title: Account Success Associate
description:
Account Success Associate

**Location:** Flexible (Remote U.S.), ideally based in Toronto, Denver, or Austin  
**Type:** Full-time | Customer Experience Team  
**Compensation:** $105,000 OTE (Base + Quarterly Bonuses)

**About Vendoroo**

Vendoroo is building the humanoid AI workforce for the built world. Our AI coworkers, or “Roos”, handle specialized operational roles like maintenance coordination, vendor communication, and resident support. They scale instantly, never churn, and execute with precision. Our customers don’t just use Vendoroo, they hire it.

We’re helping property operators replace chaos with intelligent coordination. As smart as our Roos are today, they'll always have more to learn and new opportunities to surprise and delight our customers. To maintain long-term trust and deliver ongoing value, we still need a human who can lead change, build on early successes, and act as a strategic partner to clients as their businesses grow and evolve with us.

That’s where you come in.

**The Role**

As an Account Success Associate, you’ll be the primary steward of the client relationship after onboarding and early adoption are complete. Your job: ensure every client continues to see value, deepens their knowledge and use of our Roos, and views Vendoroo as their trusted growth partner as their business evolves..

This role is a mix of project manager, product trainer, change management guide, and customer advocate. You’ll be handed the reins from our onboarding team then your goal is to maintain and expand the trust and value created during the client’s onboarding journey.

You’ll work across departments-Sales, Product, and Operations-to make sure every client utilizes best practices, maintains adoption, and understands the ROI we are delivering.

**What You’ll Own and Drive**

**Continuity of Value Post–Go-Live**  
Take over client relationships at the 90-day mark and continue to drive adoption, usage maturity, and ROI visibility well into their journey. Build upon the foundation laid during onboarding to maximize retention and long-term satisfaction.

**Client Health & Impact Measurement**  
Monitor leading indicators of client health, utilization trends, and friction points. Track and report on key metrics like NRR, feature adoption, and realized savings. Share insights regularly with clients to reinforce outcomes and identify risks early.

**Feedback & Product Advocacy**  
Serve as the client’s internal advocate. Document emerging use cases, unmet needs, and enhancement requests. Collaborate with Product and Ops to prioritize improvements that support your accounts and similar segments.

**Product Expansion & Education**  
Introduce clients to new capabilities, bundles, and workflows. Partner with Sales when it’s time to expand. Provide light-touch enablement for new features and identify training opportunities when needed.

**Strategic Account Partnering**  
Become a trusted advisor. Understand your clients’ goals, workflows, and team structure. Act as an extension of their operations team-embedding Roo more deeply into their business and driving strategic alignment.

**You Might Be a Fit If:**

* You’ve worked in a customer-facing SaaS onboarding, CX, or implementation role—ideally in a startup or high-growth environment and property management space
* You’ve worked with property operators, real estate platforms, or operationally intense industries
* You’re naturally proactive, clear in your communication, and organized under pressure
* You enjoy making customers feel smart, supported, and excited about the future
* You love to dive in and understand a product better than anyone and can turn data into action
* You understand how to actively listen and connect the dots between a real, or perceived, painpoint and product functionality.
* You get excited when a customer is facing a challenge and have a bias towards action to help them solve it. Whether it’s through product functionality or coaching them through an internal change you feel that these moments are shared wins.

**Why This Role Matters**

* You’re the ongoing connector between the customer, operations, and product. A defined point of entry of the feedback loop and a critical part of how Vendoroo maintains its competitive advantage.
* You’ll define the meaning of what "continuity of value” and “continuity of trust” really means in property operations
* You’ll help create a repeatable, scalable account support experience for the entire company
* You’ll directly influence NPS, adoption, and retention—one account at a time
* You’ll shape how property operators transition into the age of AI teammates

If you’ve read this far and are convinced in your desire to be a Roo, we want to hear from you.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $105,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Quarterly bonus

Work Location: Remote

title: Director of Marketing
description:
**Job Title:** Director of Marketing **Location:** Remote (Required: U.S.-based)

**Reports To:** CEO

**Company:**

**About Free-2-Grow**

Free-2-Grow is an AI-powered voice platform built specifically for home service businesses. We help contractors capture every call, book more jobs, and grow their revenue with a virtual voice assistant that never sleeps. Our customers include top-performing HVAC, plumbing, and electrical businesses across the country.

As we scale, we’re looking for a strategic, hands-on **Director of Marketing** to drive growth across all channels, manage key vendors and partners, and lead the brand forward.

**Role Overview**

The Director of Marketing will be responsible for leading the development and execution of Free-2-Grow’s marketing strategy. This role is ideal for a performance-minded leader who thrives at the intersection of digital marketing, strategic partnerships, brand storytelling, and event execution.

You will work directly with leadership and cross-functional teams to generate pipeline, increase brand visibility, and accelerate customer acquisition.

**Key ResponsibilitiesMarketing Strategy & Leadership**

* Own and evolve the overall marketing strategy to support company growth goals.

* Collaborate closely with sales, product, and leadership teams to align marketing with business priorities.

* Develop quarterly marketing plans with clear KPIs and ROI analysis.

**Vendor & Channel Management**

* Oversee external agencies and freelancers handling SEO, PPC, paid social, and web performance.

* Optimize digital performance through data-driven insights and experimentation.

* Ensure strong reporting, accountability, and results from all paid media and digital efforts.

**Partner Marketing & Channel Enablement**

* Manage strategic partnerships and social lead source relationships (e.g. BDR groups, trade associations, influencers).

* Develop co-marketing materials, campaigns, and partner onboarding flows.

* Track partner-generated leads and performance metrics.

**Content & Brand Ownership**

* Lead copywriting and content creation across website, email, ads, and sales materials.

* Maintain consistent brand voice and messaging across all customer touchpoints.

* Oversee development of case studies, customer testimonials, and educational content.

**Event & Trade Show Management**

* Plan, organize, and execute presence at trade shows and industry events.

* Coordinate logistics, booth design, promotional materials, and follow-up campaigns.

* Represent Free-2-Grow at events alongside sales and leadership teams.

**Qualifications**

* 6+ years of B2B marketing experience, ideally in SaaS or the home services/trades space.

* Strong understanding of performance marketing (SEO, PPC, paid social) and related metrics.

* Proven success managing external vendors and creative resources.

* Experience with partner or channel marketing programs.

* Excellent writing and editing skills—able to develop sharp, conversion-focused copy.

* Strong project management and organizational skills, including event planning.

* Comfort operating in a fast-paced, startup-like environment with a bias toward action.

* Knowledge of marketing tools like HubSpot, Webflow, Google Ads, and analytics platforms.

**Nice to Have**

* Experience marketing to small business owners, particularly in trades.

* Familiarity with CRMs, call tracking, or AI solutions.

* A network in home services trade organizations (e.g. Nexstar, BDR, EGIA).

**Compensation & Benefits**

* Competitive salary and bonus structure

* Flexible PTO and remote work culture

* Opportunity to shape the brand and marketing engine of a fast-growing AI company

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Work Location: Remote

title: Product Manager, AI Platform
description:
San Francisco, CA

Requisition ID 2025-112158

Category Project Management

Position type Regular

Pay range USD $160,000.00 - $220,000.00 / Year

Application deadline 2025-07-09

  

Your opportunity

  

At Schwab, you are empowered to make an impact on your career. Here, innovative thought meets creative problem solving, helping us “challenge the status quo” and transform the finance industry together. We believe in the importance of in-office collaboration and fully intend for the selected candidate for this role to work on site in the specified work location.  
  
The AI Incubation & Enablement (AIE) team at Schwab is where cutting-edge ideas come to life. Our mission is to develop new and novel generative AI applications that transform the way Schwab serves its clients, enhancing experiences and driving value across the organization. We don’t just solve today’s challenges, we anticipate tomorrow’s opportunities, pioneering solutions that position Schwab as a leader in financial services innovation.  
  
We are seeking a Senior Product Manager, AI to lead the development and enhancement of our artificial intelligence platform. This role involves close collaboration with engineering, research, business enablement, compliance, and cross-functional product teams.  
  
The Senior Product Manager will identify opportunities to expand the GenAI foundation at Schwab, empowering teams across Schwab to test, build, and deploy GenAI solutions. The role requires a deep knowledge of software engineering principles and architecture, an excellent and constantly updating knowledge of GenAI capabilities, and advanced analytics skills that can accommodate the stochastic nature of GenAI and the unique challenges it presents.  
  
You will drive significant strategy, planning, prioritization, and trade-off decisions. You will balance competing demands from business interests across the enterprise. You will determine how to move forward, with a bias towards action, to deliver the greatest possible advancement towards Schwab’s goals while ensuring compliance within the financial services industry.

What You’ll do

* Collaboratively define the GenAI platform vision and roadmap.
* Partner with R&D to define evaluation strategies for measuring and monitoring the quality of generative AI output.
* Participate in model validation to ensure continued performance and business value of the tool.
* Define metrics to estimate hallucination impact, output acceptance, and safety concerns.
* Communicate key metrics to both technical and non-technical stakeholders in terms of trends over time, variance, and business impact.
* Distill MVPs and iterative deliverables from long-term product visions and goals.
* Define and champion the near-term product vision, ensuring alignment with Schwab’s strategic goals.
* Oversee the product lifecycle from concept to launch, including user research, requirements gathering, and go-to-market strategy.
* Advocate for a strong user experience incorporating user feedback and analytics into product development to ensure the tool is intuitive and effective.
* Proactively identify and mitigate risks throughout the product development process.
* Build enablement and onboarding plans to champion and empower internal teams to leverage platform tools.
* Rigorously and dynamically prioritize the product roadmap, ensuring the development team is creating value with each iterative delivery.

What you have

  

Required Qualification

* BA/BS degree
* 7-10+ years of professional IT or Product development experience
* 5+ years of direct product experience
* 3+ years of experience working closely with software engineers
* 3+ years of experience with Scaled Agile Framework and delivering in an Agile environment
* 3+ years of basic statistics, probability distributions, and the fundamentals of measurement
* Demonstrable understanding of generative AI technology, architecture, and terminology including LLMs, RAG, system prompts, agentic, etc.
* Demonstrable experience using/building generative AI solutions

Preferred Qualifications:

* MBA, or Graduate degree in field related to AI
* Professional experience in engineering, data science, or related field
* Strong understanding of software design
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization
Familiarity with financial services and the regulations that* to the industry
* Strong business influence skills
* Ability to distill strategy, analytics and varied sets of input to drive decisions across stakeholder communities
* Building credibility with peers and key stakeholders (at all levels of the organization) to be able to drive action. Ability to develop multiple solutions to the same problem and identify the common failure modes associated with each
* Passion for identifying user pain points, generating ideas to relieve them, and acting swiftly to test potential solutions
* Self-starter with outstanding organizational skills, attention to detail, and desire to continually reevaluate existing products and processes
* Comfort in a dynamic and fast-moving work environment, with a positive attitude and solid work ethic
* Curiosity to continually learn and keep up to date with the latest GenAI capabilities
* A strong track record of performance

In addition to the salary range, this role is also eligible for bonus or incentive opportunities.

What’s in it for you

At Schwab, we’re committed to empowering our employees’ personal and professional success. Our purpose-driven, supportive culture, and focus on your development means you’ll get the tools you need to make a positive difference in the finance industry. Our Hybrid Work and Flexibility approach balances our ongoing commitment to workplace flexibility, serving our clients, and our strong belief in the value of being together in person on a regular basis.

We offer a competitive benefits package that takes care of the whole you – both today and in the future:

* 401(k) with company match and Employee stock purchase plan
* Paid time for vacation, volunteering, and 28-day sabbatical after every 5 years of service for eligible positions
* Paid parental leave and family building benefits
* Tuition reimbursement
* Health, dental, and vision insurance

Eligible Schwabbies receive

Medical, dental and vision benefits

401(k) and employee stock purchase plans

Tuition reimbursement to keep developing your career

Paid parental leave and adoption/family building benefits

Sabbatical leave available after five years of employment

title: Senior Staff Outbound Product Manager - Insurance Vertical
description:
Product

San Francisco

Remote

June 17, 2025

JB0060149

  

### **Company Description**

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

### **Job Description**

**Team Overview**  
The CRM Workflows business unit enables seamless sales and service operations across industries. For Insurance, we empower insurers to modernize distribution, service delivery, streamline operations, and improve policyholder and agent experiences across life, property & casualty (P&C), and specialty lines.

Our solutions include:

* Sales & Marketing (SOM & Marketing)
* Financial Service Operations (FSO)
* Field Service Management (FSM)
* Insurance-specific workflows for FNOL (First Notice of Loss), claims, underwriting support, policy servicing, and agent/broker enablement

These solutions unify siloed systems and teams across front, middle, and back offices to resolve issues faster and deliver proactive, connected service experiences to policyholders and distribution partners.

**Role Overview**  
As **Outbound Product Management – Insurance**, you will lead go-to-market efforts, evangelism, and solution alignment for ServiceNow’s Insurance products. You will connect the voice of the market to the product strategy, develop enablement content, and drive adoption across carriers, brokers, and insuretech ecosystems.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Drive thought leadership and content strategy focused on Insurance use cases, such as claims servicing, underwriting coordination, FNOL automation, and policyholder engagement.
* Understand customer needs and success metrics to:
  + Influence roadmap decisions with Inbound Product Management
  + Provide insights to ensure product-market fit across insurance segments (e.g., life, P&C, reinsurance)
* Create best-practice assets, playbooks, and industry solution briefs for Insurance customers and partners.
* Serve as the product evangelist and trusted advisor for insurance carriers, brokers, and ecosystem partners.
* Collaborate closely with:
  + Strategic partners (e.g., core platform vendors, insure techs, system integrators)
  + Product Marketing to craft messaging aligned to Insurance personas
  + Product Success and Technical Alliances for partner and customer enablement
* Lead cross-functional execution of GTM strategy and product launches specific to Insurance verticals

### **Qualifications**

**Required:**

* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI’s potential impact on the function or industry.
* 12+ years in Product Management, GTM, or equivalent leadership roles within or supporting the Insurance industry
* Deep knowledge of Insurance processes (claims, underwriting, servicing, distribution)
* Experience embedding AI into insurance workflows (e.g., claims triage, automated intake, fraud detection)
* Proven success with CRM/BPM solutions, especially with complex industry-specific data models
* Strong experience influencing and executing GTM strategy across cross-functional teams
* PaaS/SaaS experience, ideally with workflow or case management platforms
* Excellent written and verbal communication; ability to create compelling customer-facing content
* Collaborative team player with a strong executive presence

For positions in this location, we offer a base pay of $187,600 - $328,300, plus equity (when applicable), variable/incentive compensation, and benefits. Sales positions generally offer a competitive On-Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location. We also offer health plans, including flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, matching donations, a flexible time away plan, and family leave programs. Compensation is based on the geographic location in which the role is located and is subject to change based on work location.

### **Additional Information**

**Work Personas**

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

**Accommodations**

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

**Export Control Regulations**

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

title: Associate Director, HR Change Management
description:
**Who We Are**

At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.

**The Role**

The **Associate** **Director, HR Change Management** is responsible for leading and supporting change management for global HR Transformation projects and initiatives, by enabling adoption and sustainability of HR process changes, systems and programs rollouts and related organizational changes. This role reports to the Director, HR Change & Transformation and liaisons with HR leader(s), Transformation team(s), Communications and other key stakeholders, tracking milestones, raising risks and issues and reporting status. They independently take program output and design enablement plans and supporting presentation deliverables & ensure active and visible sponsorship from leaders.

**Required Skills, Experience and Circumstances:**

* Partners with senior HR leaders to delivers effective execution of change to technology processes, priorities, and initiatives.
* Drives comprehensive change management strategies, governance, and execution across all the technology and programs initiatives for HR. Transforms behaviors and embeds new ways of working.
* Builds relationships with key stakeholders
* Results oriented with a demonstrated sense of urgency and accountability to drive business value through successful changes adoption, with formal KPIs and measured results.
* Leverages disciplined project management approach to change management projects.
* Enable the organization to achieve business objectives, drive results, and enhance customer success.
* Work closely with the communications team to prepare for critical events and internal/external messaging.

**Your Future at Kyndryl**

Every position at Kyndryl offers a way forward to grow your career, from Junior Administrator to Architect. We have training and upskilling programs that you find anywhere else, including hands-on experience, learning opportunities, and the change to certify in all four major platforms. One of the benefits of Kyndryl is that we work with customers in a variety of industries, from banking to retail. Whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here.

Kyndryl currently does not require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, however, if you are hired to work at a client, customer, or partner location, you may be required to show proof of vaccination to align with their respective COVID-19 vaccination policies. Those who believe they are eligible may apply for a medical or religious accommodation prior to the start of employment.

**Who You Are**

You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.

**Required Skills, Experience and Circumstances:**

* Bachelor’s degree required or equivalent professional experience.
* Minimum of 5+ years Organizational Change Management experience incorporating the full lifecycle of change management, working on large-scale, cross-functional transformations.
* Including 5+ years of HR experience required
* Strong competence in internal communications and ability to develop clear messaging.
* Experience developing and deploying change activities globally. Tactics include, but are not limited to, stakeholder engagement, change impact assessments, communications strategies and plan, organization design and culture assessments, training and enablement, change adoption measurement, and change readiness activities.
* Project Management skills and ability to create project plans for execution.
* Experience leading and/or supporting workstreams, identifying and executing deliverables within your assigned project and supporting the overall management of project timelines.
* Excellent written and oral communication and facilitation skills; must have outstanding presentation development and delivery skills.
* Ability to influence others at all levels and move toward a common goal and definition of success by applying best practices for co-creation and leadership engagement.
* Human-centric approach to designing and executing change management strategies, with an emphasis on the user or employee experience.
* Growth minded with ability and willingness to learn and apply knowledge quickly.
* Change management skills, experience as a leader and strategic thinker, exemplifying effective communication and planning skills.
* Deep foundational understanding and experience with change management principles, methodologies, and tools.
* Ability to influence and clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences including presenting to multiple levels of an organization and executive leadership, ensuring focus in the full picture / messages vs. individual projects.
* Solid understanding of how people experience change, and how change management affects their experience.
* Ability to operate effectively across a global organization.
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple competing demands effectively.
* Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills.

**Compensation**

The compensation range for the position in the U.S. is $120,360 to $228,840 based on a full-time schedule. Your actual compensation may vary depending on your geography, job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately. The pay or salary range will not be below any applicable state, city or local minimum wage requirement.

There is a different applicable compensation range for the following work locations:

California: $132,480 to $274,560

Colorado: $120,360 to $228,840

New York City: $144,480 to $274,560

Washington: $132,480 to $251,640

Washington DC: $132,480 to $251,640

This position will be eligible for Kyndryl’s discretionary annual bonus program, based on performance and subject to the terms of Kyndryl’s applicable plans. You may also receive a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical and dental coverage, disability, retirement benefits, paid leave, and paid time off. Note: If this is a sales commission eligible role, you will be eligible to participate in a sales commission plan in lieu of the annual discretionary bonus program.

Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Know Your Rights: Workplace Discrimination is Illegal

Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision

**Being You**

Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.

**What You Can Expect**

With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.

**Get Referred!**  
If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: TALENT TEMPORARY WORKFORCE: Lead Specialist (Senior Consultant Equivalent), PPMD Excellence, Leadership Development & Succession Team
description:
This is a temporary salaried opportunity to join Deloitte Services LP for a short-term assignment.

We are currently seeking a candidate to fill our Lead Specialist role between August 2025 and January 2026 for our PPMD Talent team.

*Recruiting for this role ends on 6/13/2025.*

The PPMD Excellence Leadership Development & Succession (LD&S) Talent Team provides intentional planning, identification, development, and selection processes and programs to identify, develop, and enable cross-business, firm-wide enterprise leaders for the Deloitte US firm. The LD&S team achieves our vision through both strategic cohort development as well as enterprise-wide succession planning and mobilization. The LD&S Lead Specialist (Senior Consultant equivalent) will be responsible for supporting efforts across strategic cohorts and succession, while helping to identify synergies and efficiencies across the team.

**Work you’ll do:**

The LD&S Lead Specialist will be responsible for supporting the development, planning, and execution of innovative and strategic initiatives and projects that support broader enterprise-wide development of leaders, including succession planning and mobilization. The Specialist will work closely with a variety of distinct and cross-business leaders and teams to drive collaboration and implementation of strategic programs and approaches.

  

* Maintain utmost confidentiality and integrity of all work. The nature of the work of the LD&S team is highly confidential and cannot be disclosed to anyone outside of the team. The Lead Specialist must agree to only access information on a need-to-know basis and to not share any information with anyone outside of the team
* Tech enablement – Support HXM/SuccessFactors Succession Module MVP technology build and implementation efforts including data configuration and uploading, being a POC for testing, summarizing next steps, reviewing process guides, working with Talent Transformation on recommendations, etc.
* Support leadership development program processes, including organizing approach and curriculum, managing schedules, drafting comms and webcast content, and coordinating facilitators
* Lead data consolidation including review and maintenance of sensitive LD&S data, requiring notable skills in data analysis, pivot tables, VLOOKUP, etc.; organize data for easy retrieval, to include updating excel database real-time as insights come in, manipulating data, supporting ad-hoc requests, and identifying gaps in data to support requests– ensuring integrity and integration of various pieces of offline data specific to leaders
* Draft communications to strategic stakeholders
* Prepare storyboard for US ELT and Board level presentations
* Lead and develop USI team members through the support of cross-workstream deliverables
* Actively seek strategic links, dependencies, and commonalities, while supporting ongoing connection points, with teams to identify and implement process improvement opportunities
* Support core administrative functions of the team, including but not limited to managing coaching contracts, mailbox monitoring, communications, scheduling, and Teams maintenance

**The Ideal Candidate will possess:**

* Strong PowerPoint, logical structuring and storyboarding skills
* Excel / data management and reporting, including pivot tables
* Exceptional project management skills
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, highly visible, multi-tasking environment
* Ability to build and manage relationships in a complex, matrixed environment
* Strong communication and delivery skills
* Sound strategic-thinking skills with an ability to effectively collaborate with team members
* Ability to manage ambiguity across multiple priorities and to know when to escalate issues
* Executive stakeholder management / facilitation

**The Team:**

The LD&S team is part of the Deloitte US PPMD Excellence Team, which sets the strategy for the US Firm PPMD Talent lifecycle, covering admissions, succession, performance management, relations, and transitions. The national team collaborates with all Deloitte businesses to develop, assess, and guide the careers of our Partners, Principals and Managing Directors (PPMDs), in an objective, unbiased manner.

**Qualifications:**

Required:

* Minimum of 5 years of related experience
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
* Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Preferred:

* Experience in leadership development
* Experience using Qualtrics or other survey tools
* Program management / leadership curriculum development experience

Temporary employees are not eligible for Deloitte’s health benefits, life insurance, PTO or subsidies offered through the Health & Fitness program. They are, however, covered under Deloitte’s Business Travel Accident policy and may participate in Before-Tax Transit benefits.

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $72,900 - $134,300.

Information for applicants with a need for accommodation: https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/join-deloitte-assistance-for-disabled-applicants.html

EA\\_ExpHire

EA\\_TALENT\\_ExpHire

**Recruiting tips**  
  
From developing a stand out resume to putting your best foot forward in the interview, we want you to feel prepared and confident as you explore opportunities at Deloitte.

**Benefits**  
  
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.

**Our people and culture**  
  
Our inclusive culture empowers our people to be who they are, contribute their unique perspectives, and make a difference individually and collectively. It enables us to leverage different ideas and perspectives, and bring more creativity and innovation to help solve our clients' most complex challenges. This makes Deloitte one of the most rewarding places to work.

**Our purpose**

Deloitte’s purpose is to make an impact that matters for our people, clients, and communities. At Deloitte, purpose is synonymous with how we work every day. It defines who we are. Our purpose comes through in our work with clients that enables impact and value in their organizations, as well as through our own investments, commitments, and actions across areas that help drive positive outcomes for our communities. Learn more.

**Professional development**  
  
From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to build new skills, take on leadership opportunities and connect and grow through mentorship. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

As used in this posting, "Deloitte" means Deloitte Services LP, a subsidiary of Deloitte LLP. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Requisition code: 304919
company_description: We’re a leading professional services firm, but what makes working at Deloitte unique? When you join us, you become connected. To inspiring people. To meaningful work with fascinating clients.

title: Senior Human Resources Business Partner
description:
**What You’ll Do**

Fanatics Collectibles is seeking a strategic and experienced **Senior HR Business Partner** to serve as a trusted and high-performing advisor to senior leadership, managers, and employees in our NY office, driving alignment between people strategy and business objectives. This role partners directly with executive leaders to build & develop highly engaged and high-performing teams, foster a culture of inclusion and collaboration, and drive key people programming in support of scaling business needs.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**1. Strategic Business Partnership**

* Thought partner and execution of HR strategy, business goals, and performance outcomes.
* Influence and advise on organizational design, team structures, talent planning, and workforce development

**2. Organizational Development & Culture**

* Lead change management initiatives that support transformation and scaling across teams
* Drive culture-building efforts that promote engagement, inclusivity, and high performance.
* Use employee insights and data to shape initiatives around retention, belonging, and employee experience

**3. Talent Planning & Development**

* Collaborate with the global HR and Recruiting team on Talent Acquisition and Learning & Development to support workforce planning, succession planning, and leadership and employee growth and development.
* Identify and address operational and skill gaps to support evolving business needs.
* Coach leaders and managers to build strong, feedback-rich teams and advance internal mobility

**4. Employee Relations & Performance Enablement**

* Provide expert guidance to managers on performance management, employee development, and conflict resolution.
* Navigate complex employee relations issues with discretion, empathy, and legal alignment
* Champion clear goal setting, ongoing feedback, and structured development planning
* Foster a culture of accountability, trust, and continuous improvement.

**5. Data-Driven People Insights**

* Use people data and KPIs to surface trends, identify risks, and guide decision-making
* Communicate insights in a clear, concise way to influence executive action.

**6. Cross-Functional Leadership**

* Collaborate with cross-functional partners to implement scalable, employee-centered programs to ensure consistency and equity in employee experiences

  

**What You Bring**

**Required:**

* Bachelors Degree in HR, Business, or other relevant field
* 12+ years of progressive HR experience, with at least 5 years supporting senior leadership in a high-growth or transformation-focused environment.
* Deep knowledge of organizational design, performance enablement, talent planning, and employee engagement best practices
* Demonstrated ability to influence and partner across all levels of an organization, including executive leadership.
* Strong analytical skills with experience interpreting people data to inform decisions.
* Excellent communication, coaching, and change management capabilities.

**Preferred:**

* Familiarity with employment law, compliance practices, and employee relations in multi-state environments.
* Background in a startup, e-commerce, or consumer products company in the collectibles space.
* Passion for sports, collectibles, or fan culture (a plus, not a requirement)

  

*The salary range for this position is $188,000- $250,000, which represents base pay only and does not include short-term or long-term incentive compensation. When determining base pay, as part of a final compensation package, we consider several factors such as location, experience, qualifications, and training.*

  

*Ensure your Fanatics job offer is legitimate and don’t fall victim to fraud. Fanatics never seeks payment from job applicants. Feel free to ask your recruiter for a phone call or other type of communication for interview, and ensure your communication is coming from a Fanatics email address (including @**collectfanatics.com**). For added security, where possible, apply through our company website at* *www.fanaticsinc.com/careers**.*

title: Sr Manager, AI Business Development
description:
**Your opportunity**
--------------------

At Schwab, you’re empowered to make an impact on your career. Here, innovative thought meets creative problem solving, helping us “challenge the status quo” and transform the finance industry together.  
  
At the heart of innovation at Schwab, the AI Incubation and Enablement Team is where cutting-edge ideas come to life. Our mission is to develop new and novel AI applications that transform the way Schwab serves its clients, enhancing experiences and driving value across the organization. We don’t just solve today’s challenges—we anticipate tomorrow’s opportunities, pioneering solutions that position Schwab as a leader in financial services innovation.  
  
As Schwab’s central AI business enablement team, we bridge the gap between research, technology, and business units, ensuring that AI-powered innovation is integrated seamlessly and strategically throughout the organization. From exploring transformative AI technologies to delivering practical applications, our team is dedicated to empowering every corner of Schwab with the tools, insights, and capabilities to succeed in an increasingly AI-driven world.  
  
We are looking for an experienced and innovative Senior Manager to lead our AI Business Development function and play a pivotal role in shaping and executing Schwab’s firmwide AI strategy. Reporting to the Director of AI Business Enablement, this role serves as a critical bridge between the external AI ecosystem, and internal business and technical stakeholders, helping to embed AI into the operational DNA at Schwab. You will represent the AI Business Enablement team in key forums and working groups. The ideal candidate is both technically proficient and business-savvy, with a deep understanding of AI technologies and the broader tech ecosystem.

**What** **You’ll** **Do**

* **AI Business Development:** Engage with the AI business ecosystem, from early stage-up to enterprise, to identify emerging capabilities and communicate their potential to Schwab executives. Partner with cross-functional teams to ensure responsible and scalable AI adoption of potential solutions & integration.
* **Competitive Analysis:** Stay current on emerging AI technologies, trends, and best practices to inform Schwab’s AI roadmap. Evaluate and recommend new AI capabilities for enterprise adoption, including partnerships with startups and vendors.
* **AI Strategy & Implementation****:** Support the development and execution of GenAI-driven solutions across business units, translating business needs into AI opportunities by collaborating with stakeholders across product, operations, and technology.
* **Executive Communication**: Manage executive-level communications, including presentations, briefings, and strategic updates. Craft compelling narratives that articulate the value and impact of AI initiatives to senior leadership.

**What** **you’ll** **gain**

* Be a key driver of Schwab’s AI transformation journey.
* Opportunity to network with executives at leading external companies in the AI ecosystem
* Gain exposure to cutting-edge AI technologies and strategic business initiatives.
* Collaborate with a dynamic, forward-thinking team at the forefront of financial services innovation.
* Ability to contribute to strategic business initiatives, positioning yourself for an impactful career at Schwab
* Develop your personal brand and key relationships across the different enterprises

**What you have**
-----------------

**Required Qualifications**

* A Bachelor’s degree is required.
* 5+ years of proven experience within AI Business Development or Partnership teams, having a defined track record for engaging with the wider AI ecosystem to identify and leverage opportunities for collaboration with other AI companies.
* 5+ years developing understanding of AI technologies and trends, for informed discussions and strategic decision-making.
* 8+ years professional analytical and problem-solving, assessing market opportunities and developing strategies to capitalize on them.
* 8+ years of demonstrated senior-level communication skills and abilities to craft compelling narratives and deliver effective presentations tailored to executive audiences.
* 8+ years' experience influencing cross-functional stakeholders and championing initiatives across departments.
* 3+ years of experience enabling effective engagements with executives and key stakeholders in the AI industry.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* MBA or equivalent post-MBA level experience.
* Excellent communication skills—both written and verbal—with the ability to craft compelling narratives and deliver effective presentations tailored to executive audiences.
* Strong relationship-building and collaboration skills; a team player with experience influencing cross-functional stakeholders and championing initiatives across departments.
* Strategic mindset with the ability to identify and leverage opportunities for collaboration between Schwab and other AI companies, ensuring productive and mutually beneficial connections.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.

**What’s in it for you**
------------------------

At Schwab, we’re committed to empowering our employees’ personal and professional success. Our purpose-driven, supportive culture, and focus on your development means you’ll get the tools you need to make a positive difference in the finance industry. Our Hybrid Work and Flexibility approach balances our ongoing commitment to workplace flexibility, serving our clients, and our strong belief in the value of being together in person on a regular basis.

We offer a competitive benefits package that takes care of the whole you – both today and in the future:

* 401(k) with company match and Employee stock purchase plan
* Paid time for vacation, volunteering, and 28-day sabbatical after every 5 years of service for eligible positions
* Paid parental leave and family building benefits
* Tuition reimbursement
* Health, dental, and vision insurance

title: Director, Business Strategy (IC)
description:
**Your opportunity**
--------------------

At Schwab, you are empowered to make an impact on your career. Here, innovative thought meets creative problem solving, helping us “challenge the status quo” and transform the finance industry together.

The Business Strategy team within Schwab’s Client Service & Support organization enables leaders across the service organization to explore and set strategy, prioritize our investments, understand the perspective of our clients, and tell our strategic story along the way. As a Strategy Director (IC), you will be charged with developing, testing and delivering strategic projects and programs across a range of high-stakes strategic results for the service organization. You will work across the Retail organization alongside senior leaders and a hardworking team of strategy and industry veterans who are defining the Schwab of the future.

This is an individual contributor role that requires high levels of self-direction, intellectual discipline and business acumen. You will simultaneously work multiple, complex, cross-functional initiatives, collaborating closely with leaders and colleagues in service delivery, operations support, workforce, technology and client experience. Your work will range from strategic assessment to solution design, alignment, and execution planning – all while serving as the central driver of process, insight, and clarity.

**As a Strategy Director (IC) you are responsible for:**

* Strategy Development & Problem Structuring:
  + Break down complex operational and client-facing challenges into structured workstreams and clear hypotheses.
  + Conduct root cause analysis, develop solution frameworks, and articulate tradeoffs.
* Cross-Functional Partnership & Influence

* Partner with leaders and across service delivery, operations support, technology, digital, risk, workforce, and transformation teams.
* Build consensus around solution direction through influence, insight and data.
* Support firm wide strategic or transformational initiatives by providing well-structured, clearly communicated recommendations that are proactively socialized within the service team.
* Exercise discipline in gaining input, testing alignment, and securing support before advancing work externally or into executive forums.
* Build lasting and trust-based relationships with cross-functional partners by establishing credibility through transparency, responsiveness, and thoughtful engagement.
* Strategic Project Management

* Own the lifecycle of each strategic initiative – from discovery through socialization and execution planning.
* Create Project workplans, align timelines, and hold yourself accountable for pace, milestones, and communication.
* Analytical Mastery & Data Driven Decisioning

* Appling data fluency and advanced insight development know-how to identify, collect and command required data into clear business-relevant insights that drive strategic clarity and informed action leveraging modern tools (e.g. python, Power BI, excel).
* Rigorously apply structured problem solving (e.g. issue trees, decision matrices, A/B testing) to frame complex problems, evaluate options, and guide evidence-based recommendations that withstand leadership scrutiny.
* Insight Synthesis & Executive Communication

* Conduct structured interviews and meetings, analyze service delivery and financial data, and develop compelling recommendations in a matrix environment.
* Present findings to senior leadership with clarity, relevance and executive presence.

* Execution Planning & Handoff
  + Develop Clear implementation roadmaps, align cross functional owners, and transition work to delivery teams with minimum loss in momentum or vision.
* Strategic Enablement and Peer Development
  + Model behaviors of ownership, transparency and follow-through to build trust-based relationships within the strategy team, alignment to the principles of “See It, Own It, Solve It, Do It.”
  + Contribute to the broader strategy team by identifying and sharing reusable models, templates and analytical approaches that can be applied across initiatives.
  + Identify patterns and codify best practices that raise the strategic quality of the team’s collective work.

**What you are good at**

* Strong consulting-style capabilities: structured thinking, hypothesis-driven problem solving, and presentation development.
* Proven experience driving initiatives that cross organizational boundaries.
* Demonstrated high degree of self-motivation - can set direction, organize process, and deliver results without external management.
* Mastery of analytics, research, and attention to detail.
* Strong working knowledge of frontline functions, client experience, or service delivery metrics in a service center or large-scale customer-facing environment.
* Thrive on initiating, building, and cultivating strong authentic relationships inside and outside the group, navigates and activates alignment across organizational silos.
* Exceptional communication and influence skills – can tailor messages to senior stakeholders, peers, frontline support, and frontline team alike.
* Comfort with ambiguity and change – can drive progress in loosely defined or politically complex environments.

**What you have**
-----------------

**Requirements:**

* + 7-10 years of experience within management consulting, corporate strategy or strategic operations, or internal strategy teams within financial services or customer-service
  + Master’s degree preferred, or equivalent experience gained through structured, high-accountability roles such as management consulting, corporate strategy, or similar environments where deep coaching, feedback, and structured problem solving were core to the role.
  + Bachelor’s degree in business or quantitative field that emphasis application of the scientific method such as: Finance, Economics, Math, Statistics, Engineering.
  + Proven ability to independently lead and deliver strategic initiatives of similar complexity, scope, and ambiguity as outlined above – including data-driven problem solving, stakeholder socialization, structured execution planning, and cross-functional influence without direct authority.
  + Strong team-oriented mindset, able to focus on team-goals and both leverage and contribute to a peer-support team model
  + Demonstrated commitment to personal accountability and trust-building, consistent with the principles of *The Oz Principle*.
  + Personally, and professionally aligned with Schwab's vision and values, and a strong interest in financial services.

**What’s in it for you**
------------------------

At Schwab, we’re committed to empowering our employees’ personal and professional success. Our purpose-driven, supportive culture, and focus on your development means you’ll get the tools you need to make a positive difference in the finance industry. Our Hybrid Work and Flexibility approach balances our ongoing commitment to workplace flexibility, serving our clients, and our strong belief in the value of being together in person on a regular basis.

We offer a competitive benefits package that takes care of the whole you – both today and in the future:

* 401(k) with company match and Employee stock purchase plan
* Paid time for vacation, volunteering, and 28-day sabbatical after every 5 years of service for eligible positions
* Paid parental leave and family building benefits
* Tuition reimbursement
* Health, dental, and vision insurance

title: Marketing Technology Digital System & UX Senior Analyst
description:
**Your opportunity**
--------------------

At Schwab, you’re empowered to make an impact on your career. Here, innovative thought meets creative problem solving, helping us “challenge the status quo” and transform the finance industry together.

We believe in the importance of in-office collaboration and fully intend for the selected candidate for this role to work on site in our Austin, TX location.

The **Marketing Technology Digital System & Senior UX Analy**st is a critical role in the ever-changing landscape of digital marketing. Their purpose is to ensure actionable insights, data, performance tracking and best practices are leveraged to make strategic decisions regarding digital and technical ecosystems that enhance both customer and system user experiences, mitigate risk, drive business results and improve marketing efficiencies at scale.

In this role you will lead research and testing, analyze data and evaluate marketing technology trends and best practices to inform key decisions for improving performance across our core capabilities such as our digital design system, digital asset management and content enablement programs. These programs have direct impact on client experiences and serve multiple channels, retail, editorial and institutional marketing use cases, and internal and external partners.

This role is part of the Marketing Technology Planning and Enablement (MTPE) team, a dynamic, cross-discipline team dedicated to building and optimizing strategy and operations for the entire Schwab Marketing Technology eco-system, ensuring better client experiences and improved business results at scale, near and long term.

**What you’ll do:**

Your primary responsibility is to provide compelling and actionable data and insights to ensure informed decisions across MarTech programs and core capabilities. This includes owning strategy and implementation of research and testing, delivering data analysis, performance tracking, managing a vendor partner and identifying gaps and opportunities to improve client experiences and drive business outcomes.

Activities include:

  

* Lead our data and insights program supporting discovery efforts in alignment with marketing objectives and priorities relevant to the digital design system, digital asset management and content enablement efforts to validate problems and solutions.
* Coordinate planning and execution across teams and disciplines, including maintaining all necessary documentation, and reference materials to ensure objectives are met and insights and data will effectively inform key decisions and activities.
* Drive action and key decisions with compelling and thorough communication, reporting and presentations appropriate for various levels of audiences. This includes identifying research and testing opportunities, specifying outcomes, hypothesizing, and determining which methodology is best to gain actionable data and insights that will inform key decisions and improve quality of work to achieve business outcomes.
* Accurately track and visualize data to assess performance or other learning objectives, gathering it from tools including Adobe Analytics, various platforms, 3rd party research, best practices etc., to establish baseline metrics and targets for various studies and tests. Work in partnership with our data team and other researchers to analyze results, validate findings and ensure accuracy of key data.
* Facilitate cross-sharing and stay on top of industry trends and competitive research to ensure long term success and innovation for a competitive edge. This includes successful application of data, insights and learnings and digital marketing best practices.

The ideal candidate is a seasoned researcher and objective data analyst with a range of experience and skills across multiple marketing technology platforms, tools and core capabilities with experience in digital design systems, digital asset management and content enablement.

Key Skills: To be successful in this role you should have the following skills:

* **Proactive Initiative**: You’re a leader and subject matter expert in UX research and user testing with an existing toolkit of strategic frameworks, approaches and experience who can identify what needs to be done and do it with some autonomy.
* **Strategic Thinker**: You naturally approach a problem by using a logical, systematic, sequential approach and can clearly envision an objective and the steps needed to achieve it from a research and testing standpoint by weighing the right inputs, determining the best methodology and articulating hypotheses.
* **Communicator:** You work well within a team of marketers, technologists, creative designers and developers and ensure information is shared and documented so there are actionable insights/results and clear next steps and to help align a broad/diverse audience including stakeholders and leadership.
* **Technical Chops**: You’ve demonstrated expertise in Data and Research strategy, hypothesis creation, and data analytics. Experienced in using tools such as Adobe analytics, UserZoom, A/B and multi variant testing. Are knowledgeable in UX design with some formal training or education.
* **Creative Solutioning:** You thrive in an agile, sprint-based workflow that can be scrappy and pivot approaches in collaboration with designers and developers while anchoring in on an objective

**What you have**
-----------------

To ensure that we fulfill our promise of “challenging the status quo,” this role has specific qualifications that successful candidates should have:

**Required Qualifications:**

  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience working with marketing technology core capabilities including Digital Design Systems, Digital Asset Management Systems and Digital Marketing Content modeling among others (Email, Mobile App, Campaign Management, Marketing Automation, Personalization and Segmentation a plus)
* 4 + years of experience in research and data analytics relevant to a range of marketing technology platforms and tools.
* Extensive hands-on experience with web analytics, research and user testing, A/B testing and analytic tools such as tableau and adobe analytics or similar. (Digital content management experience a plus.)
* Experience with UX, design, research and user testing.
* Proficiency with Microsoft office, Excel, Confluence, Adobe Analytics and other standard tools.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Strong verbal communication skills an ability to build relationships with internal and external partners.

In addition to the salary range, this role is also eligible for bonus or incentive opportunities

**What’s in it for you**
------------------------

At Schwab, we’re committed to empowering our employees’ personal and professional success. Our purpose-driven, supportive culture, and focus on your development means you’ll get the tools you need to make a positive difference in the finance industry. Our Hybrid Work and Flexibility approach balances our ongoing commitment to workplace flexibility, serving our clients, and our strong belief in the value of being together in person on a regular basis.

We offer a competitive benefits package that takes care of the whole you – both today and in the future:

* 401(k) with company match and Employee stock purchase plan
* Paid time for vacation, volunteering, and 28-day sabbatical after every 5 years of service for eligible positions
* Paid parental leave and family building benefits
* Tuition reimbursement
* Health, dental, and vision insurance

title: Staff Vendor Partner Manager
description:
**Overview**
------------

We are a high-impact, fast-moving Customer Success organization on a transformational journey. With bold goals and a deep obsession for both customer and expert experiences, we operate at velocity and with purpose to deliver measurable impact at scale. We're looking for a bold, strategic, and hands-on leader to join our passionate team and help us drive large-scale change across both internal operations and external partner ecosystems.

As a Staff-level individual contributor in Vendor Partner Management, you will lead multi-million-dollar customer success partnerships and deliver complex strategic initiatives that enhance service delivery, operational efficiency, and customer satisfaction. You will be a critical bridge between internal teams and external partners, ensuring we deliver excellence and innovation across every touchpoint.

**What you'll bring**
---------------------

* 8+ years of leadership experience in Vendor Partner Management, Customer Experience, Business Operations, Program Management, or Strategic Partnerships
* Proven track record managing BPO/vendor partnerships, with a focus on performance management and relationship development across senior stakeholders
* Bachelor's degree required; MBA or advanced degree preferred
* Strong business acumen and customer-centric mindset, with the ability to balance high-level strategy and hands-on execution
* Demonstrated experience as a self-starter that can quickly and independently assess business requirements and become a trusted leader and subject matter expert
* Deep analytical skills and comfort with data; able to drive insights, make decisions, and communicate findings effectively
* Experience leading complex, multi-stakeholder initiatives across functions with measurable business impact
* Demonstrated resilience, initiative, and ability to adapt in fast-paced, evolving environments

**How you will lead**
---------------------

**Partner Management & Service Delivery**

* Lead multiple high-value external partner relationships, driving performance improvement, operational consistency, and strategic alignment.
* Build trusted, win-win relationships with senior leaders across partner organizations to co-develop goals and long-term success plans.
* Act as the voice of the partner internally, resolving escalations and clearing roadblocks that impede performance or customer experience.

**Strategic Programs & Transformation**

* Own and drive large-scale, cross-functional initiatives that impact customer support delivery, expert enablement, and operational scalability.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders across Product, Operations, Finance, and Technology to co-design and execute strategic programs.
* Take full ownership of execution details, including program setup, milestone tracking, meeting orchestration, and risk management.

**Data-Driven Insight & Impact**

* Leverage quantitative and qualitative data to assess performance, identify improvement opportunities, and build actionable strategies.
* Build dashboards and executive-level insights to communicate progress, value, and impact of initiatives and partnerships.

**Change Leadership & Innovation**

* Champion innovation by introducing novel ideas and helping others adapt to evolving priorities and solutions.
* Actively contribute to a culture of continuous improvement, bold thinking, and operational excellence.
company_description: Intuit is the global financial technology platform that powers prosperity for the people and communities we serve with TurboTax, Credit Karma, QuickBooks, and Mailchimp.
