title: Senior Manager – Technology Stack Operations (Remote in US)
description:
**Company Description**

Resultant is an outcomes-focused consulting firm committed to helping clients make technology a strategic asset and use data to guide better decisions. But we’re not just data and tech experts; we are problem solvers and industry experts who work alongside our clients to help them achieve their mission.

**We don’t solve problems** ***for*** **our clients. We solve problems** ***with*** **them.**

We take the time to deeply understand goals and roadblocks to drive toward outcomes that serve organizations, people, and communities. Through outcomes driven by data analytics, technology solutions, digital transformation, and beyond, our team works with clients in both the public and private sectors to solve their most complex challenges. We start by learning as much as we can about who they are, how they work, and what they’re striving for so we can feel their problems as our own. Partnering with our clients means their desired outcomes are always top of mind, their challenges and strengths guiding our efforts. We build client-focused relationships before we build unique solutions that blaze past expectations.

Originally founded in Indianapolis in 2008, Resultant now employs more than 450 team members who operate remotely and from offices and hubs around the United States including Indianapolis, IN; Fort Wayne, IN; Denver, CO; Atlanta, GA; and Dallas, TX.

**We’re Resultant. Clients partner with us to see a difference. People join us to make one.**

 **Job Description**

The **Senior Manager, Technology Stack Operations** is a key leadership position responsible for the performance, integration, and evolution of the toolsets that power Resultant’s Managed Services operations. This role owns the operational integrity and lifecycle of our ITSM, RMM, documentation, monitoring, and automation platforms. The ideal candidate will bring a blend of strategic thinking, process rigor, technical fluency, and a passion for continuous improvement to help drive scalable service delivery and enhanced client outcomes

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Toolset Ownership & Performance**
  + Serve as the operational owner of the MSP technology stack (e.g., ConnectWise, Rewst, Liongard, IT Glue, CloudRadial).
  + Ensure platforms are optimized, integrated, and aligned to business needs and service delivery goals.
  + Maintain high availability, performance, and usability of platforms through governance and proactive maintenance.
* **Process Optimization & Automation**
  + Partner with Service Delivery, Security, and Engineering teams to streamline workflows, reduce manual effort, and enhance technician experience.
  + Lead automation initiatives and ensure tool capabilities are fully leveraged to drive efficiency and reduce reactive effort.
* **Strategy & Roadmap**
  + Develop and manage a forward-looking roadmap for MSP tools that aligns with organizational priorities, emerging technologies, and client demands.
  + Evaluate new tools and technologies for potential inclusion in the stack; lead proof of concepts and vendor assessments.
* **Team Leadership & Development**
  + Lead and mentor a team of systems engineers and automation specialists supporting toolset administration and enhancement.
  + Foster a culture of accountability, continuous learning, and cross-functional collaboration.
* **Change Management & Enablement**
  + Lead rollout strategies for new tools and features, including documentation, training, and user adoption planning.
  + Ensure changes to the toolset are communicated clearly and executed with minimal disruption to service teams.

**What Success Looks Like**

* Smooth execution and delivery of internal projects and operational initiatives.
* Strong cross-departmental collaboration and communication within Managed Services.
* Clear, actionable roadmap for operational improvements, tool enhancements, and automation initiatives.
* Well-managed vendor relationships and cost-effective tool strategies.
* High performing, engaged Technology Stack Operations members with clear career development paths.
* Improved operational efficiency and service delivery outcomes across the business unit.

  
**Qualifications**

Some of the qualifications and skills we are expecting include the following:

* 5+ years of experience in IT operations or managed services, including 2+ years in a leadership role overseeing tools/platforms.
* Deep understanding of the MSP ecosystem, including ITSM, RMM, monitoring, documentation, and client engagement tools.
* Proven success in designing and executing tool strategies that improve service outcomes and reduce operational friction.
* Experience with automation platforms (e.g., Rewst, PowerShell scripting, API-based integrations).
* Strong analytical, organizational, and project management skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical teams.
* Prior hands-on experience administering or integrating platforms like ConnectWise, Liongard, IT Glue, and CloudRadial.
* ITIL or similar service management framework familiarity.
* Experience leading cross-functional tool transitions or upgrades in a high-growth MSP environment.
* Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship.

  
**Additional Information**

What you should know about us:

* We are humble, hungry, and smart. We solve big problems, serve lots of clients, and are entirely committed to delivering transformative outcomes.
* We are team players, deeply dedicated to the mission of the organization, and to helping everyone around us be successful.
* We compensate well, rewarding performance that delivers positive outcomes for our clients and ensuring incentives are aligned to achieve our goals.
* Our leaders work hard, serving as shining examples of what it means to live out our values. They are servant leaders, helping their teams to be successful in all possible ways.
* We have a great benefits package including self-managed PTO, 401k contribution matching, parental leave and professional development opportunities
* We pride ourselves in having the best talent in the industry and hope that you're up for the challenge!

What our team members say about us:

* "I love our true empathy and concern for our clients, it's very rare and appreciated. It is a pleasure to be a part of an organization like this."
* "I learn something new every single day, and I feel like I'm a part of building an organization that has legs. I appreciate that I'm consistently humbled by the talent and caliber of our team."
* "The culture of the company is amazing, and the climate of my team is great. The benefits that employees are offered are better than competitors, and the one-on-one presence that my team lead gives is extremely beneficial to me."

*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, sex, disability, national origin, race, religion, or veteran status.*

*Equal Opportunity Employer*

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
**Company Description**

**Our Mission**

At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.  
Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

**Who We Are**

We take our mission of protecting the digital way of life seriously. We are relentless in protecting our customers and we believe that the unique ideas of every member of our team contributes to our collective success. Our values were crowdsourced by employees and are brought to life through each of us everyday - from disruptive innovation and collaboration, to execution. From showing up for each other with integrity to creating an environment where we all feel included.

As a member of our team, you will be shaping the future of cybersecurity. We work fast, value ongoing learning, and we respect each employee as a unique individual. Knowing we all have different needs, our development and personal wellbeing programs are designed to give you choice in how you are supported. This includes our FLEXBenefits wellbeing spending account with over 1,000 eligible items selected by employees, our mental and financial health resources, and our personalized learning opportunities - just to name a few!

At Palo Alto Networks, we believe in the power of collaboration and value in-person interactions. This is why our employees generally work full time from our office with flexibility offered where needed. This setup fosters casual conversations, problem-solving, and trusted relationships. Our goal is to create an environment where we all win with precision.

 **Job Description**

**Your Career**

As a Product Marketing Manager at Palo Alto Networks, you will play a key role in shaping and executing the marketing strategy for our new Unified Management and Operations product Strata Cloud Manager for SASE with built-in ADEM (Autonomous Digital Experience Management) and AIOps capabilities. You will collaborate closely with marketing, product management, industry analysts, sales teams, customers, and technology partners to define our unique value proposition and drive messaging, content creation, thought leadership, sales enablement, and competitive analysis for these products.

In this role, you will:

* Develop narratives and materials that clearly communicate the value of our unified management solution and Digital Experience Management capabilities, translating technical features into compelling messages that resonate with customers
* Create impactful marketing content, including datasheets, whitepapers, blogs, and presentations
* Define and implement GTM strategies for new launches and campaigns in collaboration with cross-functional marketing teams
* Contribute to our vision for how the AI-powered Strata Network Security Platform is essential in securing customers' networks, both at internal and external events

**Your Impact**

* Work closely with Product Management and Product Marketing peers to build a unified market and product vision, developing value propositions and messaging that resonate with our target buyer personas and form the foundation for all product marketing activities
* Serve as the primary thought leader for the products you support, engaging in speaking opportunities and content development
* Simplify product capabilities into clear, compelling messages and tools that resonate with customers
* Create powerful marketing content, including datasheets, whitepapers, blogs, and presentations
* Educate and inspire our Sales, GTM, and field marketing teams on the customer and business value of our products

 **Qualifications**

**Your Experience**

* 2+ years in cybersecurity, with experience in network security technologies preferred
* 5+ years in technology product marketing, product management, or technical marketing
* Experience leading product launches and releases, from crafting messaging and content to tracking progress and measuring results
* This is a high visibility and collaboration role and requires excellent verbal and written communication, including experience delivering exceptional presentations
* Strong ability to collaborate with diverse stakeholders
* A creative thinker who can develop and deliver engaging presentations in various settings, from large internal teams to industry conferences and customer briefings
* Candidates who exhibit a career-long pattern of commitment to continuous learning and development

 **Additional Information**

**The Team**

Step into a marketing role at Palo Alto Networks, where your innovation drives global impact against escalating cyber threats in this era of AI. You'll seize the unique opportunity to develop cutting-edge strategies and compelling content while collaborating with industry-leading experts in the fast-paced cybersecurity landscape. Here, your creativity directly contributes to a safer digital future for everyone, fostering your growth and development in this ever-evolving market.

**Compensation Disclosure**

The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer at the posted level, the starting base salary (for non-sales roles) or base salary + commission target (for sales/commissioned roles) is expected to be between $162,000 - $210,000/YR. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here.

**Our Commitment**  
  
We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.

Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Head of Customer Success
description:
**About Fabric**

Fabric Health is a leading healthcare technology startup revolutionizing how patients access and experience care. Our innovative platform reimagines how patients connect to care—delivering personalized guidance, tailored engagement, and intuitive experiences throughout their healthcare journey. We are a passionate, mission-driven team committed to improving healthcare outcomes and expanding patient access to high-quality, personalized care.

Some of Fabric’s customers include Luminis Health, OSF HealthCare, MUSC Health, and Intermountain. Fabric is backed by Thrive Capital, GV (Google Ventures), Salesforce Ventures,Vast Ventures, BoxGroup, and Atento Capital.

**About the Role**

We are looking for a Head of Customer Success to join our growing organization. This is a pivotal leadership opportunity where you will lead a dedicated team of Client Partners. Your primary focus will be on ensuring the overall success, long-term retention, and strategic growth of our valued clients. You'll be instrumental in shaping our customer success strategies, fostering deep partnerships, and ensuring our clients derive maximum value from our Care Enablement and Telehealth solutions. This role offers the chance to significantly impact healthcare. This role offers the chance to significantly impact healthcare by transforming how patients access and experience care across the nation.

**As a Head of Customer Success, you will:**

* Lead and inspire by building, coaching, and mentoring a high-performing team of Client Partners, championing a culture centered on customer advocacy, accountability, and continuous growth.
* Create direction when there is ambiguity by diving in, head first, to problems both internal and external where clarity is lacking, asking insightful questions, thinking critically, and comfortably defining and proposing solutions and strategic direction.
* Strategize for success by developing and executing a comprehensive customer success strategy that aligns with our company objectives, with a sharp focus on driving product adoption, guaranteeing client retention, and uncovering expansion opportunities within Hospitals, Health Systems, and Payers.
* Cultivate key relationships by overseeing and actively participating in senior-level client relationships, serving as a trusted strategic advisor to key decision-makers.
* Drive value realization by deeply understanding our products and ensuring clients are effectively leveraging our platforms to achieve their critical clinical, operational, and financial goals.
* Champion onboarding excellence by guiding the client onboarding journey, ensuring a smooth transition and rapid time-to-value for new partners.
* Engage proactively and manage risk by implementing proactive client engagement models and health monitoring systems to swiftly identify and address potential risks.
* Secure renewals and fuel growth by driving exceptional renewal rates and pinpointing opportunities for upselling and cross-selling our evolving suite of solutions.
* Be the voice of the customer by creating and managing robust feedback channels, collaborating closely with Product, Sales, and Marketing to inform our product roadmap and strategic initiatives.
* Measure what matters by defining, tracking, and reporting on key customer success indicators (e.g., NPS, GRR, NRR, CLTV, adoption metrics).
* Scale and optimize by designing, refining, and implementing scalable processes, playbooks, and best practices to enhance the Customer Success team's efficiency and impact.
* Stay ahead of the curve by maintaining a comprehensive understanding of industry trends in Care Enablement, Telehealth, and the evolving landscape of US healthcare to keep our customer success strategies cutting-edge.

**Requirements for the Role**

* 8+ years in Customer Success, Account Management, or a related client-facing leadership role, ideally within a SaaS or HealthTech environment.
* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, or a related discipline.
* Demonstrated ability to successfully lead and develop customer-facing teams, whether in a formal or informal capacity.
* Proven experience working autonomously to set goals, direction, and strategy for a team, coupled with a clear sense of accountability.
* Significant experience creating and implementing new processes, tools, and strategies for a team to follow, from scratch.
* Demonstrated ability to create and implement customer success strategies that yield measurable results in retention, adoption, and revenue growth.
* Demonstrated experience identifying upsell or growth opportunities within a client base.
* Established familiarity with the US healthcare ecosystem, including the unique challenges and business drivers for Hospitals, Health Systems, and/or Payers.
* Basic familiarity with the healthcare IT space and general understanding of standard technical concepts such as HL7 data, FHIR data, etc.
* Demonstrated experience working closely with clients utilizing highly configurable software products.
* Demonstrated experience assessing customer needs and scoping software solutions for customers based on an understanding of these needs.
* Demonstrated experience working cross-functionally within a company on a day-to-day basis.
* Exceptional leadership and people management capabilities.
* Exceptional comfort and desire to work in an unstructured environment where structure and resources often must be created or sought out.
* Outstanding communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills, with comfort engaging with C-suite executives.
* A strategic and analytical thinker with a proactive, results-oriented approach.
* A natural ability to build and nurture long-term client relationships.
* Data-driven, with proficiency in CRM (e.g., Salesforce) and customer success platforms (e.g., Gainsight, ChurnZero).
* A deep commitment to customer advocacy and delivering outstanding client experiences.
* Adaptability and resilience in a fast-paced, evolving scale-up environment.
* Comprehensive understanding of Care Enablement and Telehealth solutions.

**Learn more about Fabric**

* LinkedIn
* Awards
* Press Releases
* Careers Page

*At Fabric, we believe that a diverse workforce is essential to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis ofrace, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. We actively encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.*

#LI-Remote

title: Product Trainer
description:
**Why StrataPT**

StrataPT is the only EMR & RCM platform designed to achieve a 99.99% reimbursement rate. We’re not just building software — we’re helping physical therapy practices run smarter, grow faster, and keep more of what they earn.

Our customers span the entire United States, and our team is central to how we outperform the industry. We’re relentlessly focused on delivering results, solving real problems, and making sure our customers can count on us — every single day.

**About This Role**

We’re looking to add a Product Trainer to our **mighty, high-performing team**. You’ll be hands-on in developing and delivering training programs that empower our customers and internal teams to get the most out of StrataPT’s products.

This role isn’t siloed. You’ll have a direct connection to the business, tight feedback loops with stakeholders, and a high degree of ownership.

Here’s what this looks like:

* **Design for clarity and impact.** Develop and deliver product communication and training that helps users and teams understand, adopt, and love StrataPT’s products.
* **Lead with empathy.** Tailor training approaches to different learning styles, levels of technical comfort, and roles.
* **Act as a bridge.** Connect Product, Customer Success, Support, Sales, and Marketing teams by transforming complex features into engaging, easy-to-understand content.
* **Prioritize trust and transparency.** Ensure every training builds confidence in the product and the StrataPT team.
* **Continuously improve.** Measure training effectiveness, gather feedback, and refine materials to ensure every session delivers real value.
* **Think beyond current users.** Consider how training content shapes perceptions of non-users and reinforces StrataPT’s reputation as the most helpful partner in PT billing and RCM.

We value people who think clearly, execute decisively, and take pride in results.

**Essential Responsibilities**

* Develop and maintain a comprehensive product knowledge base, including FAQs, video tutorials, and step-by-step guides.
* Collaborate closely with Product, Design, Engineering, Customer Success, Sales, and Marketing teams to ensure training content is consistent and aligned with product strategy.
* Conduct regular training workshops for customers and internal teams, supporting onboarding and ongoing learning.
* Create clear product communication and actionable training materials aligned with product releases and updates.
* Maintain high standards of accuracy and clarity in training content, ensuring materials are updated regularly and reflect current product functionality.
* Proactively identify opportunities to improve training effectiveness, taking ownership of initiatives that enhance user understanding, adoption, and satisfaction.
* Design and deliver engaging training sessions, webinars, and self-serve learning materials that make StrataPT’s products accessible to all users.

You’ll closely shadow our Director of Product, receive full training on all internal systems, and play an important part in helping StrataPT scale its operations to serve more customers nationwide.

**Skills & Qualifications**

* 2+ years of experience in product training, enablement, or customer education, preferably in a SaaS environment. We understand that some of your work may be under NDA but please share what you can.
* Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to simplify complex ideas.
* Comfortable tailoring content to different audiences — from front desk teams to clinicians and practice owners.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to gather information and ensure consistency.
* Tech-savvy with experience in Figma, Jira, Confluence, Zoom, Google Workspace, etc.
* Strong visual communication skills and an eye for creating engaging, intuitive training materials.
* Ability to manage confidential information with discretion.

**This Role Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:**

* **Humble.** Self-aware and respectful
* **Empathetic.** Goes beyond understanding another person’s perspective. Acts with compassion and respect
* **Adaptable.** We like learn-it-alls, not know-it-alls
* **Remarkable.** Remarkably resourceful. Remarkably effective
* **Transparent.** Open and honest with others and with themselves

**Our Culture at StrataPT**

These aren’t just words on a wall. These are the standards we hire against, coach around, and hold ourselves to:

* **We solve for the customer.** We don’t just want to satisfy our customers — we want to help them succeed. We aim to make them superheroes.
* **We are remarkably transparent.** We prefer to “show, don’t tell” — both internally and externally. No jargon. No spin. No rose-colored glasses.
* **We favor autonomy & accountability.** Our team is mostly remote. Work isn’t a place we go — it’s a thing we do. We trust people to own their outcomes.
* **We believe extraordinary peers make all the difference.** We recruit, reward, and release people based on these values — not tenure or title.
* **We pursue long-term impact.** We’re not afraid to take a step backward if it lets us leap forward. We play the long game.

**Compensation & Benefits**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay Range: $70,000 - $110,000, depending on experience

**StrataPT Benefits include:**

* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life & AD&D, Short- and Long-Term Disability (coverage begins on Day 1)
* Simple IRA with 3% company match (eligible after 1 year)
* Paid Time Off:
* + 14 days PTO annually
  + 6 company holidays + 1 floating holiday
* Flexible schedule, with a shared rhythm during standard business hours (Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM ET). We trust you to manage your time — and we expect everyone to stay connected, responsive, and aligned.

**Work Location**

This is a remote position for candidates located in the continental U.S. (Eastern, Central, or Mountain time zones preferred). Occasional travel may be required.

title: Lead, Product Experimentation, Media Group
description:
**Company Description**

NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies. We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

Our impact is rooted in improving the communities where our employees, customers, and audiences live and work. We have a rich tradition of giving back and ensuring our employees have the opportunity to serve their communities. We champion an inclusive culture and strive to attract and develop a talented workforce to create and deliver a wide range of content reflecting our world.

Comcast NBCUniversal has announced its intent to create a new publicly traded company ('SpinCo') comprised of most of NBCUniversal's cable television networks, including USA Network, CNBC, MSNBC, Oxygen, E!, SYFY and Golf Channel along with complementary digital assets Fandango, Rotten Tomatoes, GolfNow, GolfPass, and SportsEngine. The well-capitalized company will have significant scale as a pure-play set of assets anchored by leading news, sports and entertainment content. The spin-off is expected to be completed during 2025.

 **Job Description**

The Media Group at NBCU supports a powerhouse collection of consumer-first brands including Peacock, NBC, Bravo, NBC Sports, and NBCU International. With unequalled scale, our teams make the most out of every opportunity to collaborate and learn from one another. We’re always looking for ways to innovate faster, accelerate our growth and consistently offer the very best in consumer experience. But most of all, we’re backed by a culture of respect. We embrace authenticity and inspire people to thrive.

As an individual contributor Lead for Statistical Inference & Research, you will serve as the principal architect and subject-matter expert for the experimentation platform’s statistical engine. You’ll design, implement, and optimize advanced statistical methodologies that underpin how we measure, learn, and innovate through experimentation. Your frequent hands-on analysis of current and historical experiments will be critical to uncovering insights, reducing noise, and continually improving our approach to causal inference.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Statistical Engine Leadership**
  + Design, maintain, and implement core inference capabilities (A/B, CUPED, sequential/adaptive methods, variance reduction, diagnostics) within our experimentation platform.
  + Ensure all methodologies are robust, scalable, and production-ready.
* **Methodological Innovation & Signal Optimization**
  + Conduct frequent statistical analysis on live and historical experiment data to optimize detection of real effects, reduce variance, and enhance signal purity.
  + Research, prototype, and validate new statistical techniques, including handling zero-inflated data, covariate adjustment, multiple hypothesis correction, and causal inference.
  + Lead the design and execution of simulations, backtests, and validation studies for inference engine upgrades.
* **Data Engineering Collaboration & Implementation**
  + Build, optimize, and deploy statistical methodologies into production data pipelines and analytics workflows.
  + Work directly with data engineering teams to define requirements, data models, and ensure successful scaling and integration of new methods.
* **Data Science Enablement**
  + Mentor and guide analytics and data science teams on experimental design, statistical troubleshooting, and the use of advanced inference methods.
  + Translate complex statistical innovations into clear technical documentation, best practices, and internal training resources.
  + Advise on design and analysis of high-impact experiments across the company.
* **Technical Leadership & Roadmap**
  + Identify platform opportunities and challenges; contribute to roadmap planning and technical strategy.

  
**Qualifications**  

* 6+ years in experimentation science, applied statistics, data science, or data engineering, with significant experience in large-scale digital experimentation or analytics platforms.
* Deep expertise in statistical inference for experimentation (randomization, regression, variance reduction, sequential/adaptive methods, multiple hypothesis correction, causal inference, etc.).
* Hands-on experience implementing statistical models and methodologies in production data systems (SQL, Python, R, Spark, Databricks).
* Demonstrated ability to build and optimize data pipelines and workflows in partnership with data engineering.
* Proven skill in analyzing large and complex experimental datasets to inform and optimize inference methodologies.
* Excellent communication and documentation skills, with a track record of mentoring technical colleagues and cross-functional partners.
* Individual contributor technical leadership, ideally within experimentation, analytics, or data engineering teams.

**Desired Characteristics**

* Deep intellectual curiosity and drive to improve experimentation at scale.
* Technical rigor and a strong sense of ownership from research to production delivery.
* Collaborative, proactive, and skilled at working across engineering, data science, and analytics functions.
* Able to distill and communicate complex statistical concepts to technical audiences.
* Thrives in a high-velocity, innovative product organization.

**Additional Requirements:**

**Fully Remote:** This position has been designated as fully remote, meaning that the position is expected to contribute from a non-NBCUniversal worksite, most commonly an employee’s residence.

This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website.

*Salary range: $115,000 - $145,000 (bonus and long-term incentive eligible)*

 **Additional Information**

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

For LA County and City Residents Only: NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories, or arrest or conviction records, in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the California Fair Chance Act, where applicable.

title: Head of GTM Ecosystem and Partnerships
description:
**Job Description**

**Join the team redefining how the world experiences design**

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time-consuming, and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

**Where and how you can work**

Our flagship office is in Sydney, Australia, but we've made our way from down under to our hub in San Francisco, which is now home to our US operations. We offer flexibility in how and where you work. We trust our Canvanauts to choose the balance that empowers them and their team to achieve their goals.

**What you’d be doing in this role**

We’re seeking a seasoned leader to spearhead our Ecosystem GTM and Partnerships group. This role combines business development and developer engagement into a unified mandate: grow the value Canva delivers by integrating with the tools our users already rely on and bringing high-impact apps into the Canva experience.

You will lead a cross-functional team that includes Strategic Partner Managers, Developer Relations Engineers, and guide the work of Product Marketing Managers and Solutions Engineers. Together, you'll cultivate an ecosystem that supports key business workflows, unlocks innovation, and helps Canva grow as an AI innovator and offering for businesses.

This role is deeply collaborative and works closely with leaders across Product, Engineering, Marketing, Legal, and Sales. You will shape the evolution of the Canva developer platform—including the Apps SDK, Connect API, and other extensibility surfaces—ensuring that it meets the needs of developers, partners, and end users. While we’ve already onboarded thousands of developers and launched hundreds of apps and integrations, we’re still in the early days of our platform growth and adoption. This is a unique opportunity to influence foundational architecture and go-to-market strategy at scale.

**At the moment, this role is focused on:**

* **Shape Strategic Direction:** Define and execute a high-impact partnership roadmap aligned with Canva’s broader goal to become the most pluggable design platform and a central part of daily user workflows.
* **Build & Lead a Cross-Functional Team:** Scale a highly aligned organization across partnerships, developer relations, and partner success to deliver seamless end-to-end partner experiences. You’ll foster a culture of collaboration, clear goal-setting, and ongoing mentorship.
* **Build Partner Enablement Infrastructure:** Develop scalable onboarding, documentation, and support programs to ensure developer and partner success from integration through adoption.
* **Drive Partner and Developer Growth:** Prioritize, secure, and grow high-value strategic partnerships and developer collaborations that expand Canva’s use cases across verticals like marketing, sales, and real estate.
* **Negotiate High-Impact Deals:** Lead and close strategic partnerships that deliver strong commercial value and ecosystem alignment, fueling platform adoption and business growth.
* **Enable External Innovation:** Champion and support the external developer community through enablement, awareness, and monetization strategies. You’ll scale developer outreach efforts—including events and content—and ensure their contributions align with Canva’s ecosystem goals.
* **Integrate Advanced Technologies:** Work closely with internal AI, data, and product teams to help partners build differentiated integrations that leverage Canva’s evolving capabilities in automation and intelligent design.
* **Partner on Joint GTM Success:** Collaborate with key partners on co-marketing, sales enablement, and pipeline generation strategies that amplify Canva’s reach and business impact across customer segments.
* **Optimize Ecosystem Impact:** Own key partner performance metrics, including integration adoption, active user growth, partner-driven revenue, and developer retention, to ensure scalable and sustainable impact.
* **Scale Developer Marketing:** Partner with product marketing and comms to elevate the visibility of Canva’s platform through storytelling, campaigns, and thought leadership across technical and business communities.
* **Collaborate Across Canva:** Partner with Ecosystem Product, Legal, Marketing, and Sales to scale ecosystem operations and position Canva for long-term growth across multiple surfaces. You will also be responsible for moving critical relationships forward, driving next steps. Your ability to influence cross-functional teams will be essential.

**You're probably a match if you are:**

* Ecosystem Strategist & Growth Leader: You’ve led platform ecosystems or developer programs with proven success in driving user engagement, enterprise adoption, and scalable business growth.
* Business Development Expert: A wealth of experience in partnerships or platform strategy with a track record of managing complex deals, market expansion initiatives, and long-term partner success.
* Technically Fluent: Strong grasp of APIs, developer tooling, and integration architecture—able to translate technical concepts into strategic opportunities.
* People-Centered Leader: Experienced in building, scaling, and inspiring cross-functional teams across business development, technical engagement, and partner support. Adept at mentoring, setting KPIs, and nurturing high-performance cultures.
* Developer Ecosystem Champion: Demonstrated success in engaging third-party developers, facilitating events and hackathons, and building thriving communities that deliver business value.
* Strategic Communicator & Network Builder: Exceptional negotiation and collaboration skills, with a broad and deep network in the tech, cloud, and SI ecosystems—and the ability to execute tactically while keeping long-term vision in sight.

**About the team:**

The Ecosystem Partner Development and Success team is at the heart of Canva’s mission to empower the world to design. As part of the Ecosystem Group, this team oversees the lifecycle of partnerships and developer relationships that bring external innovation into Canva and embed Canva into the tools and workflows our users rely on.

Our goal is to foster a thriving developer community and partner network that extends Canva’s capabilities across industries, enabling rich design experiences for individuals and enterprises alike.

 **Additional Information**

**What's in it for you?**

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity, and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a taste of what's on offer:

* Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
* Health benefits plan to support you and your well-being
* 401(k) retirement plan with company contribution
* Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
* An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
* Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge, and support you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

At Canva, we value fairness, and we strive to provide competitive, market-informed compensation whilst ensuring internal equity within the team in each region. We make hiring decisions based on your skills, experience, and our overall assessment of what we observed and learned in the hiring process. The salary range for this position is $244,000 to $373,000. When calculating offers, we make salary decisions based on market data and candidates' skills and experience.

**Other stuff to know**

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills, and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva, so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

#LI-JP1
company_description: Canva is changing the way the world designs.

title: Global Head of Sales Operations
description:
**Job Description**

**Join the team redefining how the world experiences design**

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time-consuming, and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

**Where and how you can work**

Our flagship office is in Sydney, Australia, but we've made our way from down under to our hubs in San Francisco and Austin, which are now home to our US operations. We offer flexibility in how and where you work. We trust our Canvanauts to choose the balance that empowers them and their team to achieve their goals.

**What you’d be doing in this role**

We’re investing in the next phase of our Sales Operations function to unlock smarter, faster, and more AI-augmented go-to-market execution. We're looking for a Sales Operations leader to own our global sales operations team and business partner model with Sales, Customer Success, Finance, and Partnerships teams.

This is a high-impact leadership role where you’ll shape how we manage sales territories, bookings, forecasting, policies, systems, and the operational stack that powers our field teams. You’ll help bridge the gap between self-serve and enterprise sales motions, operationalizing our evolving PLG strategy, and supporting Canva’s revenue growth at scale.

**At the moment, this role is focused on:**

* Leading and evolving the global Sales Operations function, overseeing strategy, systems, and scalable processes across the full GTM motion.
* Owning core revenue operations processes, including CRM enrichment and hygiene, territory design, lead routing, pipeline and forecast management, and sales performance measurement.
* Building and driving forecasting accuracy and cadence in partnership with Sales leadership and Finance, enabling clear visibility into performance and planning.
* Driving Bookings Policy design and Deal Desk alignment, ensuring governance, compliance, and efficiency while enabling high-velocity deal flow.
* Establishing and maintaining Rules of Engagement and Sales Policy frameworks that support fair, efficient, and productive selling across regions and segments.
* Partnering deeply with Sales, Customer Success, and Partnerships leaders through a Field Operations business partner model, supporting regional nuances and go-to-market priorities.
* Operationalizing product-led sales signals, ensuring sellers have the right data, context, and triggers to act on user intent and product usage insights.
* Collaborating cross-functionally with Sales Systems, Growth, Finance, Legal, and Enablement to ensure strong alignment, process excellence, and data-driven decision-making across the revenue engine.
* Hiring, developing, and scaling a high-performing team of revenue operations analysts and leads, fostering a culture of excellence, innovation, and continuous improvement.

**You're probably a match if you have:**

* A wealth of experience in Sales, Revenue, or Business Operations at a fast-scaling SaaS company in a senior leadership role.
* Led and scaled global Sales Ops teams and know how to balance strategic leadership with operational execution.
* Deep expertise across the sales operations stack, including forecasting, territory and quota planning, deal desk, pipeline management, lead routing, and CRM governance.
* A track record of building and running accurate, scalable forecasting processes in collaboration with Sales and Finance stakeholders.
* You're a strong business partner who can influence and collaborate across Sales, CS, Partnerships, Finance, Product, and Marketing orgs.
* Experience or strong interest in supporting Product-Led Growth (PLG) motions, and understanding how to bridge product signals and sales workflows.
* A strong understanding of Customer Success and Partnership Operations, and how those teams intersect with sales growth.
* You’re excited by the future of AI in Sales Ops and are already hands-on with AI-native tools (we use Clay and Pocus) or similar platforms.
* You’re highly analytical and systems-minded, but also have the EQ and communication skills to influence at the executive level.
* You're energized by building—you love to scale smart, reduce friction, and empower others to do their best work.

**About the team:**

This role sits within the GTM Operations organization at Canva. GTM Operations brings together Strategy & Programs, Systems, Enablement, and Field Operations to power Canva’s global Sales, Customer Success, and Partnerships teams. Together, we enable Canva’s hybrid go-to-market motion — blending product-led growth with high-touch sales — to empower the world to design, while scaling efficiently and intelligently.

 **Additional Information**

**What's in it for you?**

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity, and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a taste of what's on offer:

* Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
* Health benefits plan to support you and your well-being
* 401(k) retirement plan with company contribution
* Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
* An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
* Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge, and support you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

At Canva, we value fairness, and we strive to provide competitive, market-informed compensation whilst ensuring internal equity within the team in each region. We make hiring decisions based on your skills, experience, and our overall assessment of what we observed and learned in the hiring process. The salary range for this position is $228,000 to $348,000. When calculating offers, we make salary decisions based on market data and candidates' skills and experience.

**Other stuff to know**

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills, and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva, so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

title: Regional Sales Leader
description:
We are currently seeking a highly motivated Regional Sales Leader who will be responsible for driving the company’s growth and expanding its footprint within a defined geographical territory (Bozeman and Billings). for This role involves identifying new business opportunities, establishing strong client relationships, and developing strategic initiatives to achieve and exceed sales and revenue objectives. The RSL will lead a team of Business Development Representatives (BDRs) in the territory, ensuring performance excellence through leadership, management, and accountability. Success in this role requires strong leadership skills, strategic thinking, and collaboration with internal teams to deliver innovative, customer-focused solutions.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:** *To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*

**Strategic Planning and Execution:**

* Develop and implement comprehensive business strategies designed to achieve measurable revenue targets, increase market share, and drive growth across the assigned region.
* Set regional sales and revenue goals, establish actionable plans, and track performance to ensure targets are exceeded.
* Continuously analyze market trends, customer behavior, and data to identify growth opportunities and adjust strategies accordingly.
* Proactively seek and secure opportunities in both existing and emerging markets to enhance regional profitability and competitiveness.

**Leadership and Team Development:**

* Provide leadership and oversight of BDRs within the region, ensuring alignment with company goals while setting and enforcing individual and team performance targets.
* Act as a mentor and coach for BDRs, enhancing their skills and fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation.
* Drive accountability by providing actionable feedback on performance, customer engagement, and sales outcomes, and developing corrective measures to achieve positive results.

**Customer and Relationship Management:**

* Build and sustain strong relationships with key customers, partners, and stakeholders to establish trust and drive long-term satisfaction.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for high-value accounts, supporting strategic negotiations and closing key deals.
* Work collaboratively to evaluate potential clients, understand their needs, and deliver tailored solutions to meet business objectives.

**Business Development and Lead Management**:

* Support BDRs in nurturing leads, identifying cross-selling opportunities, and driving deal closures.
* Partner with vendors and industry leaders to maximize opportunities within the territory and ensure customer success with product implementation.
* Represent the company at customer meetings, industry events, and trade shows, building strategic partnerships and expanding professional networks.

**Financial and Performance Oversight:**

* Monitor and report on key regional sales metrics, ensuring alignment with targets and profitability benchmarks. Provide data-driven insights and actionable recommendations to adjust sales strategies that directly impact profitability and market share growth.
* Manage the regional sales budget, making data-driven recommendations to optimize costs and improve efficiency.
* Identify areas for operational process improvements to enhance sales efficiency and regional profitability.
* Prepare and deliver regular reports and updates to the executive leadership team, providing insights into regional activities and progress towards goals.
* Provide feedback to internal teams about customer preferences and market trends to optimize company strategies.

**Cross-Functional Collaboration:**

* Assist in the development of sales enablement tools and training programs to empower BDRs and improve sales cycles.
* Collaborate with cross-functional internal teams, including sales, marketing, purchasing, operations, and accounting, to align strategies and ensure seamless execution of objectives.
* Share market feedback on customer preferences to inform internal decision-making and improve offerings.

**Required Skills and Abilities:**

* Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to build and maintain productive relationships with teammates, customers, and vendors.
* Strong problem-solving, analytical, and negotiation skills to address challenges effectively.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills for interaction with customers, team members, and leadership.
* Self-motivated, results-oriented, and dependable with a strong work ethic.
* Flexible and adaptable to changing priorities, business needs, and market dynamics.
* Proficient in CRM tools and Microsoft Office Suite, with the ability to learn and implement new software to support business objectives.

**Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, sales or a related field.
* Minimum of 5+ years of progressive experience in construction-related sales, business development, or account management, with a strong focus on construction materials or related industries.
* Proven track record of successful lead generation, customer engagement, and revenue growth.
* Experience leading a region or sales territory is highly preferred.

**Travel Requirements:**

* This position requires the ability to travel up to 50% of the time. Travel locations include company offices, job sites, industry events, and training venues.
* The frequency and duration of travel will depend on business needs, with trips ranging from several times a month to weekly.
* Travel will primarily be by car, with occasional flights for longer distances.

**Benefits and Compensation:**

This role will be based out of our Billings, Montana location but will also support our Bozeman branch and have a defined geographical territory. The pay is dependent on job-related knowledge, skills and experience. The position is eligible for annual bonus and profit sharing based on company performance in addition to other benefits that support the total well-being of you and your family. Benefits include:

* Comprehensive Insurance Coverage, Medical, Dental, Vision, and more
* Wellness Program
* 401K with employer match
* Discounted company stock (Employee Stock Purchase Plan)
* Profit Sharing
* Paid Time Off
* Growth opportunities through company sponsored leadership development courses and trainings

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: In person

title: Product Marketer
description:
**Product Marketer (In-Person, Addison, TX)**

**Visual One Intelligence** | Addison, TX

**About Us:**  
At Visual One Intelligence (www.visualoneintelligence.com), we're not just processing data; we're unlocking actionable insights that empower businesses to see their world with unprecedented clarity. If you're a dynamic and experienced Product Marketer eager to define and amplify the story of a cutting-edge intelligence platform, and thrive in a collaborative, in-person environment, your opportunity awaits in Addison, Texas!

As our Product Marketer, you will be the champion of our product's value, crafting compelling messaging and strategies that drive market adoption and fuel our growth. This is a pivotal role where your expertise in translating complex technology into impactful narratives will directly influence our success.

**What You’ll Do:**

**Messaging & Strategy**

* Develop clear, differentiated messaging that showcases our unique value in B2B SaaS.
* Refine buyer personas and segmentation to enhance marketing efforts.
* Develop demand generation campaigns that drive adoption and awareness.
* Create content (blogs, case studies, social media) to strengthen brand presence.
* Monitor and optimize campaign performance, delivering actionable insights.

**Go-to-Market & Launch**

* Lead market research to guide product positioning and go to market strategies.
* Partner with Partners and In-House Sales teams to successfully launch new products.

**Sales Enablement**

* Create impactful sales materials (pitch decks, FAQs, objection handling) to empower the sales team.
* Collaborate with Sales Enablement on training and support.

**Digital Marketing & Analytics**

* Conduct website analytics reviews and optimize user engagement (Google Analytics, Microsoft Clarity).
* Manage automated email campaigns and A/B test landing pages.
* Partner with our agency on PPC campaigns and optimize creatives.

**Customer Advocacy & PR**

* Cultivate customer success stories and manage case studies for promotional use.
* Coordinate industry award submissions and press releases.

**What You’ll Bring:**

* 2+ years of experience in B2B SaaS or AI product marketing.
* Strong ability to translate technical concepts into clear, persuasive messaging.
* Proven success with product launches and go-to-market strategies.
* Proficiency with marketing tools like HubSpot, Google Analytics, SEMrush, and Microsoft Clarity.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate across teams.
* A data-driven approach to marketing decisions with a focus on performance metrics.
* Strong project management skills and a results-oriented mindset.

**Why Visual One Intelligence?**  
Join our dynamic team in **Addison, TX** and help shape the future of AI-powered insights. You'll play a critical role in a fast-growing company at the intersection of technology and business.

**To Apply:**  
Ready to help us tell our story? Apply now to be part of our innovative team! (This is a full-time, in-person role in Addison, TX.)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,197.89 - $72,496.38 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
**Join Us in the Uncompromising Pursuit of Human Performance Recovery**

Nice Recovery Systems is redefining how people recover, perform, and thrive. Our advanced cold+compression and palm cooling technologies are trusted by top orthopedic practices, elite athletes, and performance-focused individuals across the U.S. and internationally.

We're hiring a **Marketing Specialist** to execute digital and traditional marketing campaigns across our core product categories - Recovery and Performance. This is a hands-on role ideal for someone early in their career who wants to gain experience, take ownership, and grow quickly in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment.

This is a full-time, on-site position based in Boulder, Colorado.

**Key Responsibilities**

**1. Digital Marketing Execution**

* Manage paid media campaigns across Google Ads, Meta, YouTube, and programmatic platforms.
* Manage email workflows HubSpot CRM and Marketing Automation.
* Social Media management including, execution of social media calendar, scheduling and post content across platforms: Website, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok, and YouTubeShorts.
* Analyze campaign performance using GA4, HubSpot dashboards, and UTM tracking.
* Support SEO with keyword research, on-page optimization, and blog content creation and formatting.

**2. E-commerce & DTC Go-To-Market Support**

* Support launching new products and marketing campaigns to our direct-to-consumer performance line.
* Maintain product detail pages, imagery, and descriptions across website.
* Update on page website content.
* Coordinate pre-sale, launch, and post-launch campaign assets including landing pages and paid ads.
* Support the execution of E-commerce promotions and seasonal campaigns.
* Track site traffic, conversion rates, and product page performance to identify optimization opportunities.

**3. Lead Generation & Funnel Marketing**

* Support execution of lead gen campaigns for our medical recovery products, targeting providers and patients.
* Build and optimize landing pages, gated content, and email drip sequences focused on lead capture and nurturing.
* Collaborate with Sales and Customer Success to ensure effective follow-up and qualification processes.
* Analyze lead conversion metrics and support campaign testing to improve performance.

**4. Influencer & Affiliate Program Execution**

* Coordinate product seeding, onboarding and campaign briefs for influencers and content partners.
* Manage affiliate program operations via tools like Snowball, Avantlink, or similar platforms
* Track and report on affiliate performance, UGC content usage, and ROI metrics.
* Assist in curating and distribution social-ready content from influencers and partners.

**5. Content Creation & Communication**

* Write compelling copy for emails, landing pages, blog articles, product spotlights, and case studies
* Support production of photo, video, and testimonial content in collaboration with creators and vendors
* Format and proof content to ensure consistency across tone, visuals, and brand standards
* Create social media posts, schedule content, and engage with audience responses

**6. Traditional, Event, and Experiential Marketing**

* Support trade show logistics, booth materials, and lead capture strategies
* Assist in the planning and execution of athlete and provider events or activations
* Support sponsorship efforts with marketing assets, timelines, and reporting
* Track performance and impact of physical events and field marketing efforts

**7. Sales Enablement & Brand Consistency**

* Develop one-sheets, toolkits, and pitch decks for internal sales teams and external partners
* Support education and training materials for providers, coaches, and retailers
* Maintain brand consistency across all channels and ensure cohesive messaging and visual identity
* Ensure all collateral aligns with NICE Recovery Systems’ voice and positioning

**8. Project and Campaign Management**

* Manage timelines and deliverables for cross-functional marketing initiatives
* Coordinate with vendors for design, print, digital, or media production needs
* Track budgets for paid campaigns, events, samples, and influencer partnerships
* Maintain organized archives of brand assets, content, and campaign documentation

**Skills & Qualifications**

**Required**

* 1–3 years of experience in marketing, digital advertising, e-commerce, or related roles (internships count!)
* Proficient in Google Ads, Meta Ads, GA4, HubSpot, and social publishing tools
* Strong writing and proofreading skills for various content formats
* Familiar with lead generation strategies and sales funnel tactics
* Excellent time management, organization, and project execution skills
* Enthusiastic team player with a proactive, problem-solving mindset
* Skilled in Microsoft Office Suite

**Preferred**

* Experience with Shopify, Adobe Creative Suite, or basic HTML/CSS
* Familiarity with influencer marketing platforms and affiliate program tools (e.g., Snowball)
* Passion or background in sports, physical therapy, fitness, or performance optimization
* Comfortable learning new tools including AI assistants (ChatGPT, Gemini, etc.)

**Education & Certifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in **Marketing, Communications, Business**, or a related field preferred
* Certifications from Google, HubSpot, or other platforms are a plus

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $57,569.00 - $73,825.00 per year

Benefits:

* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Parental leave
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Manager, Revenue Acceleration - Public Sector
description:
**Company Description**

**Our Mission**

At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.  
Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

**Who We Are**

We take our mission of protecting the digital way of life seriously. We are relentless in protecting our customers and we believe that the unique ideas of every member of our team contributes to our collective success. Our values were crowdsourced by employees and are brought to life through each of us everyday - from disruptive innovation and collaboration, to execution. From showing up for each other with integrity to creating an environment where we all feel included.

As a member of our team, you will be shaping the future of cybersecurity. We work fast, value ongoing learning, and we respect each employee as a unique individual. Knowing we all have different needs, our development and personal wellbeing programs are designed to give you choice in how you are supported. This includes our FLEXBenefits wellbeing spending account with over 1,000 eligible items selected by employees, our mental and financial health resources, and our personalized learning opportunities - just to name a few!

At Palo Alto Networks, we believe in the power of collaboration and value in-person interactions. This is why our employees generally work full time from our office with flexibility offered where needed. This setup fosters casual conversations, problem-solving, and trusted relationships. Our goal is to create an environment where we all win with precision.

 **Job Description**

**Your Career**

The Public Sector Revenue Acceleration Manager will drive revenue growth across US State & Local Government, US Education, and US Federal verticals. This role collaborates closely with cross-functional teams, including Field Sales, Partner Teams, GTM, and Product Management. Key responsibilities, in partnership with sales leadership, include working directly with core sellers and front-line sales managers to support territory planning, account planning, account strategy reviews (ASRs), close plans, deal reviews, and other sales acceleration activities, along with facilitating deliverables and coaching teams. In addition, this role will be responsible for new GTM initiatives based on new companywide and area wide priorities.

**Your Impact**

* Revenue Acceleration and Sales Optimization: Partner with Public Sector sales leadership to optimize processes, directly supporting sellers and managers to streamline planning (territory/account, ASRs, close plans, deal reviews) for increased revenue, higher win rates, and faster deal cycles.
* Best Practice Deployment: Lead the formal implementation and optimization of consistent sales methodologies (e.g., MEDDIC) and cadences to ensure predictable success and timely execution.
* Cross-functional & Ecosystem Alignment: Cultivate strong partnerships across all Go-to-Market functions (Operations & Strategy, Enablement, Marketing, Industry, Business Value, Cloud, Services, SAs, Partner Channel, Solution Consulting) for integrated activities and unified revenue acceleration.
* Strategic Growth Initiatives: Drive revenue acceleration efforts specifically aligned with expanding Next Generation Security offerings.
* Relationship Management: Maintain robust relationships with executive and functional leaders across various departments (Marketing, Channels, Operations, Product, L&E) for continuous strategic support.
* AI-Driven Productivity: Integrate AI tools (Gemini, NotebookLM) into GTM and field sales activities to dramatically boost efficiency and minimize administrative tasks for the sales team.

 **Qualifications**

**Your Experience**

* Experience: 8+ years of sales enablement experience in cybersecurity or related technologies, including at least 3 years focused on the Public Sector. Field sales and pre-sales engineering experience is a strong plus. A bachelors degree is required, and a graduate degree is a strong plus.
* Sales Acumen: Proven ability to drive measurable increases in field sales revenue, boost sales efficiency, and optimize sales velocity.
* Methodology Expertise: Demonstrated experience in deploying and optimizing sales best practices and methodologies (e.g., MEDDIC) and strong CRM expertise (e.g., Salesforce).
* Collaboration & Influence: Strong track record of cultivating and leveraging cross-functional and ecosystem partnerships for integrated Go-to-Market strategies and revenue acceleration.
* Strategic Alignment: Ability to align revenue acceleration efforts with key business objectives, particularly related to emerging technologies like Next Generation Security.
* Leadership & Relationships: Skilled in maintaining robust strategic partnerships with executive and functional leaders.
* Technical Aptitude/AI: Experience with or strong aptitude for integrating AI tools into sales processes to enhance productivity.
* Exceptional Communication & Productivity Suite Proficiency: Proven ability to effectively present and facilitate meetings with diverse audiences, coupled with advanced proficiency in productivity suites such Google Workspace (Slides, Sheets, Docs).

  
**Additional Information**

**The Team**

Our Public Sector Field Sales Organization is the connection between our clients’ cybersecurity needs and Palo Alto Networks’ set of solutions. Comprising account managers, systems engineers and sales specialists, our team is committed to client satisfaction and the continued growth of our business. Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.

As part of our Public Sector GTM team under the Public Sector Field Sales Organization, and you are empowered in partnership with sales leaders and cross-functional teams to drive revenue acceleration. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to sales enablement to meet the needs of the sales organization, partners, and customers. As a member of our GTM team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with team members to resolve incredibly complex cyberthreats.

**Compensation Disclosure**

The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer at the posted level, the starting base salary (for non-sales roles) or base salary + commission target (for sales/commissioned roles) is expected to be between $158000 - $255000/YR. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here.

**Our Commitment**  
  
We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.

Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

**Is role eligible for Immigration Sponsorship? No.** **Please note that we will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.**
company_description: Your career will have a global impact: one that protects our way of life in the digital age by preventing successful cyberattacks.

title: Worldwide Commercial Marketer, Advertiser Education
description:
At Apple, we focus deeply on our customers’ experience. Apple Ads brings this same approach to advertising, helping people find exactly what they’re looking for and helping advertisers grow their businesses. Our technology powers ads and sponsorships across Apple Services, including the App Store, Apple News, and MLS Season Pass. Everything we do is designed for trust, connection, and impact: We respect user privacy, integrate advertising thoughtfully into the experience, and deliver value for advertisers of all sizes-from small app developers to big, global brands. Because when advertising is done right, it benefits everyone.  
  
**Description**  
  
Do you love to create and market engaging ways for people to learn about an online product or service? We're looking for an experienced B2B marketer to oversee advertiser education for Apple Ads. You'll serve a critical role on our Worldwide Commercial Marketing team. We focus on generating more demand for Apple Search Ads, and enhancing how new customers get started when they create app promotion campaigns. You'll oversee Apple Search Ads Certification - our online course that inspires people to take their app marketing skills to a new level. You'll be responsible to launch new ways to make the experience even more impactful. You'll also lead transformative work to evolve Certification and make it a community where people can connect and refresh their skills over time. Beyond Certification, you'll partner with other marketers to educate customers through other marketing programs and sales channels. - Lead and continually optimize all facets of our advertiser education initiatives in partnership with other marketers, writers, designers, and engineers. - Collaborate across teams, inside and outside of Apple, to champion new ways to improve how our customers learn about best practices. - Enhance the quality of our educational efforts by sharing user engagement findings, along with recommendations. - Ensure consistency in our tone and approach across all education marketing deliverables - which include online lessons, email communications, and sales enablement materials. - Proactively explore the competitive landscape to determine if there’s learning to share, and if we should build into our own initiatives. If this sounds like you, and you want to be part of a marketing team focused on growing Apple’s advertising business, we’d love to hear from you!  
  
**Minimum Qualifications**  

* 10+ years as a B2B marketer in the tech or digital advertising industry
* Experience leading the strategic development and marketing of an educational program
* Significant experience delivering educational content across numerous marketing communication channels

  
**Preferred Qualifications**  

* Extraordinary written and verbal communication that’s thoughtful and encourages deeper collaboration
* Excellent organizational, multi-tasking, and project management abilities
* Track record of building strong working relationships with learning providers, technical teams, and creative teams or agencies
* Savvy at tackling issues, providing creative solutions, and quickly adapting to changing priorities and needs
* Consistent track record of being an effective cross-functional collaborator
* Embraces data and insights to inform decision making
* Possess unquestionable personal code of ethics and integrity

  
Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We seek to promote equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant .  
  
Submit Resume
