title: Director, Media Sales - Beauty
description:
**Be part of an amazing story.**

Macy’s is more than just a store. We’re a story. One that’s captured the hearts and minds of America for more than 160 years. A story about innovations and traditions…about inspiring stores and irresistible products…about the excitement of the Macy’s 4th of July Fireworks, and the wonder of the Thanksgiving Day Parade. We’ve been part of memorable moments and milestones for countless customers and colleagues. Those stories are part of what makes this such a special place to work.

**Job Overview**

The Director, Media Sales & Enablement leads a team of 5-7 Sales Specialists and Sales Leads across Apparel, Center Core, and Home categories. They lead the development of market-leading media strategies and innovative solutions that meet client needs and drive revenue growth. The Director promotes Macy’s Media Network (MMN) offerings to new and existing clients and invests in developing the sales team's skills.

The Director expands MMN’s client base by identifying and establishing relationships with new prospective clients. With existing clients, they find opportunities to unlock incremental spend in Apparel, Center Core, Home, and other categories. The Director networks and builds relationships with key decision-makers in shopper marketing and national brand budgets.

The Director is a strategic thought leader for MMN’s client portfolio, supporting Sales Leads and Specialists in strategy discussions with clients and empowering team members to manage individual campaigns.

They develop a strategic plan to enhance sales enablement capabilities across the team and create training modules on advertising product fundamentals (e.g., sponsored products, offsite and onsite video, social media activation). The Director also formalizes and maintains a comprehensive sales onboarding program for new colleagues.

The Director fosters a collaborative environment within the Sales team and with internal and external partners. They work closely with the Head of Sales, Sales Analytics, and Finance to develop competitive sales pipeline management methods using tools like CRM systems and data visualization dashboards. Ultimately, the Director cultivates a performance-driven sales culture to drive business growth.

**What You Will Do**

* Lead a team of 5-7 Sales Leads and Specialists dedicated to serving clients across Apparel, Center Core, and Home categories.
* Maintain strong relationships with merchandising and digital partners to drive integrated offerings across the business.
* Provide coaching and development to the sales team, focusing on both selling skills and proficiency in backend processes and CRM tools.
* Drive the sales cycle for Macy’s Media Network by establishing a robust pipeline of demand for Macy’s advertising solutions.
* Collaborate with the Head of Sales to set individual sales goals for the team.
* Prioritize and lead new client acquisition and outreach efforts in under-penetrated or untapped categories.
* Guide the Sales team on effective collaboration with other functions within MMN and across the enterprise to achieve positive client and business outcomes.
* Work closely with Sales Analytics to enhance data visualization, facilitating better understanding and communication of trends and benchmarks from campaigns to inform future actions and recommendations.
* Listen actively to advertiser needs and provide feedback to the product development team for continuous innovation and optimization of MMN’s channel offering and capabilities.
* Develop and maintain a suite of sales enablement tools, including training modules, onboarding materials, etc.
* Foster an environment of acceptance and respect that strengthens relationships, and ensures authentic connections with colleagues, customers, and communities

**Skills You Will Need**

**Leadership:** Demonstrated ability to lead, coach, manage, and motivate high-performing Sales teams effectively.

**Strategic Thinking:** Proven track record as a strategic thought leader, capable of developing and executing market-leading media strategies that drive revenue growth.

**Relationship Building:** Strong networking skills and the ability to establish and maintain relationships with key decision-makers to expand the client base and increase spending.

**Collaboration:** Highly collaborative mindset with the capacity to work effectively with internal and external partners to drive positive client and business outcomes.

**Communication and Presentation:** Excellent communication and presentation skills, particularly at the executive level, to effectively articulate MMN offerings and strategic priorities.

**Media Sales Cycle Management:** Experience in driving the sales cycle, including establishing and managing a robust pipeline of demand for advertising solutions.

**Solution-Oriented:** Solution-oriented mindset with the ability to remain calm under pressure and find innovative solutions to challenges.

**Business Acumen:** Strong business acumen with experience in pitching and closing joint business partnership (JBP) agreements, including signing new and growing existing commitments.

**Data Analysis:** Proficiency in data analysis and visualization to enhance understanding and communication of trends and benchmarks from campaigns, informing future actions and recommendations.

**Who You Are**

* Candidates with a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a related field are encouraged to apply. 5-8 years of advertising sales experience and 3-5 years of experience leading teams.
* Regularly required to sit, talk, hear; use hands/fingers to touch, handle, and feel. Occasionally required to move about the workplace and reach with hands and arms. Requires close vision.
* Required to work on-site in Macy’s NYC office multiple days each week (2+) to ensure optimal collaboration with the team, business partners, and clients. Able to work a flexible schedule based on department and company needs.

**What We Can Offer You**

Join a team where work is as rewarding as it is fun! We offer a dynamic, inclusive environment with competitive pay and benefits. Enjoy comprehensive health and wellness coverage and a 401(k) match to invest in your future. Prioritize your well-being with paid time off and eight paid holidays. Grow your career with continuous learning and leadership development. Plus, build community by joining one of our Colleague Resource Groups and make a difference through our volunteer opportunities.

*Some additional benefits we offer include:*

* Merchandise discounts
* Performance-based incentives
* Annual merit review
* Employee Assistance Program with mental health counseling and legal/financial advice
* Tuition reimbursement

Access the full menu of benefits offerings here.

**About Us**

This is a great time to join Macy’s! Whether you’re helping a customer find the perfect gift, streamlining operations in one of our distribution centers, enhancing our online shopping experience, buying in-style and on-trend merchandise to outfit our customers, or designing a balloon for the Thanksgiving Day Parade, we offer unique opportunities to be part of some of the most memorable moments in people’s lives.

***Join us and help write the next chapter in our story - Apply Today!***

  

DIGITAL00

This position may be eligible for performance-based incentives/bonuses. Benefits include 401k, medical/vision/dental/life/disability insurance options, PTO accruals, Holidays, and more. Eligibility requirements may apply based on location, job level, classification, and length of employment. Additional benefit details are available at macysJOBS.com.

title: Program Manager, Planning, Analytics & Workforce Strategies (PAWS)
description:
DESCRIPTION

The Planning Analytics and Workforce Strategies (PAWS) team within the Amazon Grocery Logistics (AGL) org owns workforce planning integration and strategic support for the Amazon Fresh fulfillment business. The AGL PAWS team develops and manages a Workforce Planning mechanisms and product suite that solves for the unique challenges and requirements of ultrafast businesses via customizable, operator-friendly tools and processes.  
  
We are looking for a dynamic, experienced Program Manager with a strong delivery record and proven success to own key aspects of Grocery workforce planning/management. A highly analytical candidate with project management experience is an ideal fit, as this role will require cross-functional partnership with multiple operational and technical teams (Workforce Planning, Field Ops, Business Intelligence Engineers, Business Analytics, Data Engineering, Workforce Staffing, Change Enablement, Tech, Finance , HR, Legal and other teams as applicable) to lead, influence and support business critical projects and initiatives.  
  
Due to the nature of the business, you will also be expected to interact internally with senior-level audiences to provide updates and make strategic recommendations that will achieve the long-term vision for optimal balance between associate experience and business/customer needs. Documentation of requirements, project management and cross-team coordination skills are essential.  
  
Key job responsibilities  

* Designing and modeling new operations processes for developing business needs to prove quality, cost, and scalability goals as critical outputs.
* Gathering and analyzing data across order fulfillment functions to establish global standards for operations in partnership with cross functional teams.
* Rethinking the grocery offerings we provide to customers to optimize for speed, convenience, and cost.
* Building strong partnership with operations field leaders to understand improvement opportunities.
* Analyzing and solving operational barriers with a focus on understanding root causes and driving forward solves.
* Leading project teams to plan, organize, and execute complex projects across multiple organizations and stakeholders to enable the launch of new projects and processes.
* Innovating to improve customer experience and continuously remove cost from our fulfillment network.
* Designing new metrics and enhancing existing metrics to support the future state of the business.
* Working autonomously in an ambiguous environment, seeking to understand business problems, automation limitations, scaling factors, boundary conditions and reasons behind leadership decisions
* Developing, implementing, reporting and governing KPI reporting for a portfolio of programs, providing visibility to the milestones, and performance across all projects
* Rolling up your sleeves and doing whatever is necessary; general manager / owner mentality

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 1+ years of program or project management experience
* Knowledge of Microsoft Excel at an advanced level, including: pivot tables, macros, index/match, vlookup, VBA, data links, etc.
* Knowledge of SQL
* Experience in a highly analytical, results-oriented environment with cross functional interactions
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor's degree in supply chain, business, engineering, finance or related technical or quantitative field
* Experience in requirement gathering and ability to write clear and detailed requirement document
* Experience with SQL
* Experience in workforce planning or workforce management, particularly within a retail or warehouse context
* Experience leading and owning cross-functional programs (design, development, implementation, maintenance and optimization)
* Experience managing multiple competing projects and priorities simultaneously
* Advanced knowledge of analytical tools such as SQL, QuickSight/Tableau, and MS Excel

  
Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.  
  
Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.  
  
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $50,100/year in our lowest geographic market up to $107,200/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Strategic Account Representative - Ontario, CA
description:
We Always Deliver for our customers and our people. Become a Strategic Account Representative (SAR) and join our team! Your main responsibility will be to sell our products and services to medium to large potential clients in your assigned territory. You will use our top-notch Sales Enablement tools and processes to secure new business within the B2B sector.
  
  
**Empowering Achievement:**  
We understand that our dedicated Team Partners are the driving force behind our company's success. We provide resources such as: regular 1:1 coaching, continuous sales training, cutting-edge technology, and career development opportunities to elevate your professional growth.
  
  
**What Your Role Entails:** Generate revenue by acquiring new clients to meet sales objectives Schedule and conduct in-person meetings with qualified leads Develop and deliver presentations to prospects about our services Maintain a strong pipeline of potential customers Devise strategies to boost sales Support in implementing and overseeing target account strategies Regularly meet with leadership to strategize Stay informed about competitors and market trends
  
  
**Unlock Limitless Earning Potential:**  
**Our comprehensive compensation package includes:** Competitive Base Salary - Total 1st year compensation (including commission) can range from $65,000-120,000 Monthly Commission New Hire Ramp-Up Bonus Quarterly Bonus Program Weekly Car Allowance Monthly Cell Phone Reimbursement Annual President’s Club trip for top performers Full suite of benefits including 401K match, profit sharing, health and life insurance, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), disability coverage, vacation, sick time, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, 30% employee discounts, and more.
  
**You will benefit from:** Paid top-tier sales training Exposure to sales and executive leadership Protected selling territories Cutting edge sales tools, devices, and software Development through our Award-winning Sales Training Program
  
Qualifications
  
  
**You will have:** 3+ years of proven successful B2B sales experience Valid Driver’s license and reliable transportation Proficiency with MS Office products Experience with Customer Record Management (CRM) Systems Experience with Sales Enablement Tools; Seismic is preferred High School Diploma or GED – College degree is a plus Internal candidates will be required to have a proven track record of success, as well as completion of company specific training and certifications
  
  
UniFirst is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or employment against any individual on the basis of race, color, gender, national origin, ancestry, religion, physical or mental disability, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, pregnancy, citizenship, or any other factor protected by anti-discrimination laws.

title: Talent Acquisition Supervisor
description:
* This is a hybrid position with a 50% on-site requirement in Wilmington, MA\\*

The Talent Acquisition Sales Recruiting Supervisor will support the strategic full cycle recruitment process for UniFirst’s Award-Winning Sales Organization by leading the Recruiting & Strategic Sourcing team. Through mentorship, recruitment expertise, and significant cross functional collaboration, this is a dynamic and key role that will drive the development and management of candidate pipelines for UniFirst’s open positions. This is a great opportunity to manage and scale a team of Talent Acquisition Recruiters and Strategic Sourcing Specialists based in the United States and Colombia.
  
  
**Responsibilities:**  
**Team Leadership:** Drive the achievement of results through coaching our internal Recruiting & Strategic Sourcing team. Manage workloads, set goals, and provide continuous feedback and development opportunities for team members.
  
**Recruitment Expertise:** Serve as the Talent Acquisition (TA) expert for all aspects of recruiting and strategic sourcing in support of UniFirst’s Sales Recruitment Initiatives Act as a strategic talent leader to implement recruitment & sourcing solutions, strategies, and continuous process improvement. Build and foster relationships with the team, hiring managers, and stakeholders throughout the organization. Foster a consultative approach with stakeholders to serve recruitment needs as they vary across geographic and candidate markets.

Generate and deliver weekly reports to monitor effectiveness & efficiency of Strategic Sourcing team Partner with Talent Enablement team to ensure effectiveness of job posting & sourcing

title: Marketing Client Services Manager
description:
ATAK Interactive is a full-service RevOps agency committed to driving growth for our clients through strategic sales and marketing initiatives. We believe in empowering our team with the freedom to innovate, solve problems, and grow within our organization. Our HubSpot + Lead Gen services span sales enablement, marketing hub onboarding, sales hub onboarding, solutions architecture, API integrations, CRM migrations, Content Hub Development, graphic design, SEO, web development, email marketing, paid digital marketing, and more. We pride ourselves on our collaborative culture and dedication to delivering exceptional results.

Our approach is built on four key pillars: Strategic Vision, Execution, Communication, and Customer Success. We craft comprehensive roadmaps aligned with client goals to drive measurable growth. We deliver on commitments with precision and excellence, maintaining high standards and meeting deadlines. Transparent, prompt, and effective communication is vital, as is setting expectations and boundaries while maintaining a consistent dialogue. Our ultimate focus is achieving client goals through impactful results, regularly measuring progress to ensure exceptional value and satisfaction.

**Marketing Client Services** Manager (Remote)

**About the Role:**

We’re looking for a driven and dynamic Client Services Manager with a strong marketing and lead generation background to join our growing remote team. This role is ideal for someone with hands-on experience in paid search, paid social, SEO, content strategy, and website design/development, who thrives in a fast-paced agency environment and is passionate about helping clients grow.

You'll serve as the primary point of contact for a portfolio of clients, leading marketing strategy, coordinating execution, and ensuring every project delivers real business impact. While HubSpot experience is a plus, what matters most is your ability to drive results across digital channels and lead generation campaigns.

Key Responsibilities:

**Client Leadership**

* Lead the development and execution of multi-channel marketing strategies for B2B clients.
* Guide clients on best practices in demand generation, including PPC, paid social, SEO, and content marketing.
* Collaborate on growth strategies that drive leads, conversions, and measurable results.

**Client Communication & Relationship Management**

* Build trusted relationships with clients through proactive communication and strategic guidance.
* Act as an advocate for your clients, ensuring they receive top-notch service and ongoing performance improvements.
* Conduct regular Zoom meetings and strategic check-ins to keep campaigns aligned with business objectives.

**Campaign & Project Management**

* Oversee the execution of digital campaigns, ensuring timely delivery, performance tracking, and clear communication.
* Manage timelines, budgets, and expectations using tools like Teamwork or Asana.
* Coordinate with internal teams (design, development, content, paid media) to keep everything on track.

**Performance Tracking & Optimization**

* Analyze campaign performance using tools like Google Analytics, Ads Managers, and CRM reports.
* Provide actionable insights to continuously improve ROI across all channels.
* Create and present detailed performance reports, identifying areas for growth.

**Cross-Functional Collaboration**

* Work with designers, developers, content creators, and paid media specialists to execute full-funnel marketing campaigns.
* Support and manage external vendors and partners when needed.

**The Ideal Candidate**:

* **Project Management**: Mastery of project management tools (we use Wrike), with a track record of keeping projects on time and under budget. Bonus points if you have any project management credentials such as a PMP.
* **Client Management**: Proven ability to manage 5–7 client accounts, serving as the strategic lead and point of contact.
* **B2B Marketing Acumen**: 3+ years of experience managing digital marketing clients across paid search, paid social, SEO, content marketing, and website projects—ideally in an agency setting.
* **Content & Web Knowledge**: Comfortable guiding clients through content strategy and website projects (HubSpot, WordPress, or similar).
* **Analytical & Strategic**: Data-driven thinker who uses insights to improve campaign performance and client results.
* **HubSpot Experience**: Familiarity with HubSpot Marketing Hub, Sales Hub, and reporting tools is a plus, but not required.
* **Team Player**: Collaborative, communicative, and able to motivate cross-functional teams and clients alike.
* **Positive Attitude**: Professional, proactive, and enthusiastic—someone who clients and teammates love working with.
  

**Why Join ATAK Interactive**:

* Career Growth: An opportunity to take actual ownership of your career with the freedom to bring new ideas and strategies.
* Innovative Environment: Work in a culture built on “being the solution”, where creative problem-solving is encouraged.
* Supportive Team: Join a strong, collaborative team that believes in one another and works together to achieve success.

The salary range for this position is between $70,000 to $90,000 per year. ATAK also offers a full benefits package, including unlimited PTO, medical/dental/vision/life insurance, and a 401k with 5% match.

title: Data Product Manager
description:
Finexio is revolutionizing how businesses manage and process payments by integrating digital payment and cash flow solutions into their existing software workflows. Our goal is to eliminate the complexity in B2B payments so finance leaders can focus on “what” to pay—while Finexio’s platform handles the “how” and “when.”

As part of our growth, we're seeking a Data Product Manager who will play a pivotal role in bridging business needs with data insights through effective reporting and business intelligence delivery. This role is ideal for someone with strong Power BI expertise, a product mindset, and the ability to translate complex data needs into practical, scalable reporting solutions.

Role Overview

The Data Product Manager will focus on enabling data-driven decisions across the organization by owning and evolving our reporting suite. You’ll work closely with stakeholders from finance, operations, and product to gather requirements, develop insights, and deliver intuitive, business-critical dashboards. Your main tools will include Power BI (required), Looker (preferred), and SQL, with some exposure to upstream data models and pipelines. You will be instrumental in increasing our data maturity while influencing how internal teams consume and leverage data to drive operational and strategic decisions.

Key Responsibilities

Business Intelligence & Reporting (Power BI Focused)

* Own the development and maintenance of Power BI dashboards, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and performance.
* Translate stakeholder requirements into actionable reporting and visualization products.
* Partner with engineering and data teams to validate data quality and availability.
* Manage reporting deliverables from scoping through launch, with a clear communication cadence.

Product Management

* Serve as the product owner for internal and external data reporting capabilities, defining reporting product roadmaps aligned with business needs.
* Conduct user interviews to continuously gather feedback on dashboards and reporting utility.
* Prioritize reporting enhancements and bug fixes using product management tools like ClickUp.

Cross-functional Collaboration

* Collaborate with Finance, Account Management, Client Operations, and Product teams to understand KPIs and key reporting requirements.
* Advocate for end users by ensuring reporting solutions are actionable and user-friendly.
* Collaborate with Data Engineering to improve data models that support reporting functionality.

Data Governance & Best Practices

* Support documentation and standardization of metrics, dimensions, and KPI definitions.
* Participate in training and enablement efforts to increase adoption of self-service BI tools.
* Help implement scalable data validation and error-checking procedures within reporting workflows.

**Requirements**

Preferred Qualifications

* 3–5 years of experience in a Data Product, BI Analyst, or Data Reporting role, preferably in fintech or SaaS.
* Expert-level proficiency in Power BI is required; familiarity with Looker and BigQuery is a plus.
* Proficient in SQL and able to write optimized queries for data exploration and dashboard back-ends.
* Comfortable working with stakeholders to define business requirements and translate them into BI solutions.
* Understanding of modern data stack tools (e.g., dbt, Fivetran, Hightouch) is a plus.
* Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects and priorities.
* Familiar with product management practices and remote collaboration tools (ClickUp, Teams, Miro, etc.)

Who You Are

* A natural collaborator who communicates well with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Detail-oriented and analytical with a passion for creating impactful, clean, and intuitive data visuals.
* Motivated to improve internal processes and help scale reporting infrastructure.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment where priorities can shift quickly.

Compensation & Location

* Candidate must currently reside on the East Coast of the United Sates or be willing to relocate to Orlando, FL (preferred).
* Remote flexibility offered depending on candidate experience and fit.

**Benefits**

Why You’ll Love Working at Finexio:

  

* Culture: We are a humble, client-first team that is focused on collaborative data-driven success.
* Speed: We move fast, love new ideas and give you the opportunity to push your limits.
* Growth: We are expanding rapidly into new markets, launching new services and creating a world-class company

What We Offer:

  

* The chance to work in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders
* An environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make a real, measurable impact
* Employee Engagement – Quarterly virtual team building activities and monthly team lunches
* Competitive salary and stock options
* Medical, dental, and vision
Unlimited Vacation Policy  

Compensation - $115k - $145 Base Salary + Equity

title: Manager, Revenue Acceleration - Public Sector
description:
**Company Description**

**Our Mission**

At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.  
Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

**Who We Are**

We take our mission of protecting the digital way of life seriously. We are relentless in protecting our customers and we believe that the unique ideas of every member of our team contributes to our collective success. Our values were crowdsourced by employees and are brought to life through each of us everyday - from disruptive innovation and collaboration, to execution. From showing up for each other with integrity to creating an environment where we all feel included.

As a member of our team, you will be shaping the future of cybersecurity. We work fast, value ongoing learning, and we respect each employee as a unique individual. Knowing we all have different needs, our development and personal wellbeing programs are designed to give you choice in how you are supported. This includes our FLEXBenefits wellbeing spending account with over 1,000 eligible items selected by employees, our mental and financial health resources, and our personalized learning opportunities - just to name a few!

At Palo Alto Networks, we believe in the power of collaboration and value in-person interactions. This is why our employees generally work full time from our office with flexibility offered where needed. This setup fosters casual conversations, problem-solving, and trusted relationships. Our goal is to create an environment where we all win with precision.

 **Job Description**

**Your Career**

The Public Sector Revenue Acceleration Manager will drive revenue growth across US State & Local Government, US Education, and US Federal verticals. This role collaborates closely with cross-functional teams, including Field Sales, Partner Teams, GTM, and Product Management. Key responsibilities, in partnership with sales leadership, include working directly with core sellers and front-line sales managers to support territory planning, account planning, account strategy reviews (ASRs), close plans, deal reviews, and other sales acceleration activities, along with facilitating deliverables and coaching teams. In addition, this role will be responsible for new GTM initiatives based on new companywide and area wide priorities.

**Your Impact**

* Revenue Acceleration and Sales Optimization: Partner with Public Sector sales leadership to optimize processes, directly supporting sellers and managers to streamline planning (territory/account, ASRs, close plans, deal reviews) for increased revenue, higher win rates, and faster deal cycles.
* Best Practice Deployment: Lead the formal implementation and optimization of consistent sales methodologies (e.g., MEDDIC) and cadences to ensure predictable success and timely execution.
* Cross-functional & Ecosystem Alignment: Cultivate strong partnerships across all Go-to-Market functions (Operations & Strategy, Enablement, Marketing, Industry, Business Value, Cloud, Services, SAs, Partner Channel, Solution Consulting) for integrated activities and unified revenue acceleration.
* Strategic Growth Initiatives: Drive revenue acceleration efforts specifically aligned with expanding Next Generation Security offerings.
* Relationship Management: Maintain robust relationships with executive and functional leaders across various departments (Marketing, Channels, Operations, Product, L&E) for continuous strategic support.
* AI-Driven Productivity: Integrate AI tools (Gemini, NotebookLM) into GTM and field sales activities to dramatically boost efficiency and minimize administrative tasks for the sales team.

 **Qualifications**

**Your Experience**

* Experience: 8+ years of sales enablement experience in cybersecurity or related technologies, including at least 3 years focused on the Public Sector. Field sales and pre-sales engineering experience is a strong plus. A bachelors degree is required, and a graduate degree is a strong plus.
* Sales Acumen: Proven ability to drive measurable increases in field sales revenue, boost sales efficiency, and optimize sales velocity.
* Methodology Expertise: Demonstrated experience in deploying and optimizing sales best practices and methodologies (e.g., MEDDIC) and strong CRM expertise (e.g., Salesforce).
* Collaboration & Influence: Strong track record of cultivating and leveraging cross-functional and ecosystem partnerships for integrated Go-to-Market strategies and revenue acceleration.
* Strategic Alignment: Ability to align revenue acceleration efforts with key business objectives, particularly related to emerging technologies like Next Generation Security.
* Leadership & Relationships: Skilled in maintaining robust strategic partnerships with executive and functional leaders.
* Technical Aptitude/AI: Experience with or strong aptitude for integrating AI tools into sales processes to enhance productivity.
* Exceptional Communication & Productivity Suite Proficiency: Proven ability to effectively present and facilitate meetings with diverse audiences, coupled with advanced proficiency in productivity suites such Google Workspace (Slides, Sheets, Docs).

  
**Additional Information**

**The Team**

Our Public Sector Field Sales Organization is the connection between our clients’ cybersecurity needs and Palo Alto Networks’ set of solutions. Comprising account managers, systems engineers and sales specialists, our team is committed to client satisfaction and the continued growth of our business. Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.

As part of our Public Sector GTM team under the Public Sector Field Sales Organization, and you are empowered in partnership with sales leaders and cross-functional teams to drive revenue acceleration. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to sales enablement to meet the needs of the sales organization, partners, and customers. As a member of our GTM team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with team members to resolve incredibly complex cyberthreats.

**Compensation Disclosure**

The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer at the posted level, the starting base salary (for non-sales roles) or base salary + commission target (for sales/commissioned roles) is expected to be between $158000 - $255000/YR. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here.

**Our Commitment**  
  
We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.

Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

**Is role eligible for Immigration Sponsorship? No.** **Please note that we will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.**

title: Senior Systems Design & Integration Specialist
description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

The Boeing Company is looking for a highly experienced and detail-oriented **Senior Systems Design & Integration Specialist** to join the team in **Everett, WA; Kent, WA; Hazelwood, MO; Berkeley, Mo; or North Charleston, SC.**

We are seeking a high-level Microsoft 365 (M365)/Exchange Administrator to oversee and support our M365 environment, with a strong focus on automation and scripting using PowerShell/Graph. The role includes managing Exchange Online, Teams, SharePoint, and compliance features, while developing scripts to automate routine tasks and improve system efficiency. This position requires participation in an on-call rotation for critical support and incident response. The ideal candidate has deep experience with M365 services, email security protocols, and strong troubleshooting skills in a fast-paced, enterprise environment.

**Position Responsibilities:**

* Lead a cross-functional team responsible for the technical operation, configuration, compliance, and lifecycle of M365 collaboration services
* Drive adoption of M365 tools through governance, training enablement, and user experience enhancements
* Collaborate with cybersecurity, data governance, and Information Technology (IT) infrastructure teams to ensure M365 solutions meet Boeing’s enterprise standards for security, scalability, and compliance
* Partner with internal stakeholders to identify business needs and implement M365/Exchange solutions that improve productivity and streamline workflows
* Monitor service performance, usage analytics, and operational metrics to ensure platform reliability and to inform continuous improvement efforts
* Stay informed on Microsoft roadmap updates and industry best practices; serve as the internal liaison with Microsoft and other key vendors

**Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):**

* 7+ years of IT experience, with at least 3 years in Microsoft 365/Exchange environments
* Experience with SharePoint Online, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Purview and other M365 collaboration tools
* Experience with Microsoft 365/Exchange governance, compliance, identity/access management, and automation
* Experience with strong communication and project management skills, with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives and engage with senior stakeholders

**Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):**

* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
* Experience with Exchange, Microsoft, and automation
* Experience with Agile, DevOps, and enterprise change management frameworks
* Experience in aerospace, defense, or other regulated industries
* Experience with PowerShell, SQL, and Graph

**Drug Free Workplace:**

Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies*.*

**Pay & Benefits:**

At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.

The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.

The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

Pay is based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

Summary pay range: $120,700 - $174,800

Applications for this position will be accepted until **Jun. 19, 2025**

 **Export Control Requirements:** This is not an Export Control position.

**Relocation**

Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position.

**Visa Sponsorship**

Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.

**Shift**

This position is for 1st shift

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**

Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Description

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

**Job Function:**

Supply Chain Manufacturing

**Job Sub Function:**

Production Equipment Repair & Maintenance

**Job Category:**

Business Enablement/Support

**All Job Posting Locations:**

Santa Clara, California, United States of America

**Job Description:**

Johnson & Johnson is hiring for a **Manufacturing Technician (Swing Shift) - Shockwave Medical** to join our team located in **Santa Clara, CA**.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Fueled by innovation at the intersection of biology and technology, we’re developing the next generation of smarter, less invasive, more personalized treatments. Ready to join a team that’s pioneering the development and commercialization of Intravascular Lithotripsy (IVL) to treat complex calcified cardiovascular disease. Our Shockwave Medical portfolio aims to establish a new standard of care for medical device treatment of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease through its differentiated and proprietary local delivery of sonic pressure waves for the treatment of calcified plaque.

**Position Overview**

The Manufacturing Technician performs complex or specialized technical assignments, often project-based, requiring the ability to work independently. This role may involve designing, developing, maintaining or modifying manufacturing equipment, materials, systems and products. The technician uses sound judgment, a high degree of initiative, creativity in solving, and must adapt to rapidly shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment. The Manufacturing Technician sets up and maintains equipment to required standards and makes recommendations for continuous improvement of manufacturing methods in partnership with Manufacturing Engineering.

**Essential Job Functions**

* Supports development and manufacturing teams by testing specific aspects of products, processes, or equipment to meet defined requirements and timelines.
* Troubleshoots and resolves equipment issues requiring hands-on experience and technical interpretation of procedures and practices.
* Masters the processes and procedures used to build company products, and is qualified to train new employees (including assemblers, technicians, engineers).
* Demonstrates ingenuity, creativity and a high degree of independent action and initiative.
* Communicates effectively with team members and multi-functional partners to ensure the highest quality products, processes, or equipment to meet identified needs.
* Supplies ideas and solutions to improve processes and equipment.
* Analyzes data to identify trends and isolate cause-effect relationships; reports findings and presents progress and plans to engineers and/or management.
* Provides support data for Engineers during qualification and validation studies.
* Plans and organizes project assignments of substantial variety and complexity; initiates or maintains work schedules and project milestones; establishes priorities.
* Facilitates meetings and training sessions on procedures and processes for all levels of technical personnel, including engineers.
* Must be available to support production on Saturdays, as needed.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Requirements**

* High School Diploma required with a minimum of 1 year experience as a manufacturing technician (or relevant experience) in the medical device industry or with 3 years’ other relevant hands on medical device experience.
* Must be able to work 2nd shift hours (2:45 pm - 11:15 pm) and overtime as needed to meet business needs.
* Knowledge of and compliance with applicable Quality System requirements such as QSRs, FDA, ISO, MDD and other relevant regulations.
* Understanding of and experience with 5S, Lean, and waste reduction in manufacturing.
* Experience in equipment preventive maintenance and/or calibration is a plus.
* Knowledge of PLC’s, pneumatic systems, and electrical systems.
* Experience in manufacturing processes, systems, and process/product development.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple priorities.
* Proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively, showing flexibility to adapt to changing requirements. Must be able to sit for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour workday)
* May be required to lift objects up to 25lbs or more.
* Must be able to work in an air-conditioned office as well as a non-temperature controlled warehouse environment as needed.

*NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employees may perform other related duties as assigned or negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.*

**Additional Information:**

* The anticipated base pay for this position is $39,100-$69,000 annually.
* The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.
* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:
  + Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
  + Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
  + Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year
  + Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year
* https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

*Johnson & Johnson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. title: Senior Marketing Manager
description:
KX Technologies LLC

As a part of the global industrial organization Marmon Holdings—which is backed by Berkshire Hathaway—you’ll be doing things that matter, leading at every level, and winning a better way. We’re committed to making a positive impact on the world, providing you with diverse learning and working opportunities, and fostering a culture where everyone’s empowered to be their best.

Marmon Water Residential Filtration group is comprised of KX Technologies & Filtrex Technologies, two leading and innovative companies dedicated to providing high-quality filtration solutions. With a commitment to excellence, innovation, and customer satisfaction, we aim to revolutionize the industry by delivering cutting-edge products and exceptional services. We are seeking an experienced and dynamic individual to join our team as the Senior Marketing Manager  
  
We are seeking a Senior Marketing Manager to drive market strategy, product lifecycle management, demand generation, and brand positioning for our water filtration products. This is a high-impact individual contributor role focused on long-term market growth, OEM partnerships, and consumer insights to influence business decisions. It is ideal for a strategic marketer with product management experience who understands the B2B2C business model collaborating with OEM partners while keeping a strong focus on end-consumer needs. The ideal candidate has a blend of strategic marketing expertise, product management acumen, and market research skills, with the ability to guide product development, positioning, and go-to-market strategies as well as who can blend data-driven insights with creative marketing initiatives to strengthen our brand in both B2B and B2C ecosystems.

**Strategic Market Planning & Business Insights**

* Develop and execute a strategic marketing roadmap to drive business growth and market expansion.
* Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and customer segmentation to identify trends and opportunities in the B2B2C landscape.
* Provide data-driven insights to guide OEM marketing strategies, product positioning, and go-to-market plans.
* Collaborate with leadership to define and refine value propositions and competitive differentiation that resonate with both OEMs and end consumers.

**Demand Generation & Go-to-Market Strategy**

* Develop and implement multi-channel demand generation campaigns that support OEM sales efforts while building end-user brand awareness.
* Optimize digital marketing, ABM (Account-Based Marketing), content marketing, SEO, and paid media strategies to reach both business customers and consumers.
* Work with OEM partners to co-market products, develop joint campaigns, and create sales enablement materials that support their go-to-market efforts.

**Brand Management & Market Positioning**

* Strengthen the company's brand presence across both OEM (B2B) and end-user (B2C) segments.
* Develop compelling messaging, content, and storytelling that reinforces the company’s expertise in water filtration for both business partners and consumers.
* Ensure branding and product positioning are aligned with OEM partner needs while maintaining strong consumer appeal.

**Consumer & OEM Market Insights**

* Stay informed about consumer trends, industry regulations, and technological advancements in water filtration.
* Conduct consumer research, surveys, and focus groups to gather insights that inform product development and marketing.
* Develop strategies to translate consumer needs into OEM opportunities, helping OEM partners better position and sell products.

**Cross-functional Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement**

* Work closely with OEM partners, sales teams, product managers, and executive leadership to align marketing with business priorities.
* Manage relationships with external agencies, research firms, and media partners to enhance marketing impact.
* Support thought leadership initiatives, including whitepapers, industry reports, and conference participation.

**Qualifications & Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Business, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
* 10+ years of experience in strategic marketing, market research, or product marketing, preferably in water filtration, Product based, or consumer goods industries.
* Strong expertise in B2B2C marketing, OEM partnerships, and consumer insights.
* Proven track record in market analysis, go-to-market strategy, and demand generation.
* Hands-on experience with digital marketing, content strategy, and CRM/marketing automation tools.
* Ability to work independently, think strategically, and drive projects with minimal supervision.
* Strong analytical and communication skills to translate data into actionable strategies.

Following receipt of a conditional offer of employment, candidates will be required to complete additional job-related screening processes as permitted or required by applicable law.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to careers@marmon.com, and please be sure to include the title and the location of the position for which you are applying.

title: Senior Product Marketing Specialist - National Remote
description:
Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health equity on a global scale. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  

We are seeking an accomplished Senior Marketing Specialist to support the Channel and Alliance Partnership’s sales team’s growth agenda. This dynamic and multifaceted role blends responsibilities from product, integrated, and sales-enablement marketing. The ideal candidate will have proven skills in the execution of marketing plans and sales support, including launching products, creating content and sales materials, digital promotion, and events. We’re looking for someone with exceptional skills in problem solving, cross-team collaboration, organization, and thrives in a fast-paced, complex organization.

  

Channel Partner marketing will be focused on driving growth of Optum products through partner channels. Alliance marketing will focus on supporting innovative partnerships that enable Optum Insight to meet client needs and grow business. This includes developing relationships, selling/promoting third party products or supporting the growth of co-developed products.

  

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely \\* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Execute marketing plans, campaigns, digital content, and programs that build the brand within the channel partner business, to support new partner acquisition, relationship expansion, partner/customer retention, and create demand and generate loyalty
* Manage partner relationships related to marketing and business development to help drive sales and maximize revenue opportunities
* Effectively work across key stakeholders, including Sales, Account Management, Product Management, Strategy, etc. to execute on marketing and communications plans that are aligned to key business priorities and drives growth in partnership channel
* Develop and execute on partner program launch plans including positioning statements and value propositions, collateral development, promotional plans, etc.
* Craft and implement messaging and content development that is relevant, meaningful, and compelling, and serves to engage prospects, customers, and other key stakeholders
* Own all partner program set-up, project management and reporting
* Captures performance metrics: Collects and analyzes data from various marketing channels to track performance against KPIs for data-driven decision-making

  

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**

* 3+ years of proven digital and/or sales marketing experience
* Prior knowledge and experience with sales enablement, event preparation, and digital marketing

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Prior Optum marketing experience
* Solid healthcare marketing experience
* Knowledge of digital marketing channels and metrics
* Ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights
* Experience with website marketing
* Experience with Workfront, Teams, and Salesforce; Marketo, Power BI, and Adobe Analytics a plus
* Demonstrated ability to be flexible and work with ambiguity

  

**Demonstrated Skills:**

* Experience with marketing campaign execution (concepting, execution, lead generation, attribution, results)
* Knowledge of sales processes and methodology
* Proficient in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, etc.). Advanced skills in PowerPoint, creating compelling and effective slides to be used by the sales/leadership team
* Solid writing and presentation skills
* Ability to collaborate across the organization to accomplish goals
* Solid interpersonal and communication skills
* Excellent project management, prioritization skills

  

* All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.

  

The salary range for this role is $71,600 to $140,600 annually based on full-time employment. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

  

**Application Deadline**: This will be posted for a minimum of 2 business days or until a sufficient candidate pool has been collected. Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.

  

*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  

*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

  

*UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*

Description

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

**Job Function:**

Sales Enablement

**Job Sub Function:**

Sales Training

**Job Category:**

Professional

**All Job Posting Locations:**

Palm Beach Gardens, Florida, United States of America, Warsaw, Indiana, United States of America

**Job Description:**

**We are searching for the best talent for** **Hips Training Manager to be in Palm Beach Gardens, FL or Warsaw, IN.**

**About Orthopaedics**

Fueled by innovation at the intersection of biology and technology, we’re developing the next generation of smarter, less invasive, more personalized treatments.

Are you passionate about improving and expanding the possibilities of Orthopaedics? Ready to join a team that’s reimagining how we heal? Our Orthopaedics teams help keep more than 6 million people moving each year while delivering clinical and economic value to surgeons and healthcare systems. Our teams build solutions for joint reconstruction; trauma and craniomaxillofacial; sports, extremities, and elective foot and ankle; spine; and robotics and digital surgery.

Your unique talents will help patients on their journey to wellness. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/medtech

**Purpose:**

The role of Hips Training Manager, Commercial Education, Joint Reconstruction and VELYS Hip Navigation is responsible for the planning, delivery, and execution of training for the sales organization aligned to the global learning strategy and in support of the US region’s business needs.

This role will be primarily focused on Hip surgeries and product lines and will work with Global Education, Regional Marketing, Sales Leadership, Healthcare Compliance and other functional partners to shape and deliver educational programs aimed at elevating the competency of the sales organization aligned with the company curricula, certification pathways, policies and strategies.

**Key responsibilities:**

* Manages daily business-focused training activities for the Commercial Education Hips and VHN.This includes but is not limited to administrative activities, communications, development and execution of curricula and courses and administration of Commercial Education policies and guidelines, all aligned with the MedTech Education strategy.
* Liaises with senior management to obtain resources for supporting needs and requirements for Joint Reconstruction and VELYS Enabling Tech strategic initiatives.
* Accountable for ongoing related asset management tracking and reporting
* Accountable for ongoing training needs assessment of customer-facing field sales teams related to organizational imperatives by performing analysis on current and historical sales activities, and enterprise engagement.
* Delivers the most effective educational programs to satisfy the overall objectives of the Joint Reconstruction and VELYS Enabling Tech organization.
* Develops and executes Commercial Education strategies in partnership with internal functional partners and Commercial Development cohorts to address all ongoing training and development of sales consultants with emphasis on technical training, clinical selling, operations, job related technical proficiency, strategic account management, and enterprise and market effectiveness.
* Keeps expertise updated in training and related clinical and business technologies and methodologies. Identifies market and organizational trends and recommends appropriate actions to management.
* Ensures that sales training practices are in compliance with all government and legal requirements.
* Accountable for the Design and deliver effective educational programs aligned to our learning strategies including the use of a 30-40-30 format.
* Educates sales consultants across the entire portfolio to build clinical and non-clinical proficiency with emphasis on technical training, clinical selling, operations, strategic account management and enterprise market effectiveness.
* Conducts and reports on follow-up of training programs, updates ongoing programs utilizing MedTech Education analytics methodologies and update programs as needed.
* Facilitates virtual/live training classes as needed to build clinical and non-clinical proficiency of sales/clinical team across the entire portfolio.
* Works with strategic vendors and acts as subject matter expert for training development.
* Leverages technology platforms to help facilitate education.
* Apply adult learning principles and professional facilitation skills in all learning programs.
* Facilitates learning in live, virtual and self-guided formats aligned with our learning strategies.
* Serve as a subject matter expert for training development with strategic partners and vendors.
* Maintains expertise in training and related clinical and business technologies and methodologies.
* Develop and deliver post course assessments in various formats that align with the training content.

**Qualifications**

Required:

* Bachelor’s degree
* 5 years of medical device experience
* Strong clinical expertise or orthopedic/medical device training experience specific in Hips Arthroplasty.
* Strong sense of ownership and accountability, ability to self-direct and self-govern
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Effective interpersonal skills that include professionalism, maturity and team mentality
* Experience leading projects or initiatives.
* Purposeful orientation aligned with passion for providing the best patient care possible
* Genuine interest in ongoing professional development of self and others
* The ability to effectively create and deliver presentations to a variety of audiences including learners, colleagues and senior leaders.
* Ability to collaborate and lead across functions, cross-functional teams, job levels and a matrix organization
* Ability to adapt to and deliver in a dynamic work environment
* MS Office proficiency and virtual meetings applications
* Travel up to 50% based on where you reside.

Preferred:

* Experience with hip arthroplasty and/or reconstructive joint replacement surgery and revision.
* 3-7+ years of experience in medical device sales, clinical education, or sales training, particularly in orthopaedics
* Strong understanding of hip anatomy, biomechanics, and pathology.
* Familiarity with hip arthroplasty procedures, surgical techniques, and instrumentation.
* Experience with orthopaedics implant products, including the EMPHASYS™, KINCISE™, ACTIS™ and CORAIL™
* Expertise in DPS product platform and sales business practices
* Experience as an orthopedic/medical device trainer
* Experience designing, creating and delivering educational content for virtual, classroom, in-person internal and field-based audiences.
* Experience in technology assisted surgery and/or capital equipment
* Understanding selling strategies
* Experience working in additional commercial functions (field, marketing, etc.)
* Familiarity and training experience with preoperative templating software and 3D planning platforms for accurate implant selection and positioning
* The ability to collaborate with surgeon faculty to develop and deliver high-quality educational programing.
* Ability to process complex situration with opporsing inputs and decide the best path forward.
* Strong ability to build relationships with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and align training programs with best practices and evolving clinical techniques.

Other:

* Office work requires sitting, walking, using phone and computer and surgical instrumentation demonstrating surgical workflow, work in the presence of fluoroscopy.
* May lift up to 30 lbs. occasionally.
* Work Environment: Office, classroom, laboratory and surgical facilities.
* Working Hours: daily Monday – Friday and occasional evenings and weekends.
* Travel Requirements: Overnight travel may be required up to 50%.

title: Sr Account Executive, Indirect Sales (Government)
description:
At T-Mobile, we invest in YOU! Our Total Rewards Package ensures that employees get the same big love we give our customers. All team members receive a competitive base salary and compensation package - this is Total Rewards. Employees enjoy multiple wealth-building opportunities through our annual stock grant, employee stock purchase plan, 401(k), and access to free, year-round money coaches. That’s how we’re UNSTOPPABLE for our employees!

Job Overview  
The Sr. Account Executive, Indirect Sales will oversee channel partner sales activities for T-Mobile's direct sales in Government. This role involves coordinating with T-Mobile direct sales segments to ensure activation and revenue targets (QGP) are met. The Sr. Account Executive, Indirect Sales utilizes their experience in indirect sales to partner with the T-Mobile direct sales teams to ensure Government customers needs are met. This role will work with their internal TFB partners to align on sales strategies to increase sales productivity. In addition to a focus on sales quota attainment, responsibilities also include training, enablement, and collaboration with T-Mobile for Business direct sales teams to achieve results, grow the base and solutions portfolio.

**Job Responsibilities**:

* Achieve growth targets by working with internal T-Mobile for Business teams, including assigned direct sales segments, on sales strategies, offers, and programs to increase sales productivity and activation of T-Mobile products and services.
* Drive indirect partner activity with direct sales segments, participating on joint sales calls as needed, and ensuring TFB direct sales segments have the training and sales enablement tools to achieve results, grow the base and portfolio.
* Accountable for sales reporting and insights for assigned direct sales segments. Partner with internal operations teams to construct communication flows, programs, co-op, and team coordination.
* Stays abreast of industry landscape, challenges and problem statements for the industry, unique products, and solutions, and collaborate as an expert to strategize current and long-term solutions.

**Education and Work Experience**:

* Bachelor's Degree (Preferred)
* 7-10 years Strategic operations, sales, and/or business development experience in a sales and/or wireless organization. Required
* 7-10 years Selling into and/or through key industry partner clients Required
* 5+ years Selling to Government (State and Local) accounts

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**:

* Negotiation Strong, proven negotiation skills. (Required)
* Business Analysis Analytical, planning and decision making. (Required)
* Strategy Strategic operations, sales, and/or business development experiences in a sales and/or wireless organization. (Required)
* Business Acumen Strong business acumen; incorporates overall objective in developing strategy and decisions. (Required)
* Communication Excellent communication skills. (Required)

**Licenses and Certifications**:

* At least 18 years of age
* Legally authorized to work in the United States
* **Travel**:  
  Travel Required (Yes/No):Yes  
    
  **DOT Regulated**:  
  DOT Regulated Position (Yes/No):No  
  Safety Sensitive Position (Yes/No):No

  
Total Target Cash Pay Range: $160,700 - $289,800, inclusive of target incentivesBase Pay Range: $112,490 - $202,860The pay range above is the general base pay range for a successful candidate in this role. The successful candidate’s actual pay will be based on various factors, such as work location, qualifications, and experience, so the actual starting pay will vary within this range. To find the pay range for this role based on hiring location, click here.

At T-Mobile, employees in regular, non-temporary Retail and Business Sales roles are eligible for monthly or quarterly sales incentives.

At T-Mobile, our benefits exemplify the spirit of One Team, Together! A big part of how we care for one another is working to ensure our benefits evolve to meet the needs of our team members. Full and part-time employees have access to the same benefits when eligible. We cover all of the bases, offering medical, dental and vision insurance, a flexible spending account, 401(k), employee stock grants, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and up to 12 paid holidays - which total about 4 weeks for new full-time employees and about 2.5 weeks for new part-time employees annually - paid parental and family leave, family building benefits, back-up care, enhanced family support, childcare subsidy, tuition assistance, college coaching, short- and long-term disability, voluntary AD&D coverage, voluntary accident coverage, voluntary life insurance, voluntary disability insurance, and voluntary long-term care insurance. We don't stop there - eligible employees can also receive mobile service & home internet discounts, pet insurance, and access to commuter and transit programs! To learn about T-Mobile’s amazing benefits, check out *www.t-mobilebenefits.com**.*

Never stop growing!  
As part of the T-Mobile team, you know the Un-carrier doesn’t have a corporate ladder–it’s more like a jungle gym of possibilities! We love helping our employees grow in their careers, because it’s that shared drive to aim high that drives our business and our culture forward. By applying for this career opportunity, you’re living our values while investing in your career growth–and we applaud it. You’re unstoppable!
