title: Senior Manager, Sales Engineering - Tier 1 Accounts
description:
This is a remote-based position located in any major city in the Central United States.  
  
Our team is growing and we’re looking for a Senior Manager, Sales Engineering who will be in an important player in driving revenue for Calix’s Tier 1 Accounts sales opportunities while partnering with and supporting the Tier 1 Accounts Field Sales Team.  
  
This role will be an important player in eliciting the Calix value chain through the implementation, coaching and measurement of a consultative and outcome-based sales methodology, to better serve the field sales team in selling value-based solutions.  
  
This role will be responsible for the management and development of a virtual team, while working with sales leadership and sales enablement in creating and delivering sales materials and training with intent to shorten sales cycles, increase close rate and improve product penetration rates through a structured solution-selling methodology. This methodology will include business challenges, technical content and consultative analysis in support of the Calix solution set within our named account customers.  
  
The Senior Manager, Sales Engineering will also coordinate with the broader sales and support organization, including the Product and Architecture teams to foster sales and operational readiness for all new and existing services, and develop playbooks for standard sales, solution review, turnover, implementation, and steady state for sold offerings.  
  
This role will be charged with remaining current on all major industry trends related to BSP’s. He/she will be responsible for articulating (both internally and externally), the features, values, and benefits of a Calix solution.  
  
The Team Lead will also be engaged in specific solution opportunities, both to improve the methodology, train the Sales and Solutions teams, and to increase business close rates. Based upon client feedback, this role will provide a feedback loop on services feature/functionality back to the Product Team.  
  
The successful candidate will also act as the contact point for Sales opportunities outside of productized offerings, evaluating them for business fit, operational readiness, cost of operation, and market segmentation.

Responsibilities and Duties:

* Recruit, cultivate, excite, and retain an outstanding named account Solutions Engineering team.
* Help to evolve a unique and distinctive organization and share the strategic vision in order to deliver outstanding results.
* Solicit and dissect client requirements and craft complex solutions that utilize services, Cloud and traditional Calix services as dictated by the client need.
* Develop and maintain a positive working relationship with the sales teams.
* Manage, develop and provide senior level contributions in special engineering and technology projects, as needed.
* Manage general individual and team reporting functions, as required.

Qualifications:

* Uniquely talented and highly intelligent with a results-oriented mindset.
* Significant experience in selling to the specific requirements within a Tier 1 Operator; including managing multiple stakeholders and a complex and lengthy sales process.
* 10 - 15 years experience in the networking industry, which has been gained from consumer-facing roles in marketing and sales, and/or solutions engineering.
* 2 – 5 years proven team leadership experience in technical and solutions selling.
* Proven track record of establishing and solidifying strategic relationships with key customers and partners, while representing suites of complex services and solutions.
* Significant experience in the background of networking and the BSP industry, technology and topology.
* Ability to take a holistic and strategic view of the business process, leveraging a deep understanding of end-to-end business models and sales.
* Self-starter with a reputation for being an effective change agent.
* Tenacious work ethic, doing “whatever it takes” with resolve, integrity and an appropriate sense of urgency to meet deadlines and get the job done.

Location:

* This is a remote-based position in the Central United States.

#LI-Remote

Compensation will vary based on geographical location (see below) within the United States. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's location of residence and multiple factors, including job-related skills, experience, and education.

There are different ranges applied to specific locations. The average base pay range (or OTE range for sales) in the U.S. for the position is listed below.

San Francisco Bay Area Only:

250,000.00 - 375,000.00 USD Annual

National Major Cities plus, CA, CO, NY Metro area:

218,000.00 - 327,000.00 USD Annual

Regional plus NY:

196,000.00 - 294,000.00 USD Annual

  

About Us

PLEASE NOTE: All emails from Calix will come from a '@calix.com' email address. Please verify and confirm any communication from Calix prior to disclosing any personal or financial information. If you receive a communication that you think may not be from Calix, please report it to us at

talentandculture@calix.com

.

Calix delivers a broadband platform and managed services that enable our customers to improve life one community at a time. We’re at the forefront of a once in a generational change in the broadband industry. Join us as we innovate, help our customers reach their potential, and connect underserved communities with unrivaled digital experiences.

This is the Calix mission - to enable CSPs of all sizes to Simplify. Innovate. Grow.

If you are a person with a disability needing assistance with the application process please:

* Email us at

  calix.interview@calix.com

  ; or
* Call us at +1 (408) 514-3000.

Calix is a Drug Free Workplace.

title: Sales Technology Enablement Manager
description:
Tampa, FL

Revenue Operations

Full Time

351720

At **Advantive**, we don’t just make software—we build careers and power the manufacturing and distribution backbone of the global economy. We are growing fast, investing in AI, and building a culture where motivated, curious people rise quickly.

As the Sales Technology Enablement Manager, you will be responsible for the deployment and training of the GTM teams on the technology platforms that drive elite performance within the sales organization. Success in the role will be measured by your ability to increase the productivity and efficacy of our GTM teams through the use of technology. As an experienced cross-functional leader, you will work with the Sales Enablement Director, RevOps, and Marketing to implement strategies that drive results in pipeline generation and GTM team productivity.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Plan and execute rollout of prospecting technology platform
* Own, alongside VP RevOps and Sales Enablement manager, prospecting technology strategy and execute that strategy
* Partner with Product Marketing to create prospecting cadences that deliver measurable improvement in pipeline generation
* Create content for and deliver enablement for GTM teams on revenue engagement, call recording, CRM and other sales technology platforms
* Monitor for effective use of sales technology and work to address gaps to increase GTM team productivity
* Partner with Sales and Marketing leadership to leverage technology to execute on GTM strategies

**Competencies**

* Ability to influence: Capability to guide and influence stakeholders and team members to achieve company goals
* Analytically savvy & data driven: Proficiency in utilizing data and analytics to make informed decisions and drive business strategies
* Disciplined Execution: Detail-oriented and organized, this leader prioritizes effectively, excels at time management, and anticipates well in decision making
* Portfolio knowledge: Understands our portfolio, its features, and capabilities; positions effectively with customers & prospects
* Sales content management: Manages sales content to support and enhance sales and marketing initiatives

**General Qualifications:**

* Self-starter with a proactive and independent work style
* Strong discipline and ability to execute consistently
* Comfortable with technology across various platforms (not limited to specific software)
* Hybrid role: required to be in office at our HQ (Tampa, FL) - 3x a week

**For Candidates with a Higher Education Background:**

* 3+ years of teaching experience at any grade level
* Experience using technology in the classroom or supporting tech rollouts at the school or district level
* Demonstrated ability to adapt and apply skills in new environments

**For Candidates with a Sales Background (BDR/SDR or BDR Manager preferred):**

* 1+ years of experience in a sales role
* Familiarity with go-to-market (GTM) tech tools such as Outreach, Gong, Sales Navigator, LinkedIn, etc.
* Proven ability to leverage sales tools to enhance process efficiency and drive results

**Nice to have qualifications:**

* Go-to-market tech tools: Specifically in Outreach and Salesforce
* Private Equity and/or Start Up Experience

**Location**: Tampa, FL  
**In office requirement:** 3 days a week

***While we offer flexibility, this role includes an expectation of being onsite three days a week in our Tampa office to support team alignment and cross-functional collaboration.***

**Why Advantive?**

* Culture of Growth: We don’t hire to fill seats—we hire to develop talent. You’ll be supported like an athlete, coached like a leader, and challenged like a builder.
* Career Acceleration: Many of our best leaders started in frontline roles like this one. We believe in moving fast and promoting from within.
* Real Impact: You’re not a cog in the machine here. Your work helps real businesses that keep supply chains, manufacturing lines, and entire industries running.

**All Posts:**

Artificial intelligence (AI) technology may be used during the hiring process to record, transcribe, analyze, and rank interview responses. By submitting your application and participating in the interview process, you acknowledge and consent to the use of AI technology in the hiring process.

**Interview Process:**

We believe in identifying a strong fit between our company and our employees and supporting a culture of creative problem solving and innovation. To that extent, if selected for next steps, you will be invited to complete a series of assessments that focus on aptitude and personality prior to a recruiter interview. Everyone at the company from early career all the way to CEO has taken these assessments. The assessment email will be coming from a no-reply email address via our ATS (Hirebridge), so please be on the lookout!

  

**Warning!** Advantive does not make job offers without conducting face-to-face (including virtual) interviews and will never ask you for money and/or personal information such as Social Security or bank information during the interview process.
  
  
Job scams have been reported against many companies. For more information, please visit: **FTC Job Scams**.

title: Director of Distribution Sales, Americas - Remote USA
description:
Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions. They rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver unprecedented progress. With double-digit growth year over year, no provider is better positioned to deliver scalable outcomes than Extreme.

Inclusion is one of our core values and in our DNA. We are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace that embraces our differences and creates an atmosphere where all our employees thrive because of their differences, not in spite of them.

Become part of Something big with Extreme! As a global networking leader, learn why there’s no better time to join the Extreme team.

The Americas Sales Director of Distribution is responsible for leading and executing the distribution sales strategy across North, Central, and South America. This role will focus on driving revenue growth through strategic distribution partners, optimizing channel performance, and aligning with Extreme Networks’ go-to-market initiatives. The ideal candidate will have deep experience in channel sales, distribution management, and a strong understanding of the networking technology landscape.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Develop and execute the Americas distribution strategy aligned with corporate objectives.
* Build and maintain executive-level relationships with key distribution partners.
* Collaborate with regional sales leaders to ensure alignment and execution of joint business plans.
* Drive revenue growth through distribution-led initiatives and partner enablement.
* Identify and recruit new distribution partners to expand market reach.
* Monitor and analyze sales performance metrics to optimize partner productivity.
* Manage quarterly business reviews (QBRs) with distributors and internal stakeholders.
* Ensure accurate forecasting, pipeline management, and reporting.
* Oversee MDF (Market Development Funds) planning and ROI tracking.
* Work closely with marketing, product management, and customer success teams to support partner success.
* Align with global distribution and channel programs to ensure consistency and scalability.
* Ensure sales forecasting excellence through accurate, data-driven projections and collaboration with finance and operations teams.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or related field (MBA preferred).
* 10+ years of experience in channel sales or distribution management in the networking or IT industry.
* Proven track record of exceeding sales targets and managing multi-million-dollar distribution relationships.
* Strong understanding of the networking technology ecosystem (LAN, WLAN, SD-WAN, cloud networking).
* Excellent leadership, communication, and negotiation skills.
* Ability to travel up to 50% across the Americas.

**Preferred Skills**

* Experience with Extreme Networks solutions or similar enterprise networking vendors.
* Bilingual (English and Spanish or Portuguese) is a plus.
* Familiarity with Salesforce, Tableau, PRM tools, and data analytics/AI platforms.

**Why Join Extreme Networks?**

* Work with cutting-edge cloud networking technologies.
* Be part of a collaborative, innovative, and inclusive culture.
* Competitive compensation, benefits, and career development opportunities.

Extreme Networks, Inc. (EXTR) creates effortless networking experiences that enable all of us to advance. We push the boundaries of technology leveraging the powers of machine learning, artificial intelligence, analytics, and automation. Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions and rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before. For more information, visit Extreme's website or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook.

*We encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. Come Advance with us! In keeping with our values, no employee or applicant will face discrimination/harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination/harassment based on “protected categories,” Extreme Networks also strives to prevent other, subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (e.g., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our organization. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Extreme Networks.*
company_description: For nearly 25 years, Extreme Networks has been helping customers to advance their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before.

title: Sales Technology & Analytics Lead
description:
RQM+ is *The* MedTech CRO, accelerating innovation to patient impact. Our tailored solutions deliver regulatory and quality expertise, FDA-recognized laboratory services, clinical trials, and reimbursement strategies across device types and therapeutic areas to bring life-changing technologies to patients — faster, safer, better.

We don’t make MedTech. We make MedTech happen.

Our experienced teams are cohesive, collaborative, and proactive, constantly seeking to improve and evolve while remaining laser-focused on customer success. RQM+ elevates the MedTech experience through best-in-class service and clear, concise communication. We serve as an extension of our customers establishing and maintaining excellent client and site relationships and providing direct access to our technology platforms for real-time data and study transparency

The Sales Technology & Analytics Lead is responsible for owning and optimizing the Salesforce ecosystem to support commercial effectiveness and delivering strategic insights to senior and executive leadership. This role bridges technology and strategy, delivering dashboards, high-impact reporting, and sales intelligence tools that enable data-driven decisions and revenue growth.

### **Primary Responsibilities:**

* Develop and maintain dashboards, KPIs, and sales analytics reporting to track performance against commercial goals.
* Ensure the accuracy and cleanliness of Salesforce and related systems through structured governance, data audits, and user support.
* Partner with Sales Leadership to support forecasting, pipeline reviews, and territory/account planning.
* Maintain and enhance sales process documentation, onboarding materials, and operating procedures in coordination with Client Solutions, Marketing, and Finance.
* Identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies in the sales cycle; work cross-functionally to implement solutions and tools to streamline processes.
* Partner with Marketing to ensure seamless handoffs of marketing-qualified leads and consistent tracking of lead conversions.
* Coordinate reporting on conference leads, proposal timelines, and opportunity status with the Proposals & Contracts team.
* Provide structured support to Inside Sales and Field Sales through reporting, process standardization, and salesforce hygiene initiatives.
* Facilitate training for sales systems and tools and serve as a go-to resource for best practices and troubleshooting.
* Collaborate with Finance and Proposals to support incentive plan tracking and ensure data alignment across teams.

### **Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, communications, or a related field
* 5+ years’ experience with Salesforce or CRM systems in a commercial operation or reporting role within sales enablement.
* Salesforce Administrator certification required; Sales Cloud or CRM Analytics certifications preferred.
* Proven track record of delivering board-level reporting and commercial analytics.
* Experience working cross-functionally to drive data-informed decision-making at a leadership level.
* Demonstrated project management skills with the ability to set, pursue, and achieve results within set timelines.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
* Creative and innovative thinker, bringing fresh ideas and perspectives.
* Self-starter with the ability to work independently and in teams and to collaborate effectively to achieve common goals.
* An inquisitive mindset with a strong commitment to fostering outstanding internal and external customer experiences.
* Highly organized, managing multiple priorities with efficiency, effectiveness, and attention to detail.
* Ability to understand the bigger picture and how people, processes, and technology connect.
* Flexible and adaptable, thriving in a fast-paced and evolving work environment.
* Excellent organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate ideas and influence others effectively.
* Must be willing to travel, up to 25%.

### **Behaviors:**

* Customer Focus, Strong Written and Verbal Skills, Action-Oriented, Approachability, Building Effective Teams, Business Acumen, Career Ambition, Composure, Courage (Managerial), Decision Quality, Informing, Integrity & Trust, Interpersonal Savvy, Planning, Multi-Tasking, Flexible / Adaptable and Analytical

### **Supervisory Responsibilities:**

* This position does not have supervisory responsibilities.

### **Work Environment/Physical Demands**

* This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers and filing cabinets. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. The employee is occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must frequently lift or move objects up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift or move objects up to 25 pounds.

Being an industry leader in Medtech is just the beginning for RQM+. We consider our employees our biggest asset and we invest heavily in ongoing learning and development. Providing a rewarding place to work is rooted deep in our core values. From an industry leading compensation package to a deeply engrained focus on work life balance, RQM+ has a unique offering for regulatory and quality professionals. At RQM+, you are not just another employee, you are a member of RQM+ family. Make your impact today!

We invite you to apply if you have an interest in learning more about our organization and beginning your journey with us.

**Job Opportunity Verification**

At RQM+, we prioritize the security of our job applicants. To ensure a safe application process:

All legitimate RQM+ job opportunities are listed on our official careers page: rqmplus.com/careers

Every candidate going through the interview process will participate in a voice and/or video interview.

Exercise caution with unsolicited job offers or requests for sensitive information.

title: Internship: Sales Operations
description:
At Summit, we're on the lookout for talent that doesn't just think "outside the box," but brings their own unique perspective to the table. With our relentless pursuit of excellence and curiosity, we lead innovation in our industry. We humanize technology by actively listening to our clients, crafting tailored proposals, and delivering on the promise of technology with precision and purpose.

Are you detail-oriented, organized, and excited by the behind-the-scenes work that helps sales teams thrive? Summit is seeking a Sales Operations Intern to support our sales and partner organizations as they execute go-to-market strategies for our technology managed services. This role offers hands-on experience in CRM management, sales enablement, order tracking, and cross-functional coordination.

### **What You’ll Do:**

* Maintain and update customer, opportunity, and partner data in CRM or PRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot)
* Assist the sales team in preparing and submitting proposals, RFP responses, and supporting documentation
* Support partner and revenue operations through order tracking, reporting, and data management
* Help streamline backend processes that support sales, marketing, and partner success
* Coordinate day-to-day administrative tasks across departments including sales, finance, and marketing
* Follow up on low-value client inquiries and ensure accurate documentation across systems
* Contribute to data cleanup efforts, report generation, and process improvements
* Gain exposure to sales tools, partner ecosystems, and revenue operations best practices

### **What You’ll Learn:**

* How sales operations fuel go-to-market strategies in a high-growth tech company
* The importance of accurate data and systems in supporting sales execution
* Real-world experience with CRM and PRM platforms like Salesforce and HubSpot
* Cross-functional collaboration across sales, marketing, finance, and partner teams
* Best practices in sales administration, reporting, and operational efficiency
* The role of sales operations in scaling B2B service delivery

### **What We’re Looking For:**

* Bachelor’s degree (completed or in progress) in Business, Marketing, Administration, or a related field
* 1+ years of experience in sales operations, order management, or administrative support (preferred but not required for interns)
* Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* A proactive, team-oriented mindset with a strong willingness to learn
* Familiarity with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce or HubSpot)
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
* Basic understanding of technology services or B2B environments

### **Preferred Skills:**

* Familiarity with CRM systems like Salesforce or HubSpot
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
* Basic understanding of technology services or B2B environments
* Prior experience in administrative support, customer service, or sales (preferred but not required)

### **Internship Details:**

* **Commitment:** 15-20 hours per week during the academic year, with the option to increase to full-time during summer.
* **Duration:** 6-9 months, flexible based on availability.
* **Compensation:** $19 - $24 per hour

### **At Summit, our culture and core values are important to us. As a diverse team of passionate pathfinders, we deliver on the promise of technology. If this sparks your interest, we'd love to chat with you!**

* Empower our people
* Constant elevation
* Customer first
* Focus on outcomes
* Embrace curiosity

Summit is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Summit is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

As part of this commitment, Summit will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let us know.

title: Business Quality Systems Analyst
description:
Since 1869 we've connected people through food they love. We’re proud to be stewards of amazing brands that people trust. Our portfolio includes the iconic Campbell’s brand, as well as Michael Angelo’s, Pace, Pacific Foods, Prego, Rao’s Homemade, Swanson, and V8. In our Snacks division, we have brands like Cape Cod, Goldfish, Kettle Brand, Lance, Late July, Pepperidge Farm, Snack Factory, and Snyder’s of Hanover.

Here, you will make a difference every day. You will be supported to build a rewarding career with opportunities to grow, innovate and inspire. Make history with us.

Why Campbell’s…

* Benefits begin on day one and include medical, dental, short and long-term disability, AD&D, and life insurance (for individual, families, and domestic partners).
* Employees are eligible for our matching 401(k) plan and can enroll on the first day of employment with immediate vesting.
* Campbell’s offers unlimited sick time along with paid time off and holiday pay.
* If in WHQ – free access to the fitness center. Access to on-site day care (operated by Bright Horizons) and company store.
* Giving back to the communities where our employees work and live is very important to Campbell’s. Our “Campbell’s Cares” program matches employee donations and/or volunteer activity up to $1,500 annually.
* Campbell’s has a variety of Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to support employees.

How you will make history here…

* This position supports the Corporate Quality Assurance team. The incumbent will support various QA systems, programs and multiple aspects of product/technical data management, documentation and communication of details to our internal and external partners. Individual will work in close collaboration with internal subject matter experts in Quality, Product Development, Packaging, Regulatory Affairs, Analytical/Micro labs.
* The role is responsible for identifying, strengthening and supporting implementation of process and system solutions for our QA, Corporate, and manufacturing plant end users.

What you will do…

* Participate in designing solutions within various QMS to meet business needs, take a lead role in implementing and maintaining these solutions within the system
* Optimize various systems configurations for efficient execution of processes and teams' enablement
* Supervision of technical data management programs and practices that control, protect, deliver and enhance the value of data and information assets.
* Ensure relevant product data and documentation managed in multiple systems (Optiva, SharePoint, SAP, eQMS) is aligned. Resolve issues regarding conflicting information between the systems.
* Drive continuous improvement in material data management processes through collaboration with the broader Supply Chain teams.
* Serve as one of the primary contacts for SAP QM support/ eQMS/ LIMS
* Business process optimization including: enhanced system and process effectiveness and efficiency by understanding the commercialization process and roles and responsibilities and critical data within these processes for our manufacturing facilities.
* Document new/modified work processes/ workflows and communicate to broader team and internal/external customers.
* Responsible for conducting annual audits across all systems to ensure compliance to control. Deliver process or systems training, provide end user support. Demonstrate understanding of systems integrations and schemas

* Analyze information needs and functional requirements to address business inefficiencies and support operational objectives.
* Collaborate effectively with technical subject matter experts to gather accurate and comprehensive information as needed.
* Skilled in synthesizing data from multiple cross-functional sources to create clear, concise, and actionable summaries.
* Proficient in executing key administrative functions within various digital Quality Management Systems (QMS) and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platforms

Who you will work with…

* Enterprise position, Quality and would work with both snacks and beverages

What you bring to the table…

* Bachelor’s Degree.
* 3 + years of relevant experience in a Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) environment

It would be great to have…

* Bachelor’s Degree in a scientific discipline; a concentration in Computer Science or a related field is a plus.
* 5 + years of relevant experience in a Food or Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) environment, with a focus on administering digital quality tools, preferably within food manufacturing.
* Demonstrated ability to leverage system knowledge to organize and streamline technical documentation of business processes for improved efficiency; proven skills in evaluating processes and identifying opportunities for simplification.
* Strong computer proficiency, including expertise in Microsoft Office and experience with SQL databases, RMS, SAP, Veeva, SharePoint, Zendesk, or similar Quality Management System (QMS) and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platforms. Experience with permissions management is preferred.
* Highly proficient in independent planning and prioritization.
* Experienced in designing systematic workflows to address business needs using tools such as Visio, Lucidchart, Canva, or similar.
* Skilled in information gathering and documentation.
* Strong critical thinking, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.

Compensation and Benefits:

The target base salary range for this full-time, salaried position is between

$71,500-$102,800

Individual base pay depends on work location and additional factors such as experience, job-related skills, and relevant education or training. Total pay may include other forms of compensation. In addition, we offer competitive health, dental, 401k and wellness benefits beginning on the first day of employment. Please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner for more information about our total rewards package.

The Company is committed to providing equal opportunity for employees and qualified applicants in all aspects of the employment relationship, including consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, marital status, protected veteran status, disability, age, religion, or any other classification protected by law.
company_description: Since 1869, we’ve been connecting people through food they love. Our history was created by remarkable people, ideas and innovations. We have a focused strategy and leading brands across our divisions

title: Manager, Human Resources Planning and Support CALA
description:
**Additional Information**  
**Job Number**25097830  
**Job Category**Human Resources  
**Location**CALA Regional Office, 1200 S. Pine Island Road, Plantation, Florida, United States, 33324  
**Schedule**Full Time  
**Located Remotely?**N  
**Position Type** Management

**JOB SUMMARY**

The Manager, HR Planning & Support is a key contributor to the strategic and operational success of the Human Resources function in the Caribbean and Latin America (CALA) region. Reporting to the Sr. Director of Human Resources, this role is responsible for leading cross-functional HR initiatives through effective project management, while also supporting HR analytics and technology enablement. With a focus on both execution and continuous improvement, the manager will coordinate complex projects, deliver data-driven insights, and collaborate with internal stakeholders to enhance HR systems, processes, and overall efficiency.

**CANDIDATE PROFILE**

**Education and Experience**

*Required*

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Hospitality, or a related field. Degrees in quantitative disciplines also accepted (finance, data science, engineering, economics, mathematics, statistics, etc.)
* 3+ years of experience in HR, analytics, or project management roles.
* Strong analytical background, with hands-on experience using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or SQL.
* Demonstrated project management experience, including planning, stakeholder management, and execution.
* Fluency in Spanish and English, with knowledge of Portuguese being an advantage.

*Preferred*

* Graduate degree or certification in a related field (e.g., MBA, HR Management, PMP).
* Experience working with HR systems and data (e.g., Oracle HCM, OAC, or similar platforms).
* Experience in hospitality or global/matrixed organizations.

**CORE WORK ACTIVITIES**

**Project Management**

* Lead/support HR PMO initiatives, ensuring projects are delivered on time and aligned with regional priorities.
* Provide end-to-end project management support, including scoping, planning, scheduling, and stakeholder communication.
* Serve as the HR representative for project status updates and report-outs.
* Develop presentations, executive-level reports, and communications for key HR initiatives and leadership updates.

**HR Analytics**

* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that track HR metrics and measure program outcomes.
* Provide consultative support to HR Leaders and other Centers of Excellence (COEs) on data inquiries and HR-related projects.
* Ability to analyze key metrics (demographics, turnover, time to fill, performance, etc.) to measure success and drive decision-making.
* Development of predictive HR analytics model and metrics to identify likelihood of future outcomes.
* Synthesize complex data into summary views. Extract and identify trends, themes, and drivers. Present finding intuitively to stakeholders.
* Work closely with cross-functional partners to develop new reports and solutions.
* Ability to respond to time-sensitive and confidential data requests with a quick turnaround.

**Process Improvement & HR Technology Enablement**

* Serve as a liaison between Continent HR and Global HR for the implementation and optimization of HR technology systems and tools.
* Identify opportunities for process improvements and support continuous improvement efforts across HR operations.
* May represent CALA HR in various calls and meetings with Continent and Corporate stakeholders.

The salary range for this position is $73,800 to $119,300 annually. Marriott offers a bonus program, comprehensive health care benefits, 401(k) plan with up to 5% company match, employee stock purchase plan at 15% discount, accrued paid time off (including sick leave where applicable), life insurance, group disability insurance, travel discounts, adoption assistance, paid parental leave, health savings account (except for positions based out of or performed in Hawaii), flexible spending accounts, tuition assistance, pre-tax commuter benefits, other life and work wellness benefits, and may include other incentives such as stock awards and deferred compensation plans. Benefits and incentive compensation may be subject to generally applicable eligibility, waiting period, contribution, and other requirements and conditions.  
  
The compensation and benefits information is provided as of the date of this posting. Marriott reserves the right to modify compensation and benefits at any time, with or without notice, subject to applicable law.

*Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.*

Marriott International is the world’s largest hotel company, with more brands, more hotels and more opportunities for associates to grow and succeed. **Be** where you can do your best work, **begin** your purpose, **belong** to an amazing global team, and **become** the best version of you.

title: Corporate and Foundation Relations Officer
description:
The Urban Land Institute (ULI) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit research and education organization supported by its members. Founded in 1936, the Institute has more than 48,000 members worldwide representing the entire spectrum of land use and real estate development disciplines, working in private enterprise and public service. As the preeminent, multidisciplinary real estate forum, ULI facilitates the open exchange of ideas, information, and experience among local, regional, national, and international industry leaders and policy makers dedicated to creating better places. The mission of ULI is to shape the future of the built environment for transformative impact in communities worldwide.

**POSITION SUMMARY**

The Corporate and Foundation Relations Officer is responsible for identifying, securing, and stewarding institutional philanthropic support to advance ULI’s mission. This role manages the full lifecycle of institutional fundraising—from researching prospective funders to drafting proposals, overseeing submissions, and preparing impact reports. Serving as a key member of the ULI Foundation team, this position also supports cross-functional collaboration across the organization, with a specific focus on national and global fundraising efforts that require coordination across ULI business units and geographies. The Officer provides leadership in grant writing strategy and ensures proposal quality and consistency across the Advancement team.

The role is hybrid, with in-office presence required three days per week at ULI’s headquarters on L Street in Washington, DC. Occasional travel for events or donor meetings is also expected.

**ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Funder Research & Qualification**

* Identify and evaluate potential foundation and corporate funding partners.
* Analyze funder priorities, guidelines, and giving history to support alignment with ULI initiatives.

**Proposal Strategy & Development**

* Write persuasive, high-quality proposals, letters of inquiry (LOIs), and supporting documentation.
* Tailor content to specific funder interests while clearly articulating ULI’s impact and goals.

**Grants Lifecycle & Pipeline Management**

* Manage timelines and submission processes to ensure timely delivery of grant materials.
* Track proposal status and maintain organized records of communications and outcomes.
* Maintain accurate grant records in CRM and tracking systems.
* Generate reports to monitor grant success rates, pipeline progress, and overall fundraising performance.

**Budget Development & Financial Alignment**

* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop accurate, funder-compliant proposal budgets.
* Align financial narratives with project goals and ensure clarity and transparency.

**Internal Coordination & Donor Communication**

* Liaise with internal teams, including program staff and leadership, to align proposals with programmatic needs.
* Serve as a central point of contact for institutional donor-related communications.

**Monitoring, Reporting & Stewardship**

* Prepare compelling narrative and financial reports to demonstrate impact and fulfill funder requirements.
* Coordinate internally to collect program data and outcomes for effective reporting.
* Develop long-term relationships with institutional funders to support multi-year commitments and renewals.

**Advancement Team Enablement & Proposal Quality Assurance**

* Provide tools, guidance, and best practices for proposal development across the Advancement team.
* Review all team-generated proposals to ensure accuracy, clarity, and alignment with ULI standards.
* Develop and maintain internal templates, training materials, and tools to support consistent, high-quality proposal development across the team.

**Institutional Collaboration & Global Integration**

* Lead cross-functional proposal efforts that span national and international business units.
* Ensure cohesive messaging and coordinated engagement across departments and geographies.
* Coordinate with District Councils, and partners to support collaborative or pooled grant opportunities that align with shared priorities.

**OTHER KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Perform other duties as requested by the Vice President or Chief Fundraising Officer.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
* 5-7 years of experience in institutional fundraising, grant writing, or foundation relations.
* Proven track record of securing funding from corporate and foundation donors.
* Excellent writing, editing, budgeting, and project management skills.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills; ability to collaborate across teams.
* Familiarity with donor databases, CRM platforms, and proposal tracking systems.

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* Experience in the nonprofit, urban planning, sustainability, or real estate sectors.
* Familiarity with funder compliance requirements and grant administration best practices.
* Experience supporting global or multi-regional fundraising initiatives.

**Working Conditions & Compensation**

* **Salary Range:** $ 106,000 – $120,000, commensurate with experience
* **Location:** Hybrid role based in Washington, DC – three days per week in-office required
* Periodic travel to headquarters and occasional travel to donor meetings or conferences
* Ability to lift up to 30 lbs. and support event logistics as needed

**APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:**

If you are passionate about advancing the mission of a respected global organization and thrive in a collaborative, high-impact environment, we encourage you to apply follow the link. Please submit a résumé and a letter of interest/cover letter.

ULI is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion/creed, sex, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, veteran or active military status, non-citizenship or citizenship status, arrest or conviction record, credit history, salary history, caregiver status, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or partnership status, familial status, unemployment status, status as a victim of domestic violence or sexual violence, or any other status protected by applicable law.

EOE/m/f/d/v. No relocation reimbursement is offered at this time.
company_description: ULI's Mission:The Urban Land Institute provides leadership in the responsible use of land and in creating and sustaining thriving communitie

title: Health Plan Lead Sales Solutions Engineer
description:
*Together we fight for everyone’s opportunity for a better financial future.*

We will do this together — with customers, partners and colleagues. We will fight for others, not against: We will stand up for and champion everyone’s access to opportunities. The status quo is not good enough … we believe every individual and every community deserves access to financial opportunities. We are determined to support both individuals and communities in reaching a better financial future. We know that reaching this future depends on our actions today.

Like our Purpose Statement, Voya believes in being bold and committed to action. We are committed to a work environment where the differences that we are born with — and those we acquire throughout our lives — are understood, valued and intentionally pursued. We believe that our employees own our culture and have a responsibility to foster an environment where we all feel comfortable bringing our whole selves to work. Purposefully bringing our differences together to positively influence our culture, serve our clients and enrich our communities is essential to our vision.

Are you ready to join a company with a strong purpose and a winning culture? Start your Voyage – Apply Now

Get to Know the Opportunity:

The Health Plan Lead Solutions Engineer is focused on supporting the pre-sales process, delivering compelling product demonstrations, and weaving a strong narrative that aligns with the customer’s strategic goals. You will work closely with the Account Executive plus senior-level stakeholders, translating complex technical capabilities into clear business value propositions. This includes scoping and working with the Product/Delivery teams to ensure success implementation of the defined end-end solution. The ideal candidate will have at least 10 years of experience in similar capacity.

*Please Note:* *Work location for this role is FLEXIBLE! This position allows 100% remote work from home or allows work to be performed in any of our major office locations with a hybrid schedule.*

The Contributions You’ll Make:

* Act as the lead technical representative during the pre-sales process for our Enterprise/Health Plan Business, defining the scope and end-end solution, delivering product demos and managing necessary coordination with internal and external stakeholders.
* Deliver high-impact product demonstrations that address customer needs and align with their strategic business objectives
* Leverage your storytelling skills to craft and deliver a narrative that resonates with senior-level decision-makers and highlights Benefitfocus' unique value proposition
* Translate customer requirements into scoped solutions and work alongside technical teams to ensure successful implementations
* Work in a challenging, fast-paced environment to provide expert knowledge of our software products and implementation methodology
* Assess the need and develop the technical solutions necessary to support the effective sales enablement of channel partners
* Collaborate closely with the sales, product, customer success, and marketing teams to refine product messaging, demos, and collateral that target senior-level audiences
* Mentor and guide other Solution Consultants to improve their demo skills and ability to engage with senior decision-makers
* Travel up to 25% in support of partner engagements
* Assist in the completion of functional and technical responses for RFI/ RFP’s and develop partner capabilities to effectively respond
* Other duties as assigned

Minimum Knowledge & Experience:

* Experience demonstrating complex application functionality and designing customer-specific software solutions for large enterprise deals
* 10+ years experience selling both software products and services to health plans, other enterprise organizations and/or to the group benefits space
* Experience supporting strategic partners and developing relationships.
* Knowledge of enterprise-level software technology, including server hardware, networking, web applications, electronic data exchange, and service -oriented architectures
* Strong consultative, analytical, and communication skills needed to listen to, understand, and anticipate client needs (business and IT)
* Passion for technology and for being a part of a fast-growing SaaS startup where we move quickly and wear many hats
* Flexible approach, able to operate effectively with uncertainty and change
* Driven, self-motivated, enthusiastic and with a “can do” attitude
* BS/BA degree or equivalent experience in computer software or systems. Computer Science or Computer Engineering degree preferred, or substitute degree/experience in human resources, employee benefits, or healthcare.

#LI-LH1

#Remote

Compensation Pay Disclosure:

Voya is committed to pay that’s fair and equitable, which means comparable pay for comparable roles and responsibilities.

The below annual base salary range reflects the expected hiring range(s) for this position in the location(s) listed. In addition to base salary, Voya may offer incentive opportunities (i.e., annual cash incentives, sales incentives, and/or long-term incentives) based on the role to reward the achievement of annual performance objectives. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations, and refers to the amount Voya Financial is willing to pay at the time of this posting.

Actual compensation offered may vary from the posted salary range based upon the candidate’s geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer. Salaries for part-time roles will be prorated based upon the agreed upon number of hours to be regularly worked.

$145,470 - $181,840 USD

Be Well. Stay Well.

What We Offer

title: Training & Exercises Specialist (HSEEP) / Federal Experience / J7
description:
**Job Type:** Contractor  
**Location:** Remote with potential for occasional travel (as required by contract)  
**Clearance Level:** Public Trust or ability to obtain

### **About Blueprint Creative Group**

Blueprint is a fast-growing mission-aligned program execution partner delivering operational readiness, innovation enablement, health logistics, and theater-scale operational support across health security, defense, homeland security, and technology transformation domains.  
  
Customers include Army Medical Command, Army National Guard, NASA, Department of Energy, U.S. Trade and Development Agency as well as state and local government.

### **Core Responsibilities:**

* Lead or support the planning, execution, and after-action processes for HSEEP-compliant exercises (Tabletop, Functional, and Full-Scale).
* Develop and facilitate exercise planning meetings, player handbooks, MSELs, and evaluation guides.
* Conduct needs assessments, gap analyses, and improvement plan tracking (IPTs).
* Engage stakeholders across federal, state, and local jurisdictions to coordinate multi-agency exercises.
* Draft After Action Reports (AARs) with actionable findings and recommendations.
* Ensure exercises align with agency-specific continuity of operations (COOP), public health preparedness, and homeland security priorities.
* Support federal clients with exercise compliance, documentation, and readiness assessments.

### **Key Competencies & Tools:**

* **HSEEP Expertise:** Deep understanding of FEMA's Homeland Security Exercise and Evaluation Program.
* **Public Health & Emergency Preparedness Knowledge:** Familiarity with CDC's PHEP capabilities, ASPR guidelines, and FEMA mission areas.
* **Project Management:** Strong planning, logistics, and stakeholder coordination skills; familiarity with Microsoft Project or Smartsheet.
* **Evaluation and Reporting:** Skilled in AAR/IP development, corrective action tracking, and performance measurement.
* **Stakeholder Engagement:** Able to build trust and coordinate across multidisciplinary government teams.
* **Technical Tools:** Proficiency in tools such as Microsoft 365, Adobe Acrobat, Miro, and virtual facilitation platforms (ZoomGov, MS Teams).

### **Federal Classification Series Match:**

* **GS Equivalent:** GS-0301 (Misc. Administration and Program), GS-0343 (Management and Program Analyst), or GS-0601 (Health Program Specialist)

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s in Emergency Management, Public Health, Homeland Security, or related field.
* HSEEP Certification (FEMA Emergency Management Institute)
* Experience working with HHS, CDC, FEMA, or DoD exercise programs.
* Familiarity with federal contracting environments and performance-based contracting.

### **Performance Expectations (Bench Readiness):**

This role will be part of Blueprint’s **Operational Readiness & Exercises Contractor Bench**, with expectations for:

* Rapid response availability during surge periods
* Clear deliverable-based tasking with timelines and milestones
* Integration into Blueprint’s SOP and contract scorecard systems
* Participation in Blueprint onboarding and contract-readiness review

title: Briefing Program Manager – Sunnyvale Executive Briefing Center (Hybrid, Sunnyvale)
description:
As a global leader in cybersecurity, CrowdStrike protects the people, processes and technologies that drive modern organizations. Since 2011, our mission hasn’t changed — we’re here to stop breaches, and we’ve redefined modern security with the world’s most advanced AI-native platform. Our customers span all industries, and they count on CrowdStrike to keep their businesses running, their communities safe and their lives moving forward. We’re also a mission-driven company. We cultivate a culture that gives every CrowdStriker both the flexibility and autonomy to own their careers. We’re always looking to add talented CrowdStrikers to the team who have limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to our customers, our community and each other. Ready to join a mission that matters? The future of cybersecurity starts with you.

About the Role:

As a Briefing Program Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the customer experience at CrowdStrike’s Executive Briefing Center (EBC) in Sunnyvale. You’ll collaborate closely with the Office of the CTO, Sales, Product, AV/IT, Facilities, and Marketing teams to deliver tailored, high-impact executive briefings that align to our customers’ strategic goals. From briefing intake to execution and follow-up, you’ll be a key partner in delivering meaningful engagements that deepen relationships and accelerate pipeline.  
  
You’ll work as part of a small, high-performing team supporting CrowdStrike’s most strategic customer engagements. This is an onsite role based in Sunnyvale, CA, and requires an onsite presence during customer briefings.

Why This Role Matters:

CrowdStrike’s Executive Briefing Center is more than a space — it’s a platform for strategic conversations and lasting relationships. In this role, you’ll help design and deliver these moments, shaping how the world’s most influential companies experience CrowdStrike.

What You’ll Do:

* Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned briefings, partnering with the Office of the CTO and account teams to assess customer needs and objectives.
* Customize briefing agendas that align with strategic goals, coordinating with internal teams to secure the right executives, SMEs, and content.
* Lead pre-brief planning calls, provide guidance to discussion leaders, and ensure all participants are prepared and aligned.
* Host and facilitate briefings, delivering a polished and professional experience for customers and internal stakeholders alike.
* Review content and speaker flow, offering feedback to ensure relevance, consistency, and impact across sessions.
* Maintain briefing systems and tools—scheduling, updating agendas, capturing meeting notes, and tracking follow-ups in collaboration with account teams.
* Document customer feedback and insights post-briefing, identifying opportunities and sharing learnings to inform future engagements and strategy.
* Support the continuous improvement of briefing experiences by partnering with your team on process enhancements, templates, and special projects.
* Collaborate closely with the Briefing Center Manager, Briefing Coordinator, and extended teams to ensure every touchpoint — from physical environment to personalized moments — meets the highest standards.
* Coordinate with external partners (e.g., catering, gifting vendors, hospitality services) to ensure consistent and high-quality delivery.
* Continuously identify opportunities to enhance the on-site customer journey through thoughtful details that surprise and delight.
* Track briefing volume, attendee satisfaction, and post-briefing outcomes in partnership with the broader Executive Programs team to inform continuous improvement.

What You’ll Need:

We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, customer-first environment and is passionate about delivering premium experiences. While you may not have deep expertise in every area below, you’re excited to grow and contribute meaningfully.

*Minimum Qualifications:*

* 5–7 years of experience in customer programs, customer briefings, executive engagement, event planning, sales enablement, or marketing roles.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a professional and engaging presence.
* Confident working with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels, including Sales, Product, Marketing, and Executives.
* High attention to detail and ability to manage multiple briefings and timelines simultaneously.
* Strong organizational, problem-solving, and project management capabilities.
* Customer-obsessed, with a passion for creating meaningful, personalized experiences.
* Comfortable working cross-functionally and collaboratively with operational teammates to ensure the full customer experience — from strategic agenda to environmental details — is cohesive and elevated.
* BA/BS degree or equivalent relevant work experience.
* Must be based in the Sunnyvale area and available to host briefings in person.

title: Senior Software Product Manager - QualityOS
description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.

**ABOUT THE TEAM**

QualityOS, a team within ArsenalOS, is responsible for building software that upholds the highest standard of quality for our customer-ready hardware. Quality is one of the three primary Operating Systems in the ArsenalOS landscape, and it is served by an ever-evolving suite of software solutions to facilitate inspections, dispositions, root causes, and corrective actions that happen throughout the production lifecycle. We are looking for an experienced Software Product Manager to own and elevate the experiences that support our Quality customers.

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

As a Senior Software Product Manager for QualOS, you will be responsible for a combination of Quality Engineering tools and how they support end user workflows and integrate with the rest of Anduril’s business systems. You will be responsible for:

* Developing a long-term strategy that navigates complex product tradeoffs, integration dependencies, and buy versus build scenarios to ultimately push the entire Systems Engineering domain forward
* Building a holistic solution that empowers end users to complete their work effectively and efficiently while ensuring authoritative controls and full end-to-end traceability across domains
* Partner with Quality Technicians, Quality Engineers, and Reliability Engineers to develop and implement tooling strategies both short and long term vision, managing their requirements and synthesizing them into a prioritized backlog
* Communicating across stakeholders and interested parties on QualOS development and roadmap
* Driving adoption and enablement of QualOS solutions across Anduril business lines and divisions

Product Strategy

* You can “see around the corner'” for your product, crafting the vision, high-level roadmap, and critical dependencies for 6-12 months into the future. You constantly engage with stakeholders to solicit input and buy-in, proactively communicating product goals and managing expectations for delivery. You escalate large trade offs and necessary decision points as needed. You work effectively with many internal teams to synthesize their needs, but are never afraid to make important decisions as the owner of your product.

Product Prioritization

* You work backward from your strategy to set clear outcomes for your portfolio in partnership with your engineering, design, and business partners. You will support team structures that allow prioritization of competing work within rapid development cycles. You consistently let your team flex to adapt goals when needed, based on new information.

Problem discovery and Solution Generation

* You become attached to problems, not solutions. To do this, you will seek out real-world context in the form of onsite user research, internal expert feedback, existing product data, and industry tech investigation. You will capture core workflows and translate these user needs into well-scoped requirements and success hypotheses.

Product Execution

* From design to delivery, you fill gaps wherever needed to make your well-scoped solutions a reality. You proactively communicate with internal team members and external stakeholders, approach solutions with humility and creativity in order to hit milestones, and set a high bar for the product that you own.

#### **REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Five to seven years in a software product management role
* Expertise in (1) building workflow applications for users and (2) application to application integrations using a variety of technologies
* Strong understanding of the interplay between enterprise systems, including role-based permissions, governance and controls, data authorities, and traceability
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to balance requirements across engineering, design, data, and business stakeholders
* Comfortable working with internal and external stakeholders, across a wide range of technical comfort
* Demonstrated success decomposing a problem into addressable component parts and arranging the correct sequencing
* Proven ability to “see around corners” by crafting product strategy for 6-12 months into the future
* Comfort in maturing a product from MVP to enterprise-grade production
* Must be able to travel up to 25% of the time
* Eligible to obtain and maintain an active U.S. security clearance

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* 2+ years experience in or supporting a Quality Engineering organization
* Domain expertise within hardware-related industries (Aerospace, Defense, Automotive, Consumer Electronics etc.)
* Experience with UI / UX web design tools (e.g. Figma)

**US Salary Range**

$150,000 - $225,000 USD

The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. Highly competitive equity grants are included in the majority of full time offers; and are considered part of Anduril's total compensation package. Additionally, Anduril offers top-tier benefits for full-time employees, including:

* Platinum Healthcare Benefits:For U.S. roles, we offer comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans at little to no cost to you.
  + *For UK roles, Private Medical Insurance (PMI): Anduril will cover the full cost of the insurance premium for an employee and dependents.*
  + *For AUS roles, Private health plan through Bupa: Coverage is fully* *subsidized* *by Anduril.*
* Basic Life/AD&D and long-term disability insurance 100% covered by Anduril, plus the option to purchase additional life insurance for you and your dependents.
* Extremely generous company holiday calendar including a holiday hiatus in December, and highly competitive PTO plans.
* 16 weeks of paid Caregiver & Wellness Leave to care for a family member, bond with your baby, or tend to your own medical condition.
* Family Planning & Parenting Support: Fertility (eg, IVF, preservation), adoption, and gestational carrier coverage with additional benefits and resources to provide support from planning to parenting.
* Mental Health Resources: We provide free mental health resources 24/7 including therapy, life coaching, and more. Additional work-life services, such as free legal and financial support, available to you as well.
* A professional development stipend is available to all Andurilians.
* Daily Meals and Provisions: For many of our offices this means breakfast, lunch and fully stocked micro-kitchens.
* Company-funded commuter benefits available based on your region.
* Relocation assistance (depending on role eligibility).
* 401(k) retirement savings plan - both a traditional and Roth 401(k). *(US roles only)*

The recruiter assigned to this role can share more information about the specific compensation and benefit details associated with this role during the hiring process.

Anduril is an equal-opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. The Anduril team is made up of incredibly talented and unique individuals, who together are disrupting industry norms by creating new paths towards the future of defense technology. All qualified applicants will be treated with respect and receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, uniform service, Veteran status, age, or any other protected characteristic per federal, state, or local law, including those with a criminal history, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the CA Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. We actively encourage members of recognized minorities, women, Veterans, and those with disabilities to apply, and we work to create a welcoming and supportive environment for all applicants throughout the interview process. If you are someone passionate about working on problems that have a real-world impact, we'd love to hear from you!

title: MDU & Residential Developments Engineer
description:
**MDU & RESIDENTIAL DEVELOPMENTS ENGINEER**  
Department: Outside Plant  
Reports To: Market Development Engineer  
  
**Why Join Vero Fiber?**  
At Vero Fiber, we’re building future-ready broadband infrastructure that connects homes, neighborhoods, and entire communities. Join a fast-growing, mission-driven team where your technical expertise helps power real-world impact — delivering fast, affordable, friendly, and reliable fiber internet to the people who need it most**!**  
  
**POSITION SUMMARY**  
Vero Fiber is seeking a technically skilled and relationship-driven Fiber To The Home MDU & Residential Developments Sales Engineer to support the expansion of our Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) network into multi-dwelling units (MDUs), greenfield, and brownfield residential developments. This pre-sales role bridges the gap between the sales team, engineering, construction, and real estate developers — playing a key part in winning new development opportunities and ensuring technical feasibility and cost-effective deployment.  
  
The ideal candidate will bring a strong foundation in fiber optic networks, MDU installation strategies, and developer relations, paired with the ability to communicate technical solutions in a clear and business-savvy way.  
**RESPONSIBILITIES**  
**Pre-Sales Engineering Support**

* Partner with the Vero sales team to provide technical guidance during early engagement with property developers, builders, and HOAs.
* Assess feasibility for FTTH deployments across a variety of residential property types, including new construction and retrofits.
* Support the development of solution proposals, including high-level design, budgetary pricing, and infrastructure requirements.
* Participate in customer and developer meetings to explain proposed solutions and answer technical questions.

**Developer Engagement & Design Consultation**

* Act as the technical liaison with real estate developers and property managers to understand build requirements, timelines, and utility access needs.
* Collaborate with internal fiber engineering, ISP and OSP teams, as well as external contractors, to produce preliminary layouts, cost estimates, and scope of work documents tailored to each property.
* Guide developers through conduit pathway standards, equipment placement, and in-building wiring best practices.

**Network Architecture Alignment**

* Ensure proposed solutions align with overall network architecture, backhaul options, and Vero’s design standards for fiber infrastructure.
* Recommend value engineering approaches that reduce construction cost and complexity without compromising quality or performance.
* Identify long-term scalability options for serving additional units or phases of a development.

**Sales Enablement & Project Handoff**

* Create and maintain technical collateral, playbooks, and documentation to support the sales process.
* Track and report on pre-sales activity, developer commitments, and project pipeline metrics.
* Facilitate smooth handoff from sales to project management and construction once agreements are in place.

**CORE COMPETENCIES**  
There are several competencies required to be successful in this position. The following are some of the most important:

* Customer-focused solution design
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Technical writing and proposal development
* Cross-functional collaboration
* Strong presentation and communication skills
* Knowledge of permitting, right-of-way, and easement considerations

**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Telecommunications, Construction Management, or equivalent work experience.
* 3+ years of experience in telecom sales engineering, FTTH deployment, or broadband network consulting.
* Deep understanding of fiber optic technology, MDU construction, and outside plant (OSP) practices.
* Confident communicator capable of engaging with technical and non-technical audiences.
* Proficiency in interpreting site plans and providing high-level network design recommendations.

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* Experience supporting sales teams in a pre-construction, developer-focused environment preferred.

**JOB DETAILS AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* This role requires extensive travel up to 30-40% of time with the ability to travel to various locations to perform job duties and meet with clients, partners, and other stakeholders. Travel schedules may be predictable or variable depending on the project. This position may require you to take short trips, longer trips, or extended stays, depending on the needs of the project. Some travel may require the employee to work weekends or holidays.
* Must be authorized to work in the United States.
* Valid Driver’s license and ability to pass an MVR screen.
* This is a staff position.
* This is an Exempt position.
* This is a Full-Time position.
* This is a Remote position.
* The schedule for this position is Monday through Friday normal business hours with night or weekend availability as needed to fulfill the core duties of the role.
* This position requires the ability to sit and work at a desk for extended periods of time, using a computer and other office equipment.
* This position requires the ability to perform fine motor tasks, such as typing or using a mouse, for extended period of time.

**COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS**

* Base pay is paid at an hourly rate/annual salary rate. The range for this position is $65,000 to $90,000 depending on experience.
* Paid Life Insurance, medical plans, PTO, holidays.
* Dental and vision options.
* 401(k) with match.

  
**ABOUT VERO**  
Vero Broadband was formed to fill a need in unserviceable and underserved communities where access to affordable, reliable broadband simply does not exist. Our goal is to bring the highest quality fiber optic-based broadband services to these communities. In addition, Vero strives to enhance communities by becoming an active partner in these communities by adding jobs, supporting local causes, and helping improve the connectivity of schools and rural healthcare as well.  
  
**NOTICES**  
Vero participates in E-Verify. Vero will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. For more information about E-Verify, please visit: www.e-verify.gov  
  
This position requires the ability to pass a standard background check upon offer of position.  
  
At least 2 professional references are required.
