title: Marketing Technology Digital System & UX Senior Analyst
description:
Austin, TX

Requisition ID 2025-112094

Category Project Management

Position type Regular

Pay range USD $103,500.00 - $150,000.00 / Year

Application deadline 2025-06-24

  

Your opportunity

  

At Schwab, you’re empowered to make an impact on your career. Here, innovative thought meets creative problem solving, helping us “challenge the status quo” and transform the finance industry together.

We believe in the importance of in-office collaboration and fully intend for the selected candidate for this role to work on site in our Austin, TX location.

The Marketing Technology Digital System & Senior UX Analyst is a critical role in the ever-changing landscape of digital marketing. Their purpose is to ensure actionable insights, data, performance tracking and best practices are leveraged to make strategic decisions regarding digital and technical ecosystems that enhance both customer and system user experiences, mitigate risk, drive business results and improve marketing efficiencies at scale.

In this role you will lead research and testing, analyze data and evaluate marketing technology trends and best practices to inform key decisions for improving performance across our core capabilities such as our digital design system, digital asset management and content enablement programs. These programs have direct impact on client experiences and serve multiple channels, retail, editorial and institutional marketing use cases, and internal and external partners.

This role is part of the Marketing Technology Planning and Enablement (MTPE) team, a dynamic, cross-discipline team dedicated to building and optimizing strategy and operations for the entire Schwab Marketing Technology eco-system, ensuring better client experiences and improved business results at scale, near and long term.

What you’ll do:

Your primary responsibility is to provide compelling and actionable data and insights to ensure informed decisions across MarTech programs and core capabilities. This includes owning strategy and implementation of research and testing, delivering data analysis, performance tracking, managing a vendor partner and identifying gaps and opportunities to improve client experiences and drive business outcomes.

Activities include:

* Lead our data and insights program supporting discovery efforts in alignment with marketing objectives and priorities relevant to the digital design system, digital asset management and content enablement efforts to validate problems and solutions.
* Coordinate planning and execution across teams and disciplines, including maintaining all necessary documentation, and reference materials to ensure objectives are met and insights and data will effectively inform key decisions and activities.
* Drive action and key decisions with compelling and thorough communication, reporting and presentations appropriate for various levels of audiences. This includes identifying research and testing opportunities, specifying outcomes, hypothesizing, and determining which methodology is best to gain actionable data and insights that will inform key decisions and improve quality of work to achieve business outcomes.
* Accurately track and visualize data to assess performance or other learning objectives, gathering it from tools including Adobe Analytics, various platforms, 3rd party research, best practices etc., to establish baseline metrics and targets for various studies and tests. Work in partnership with our data team and other researchers to analyze results, validate findings and ensure accuracy of key data.
* Facilitate cross-sharing and stay on top of industry trends and competitive research to ensure long term success and innovation for a competitive edge. This includes successful application of data, insights and learnings and digital marketing best practices.

The ideal candidate is a seasoned researcher and objective data analyst with a range of experience and skills across multiple marketing technology platforms, tools and core capabilities with experience in digital design systems, digital asset management and content enablement.

Key Skills: To be successful in this role you should have the following skills:

* Proactive Initiative: You’re a leader and subject matter expert in UX research and user testing with an existing toolkit of strategic frameworks, approaches and experience who can identify what needs to be done and do it with some autonomy.
* Strategic Thinker: You naturally approach a problem by using a logical, systematic, sequential approach and can clearly envision an objective and the steps needed to achieve it from a research and testing standpoint by weighing the right inputs, determining the best methodology and articulating hypotheses.
* Communicator: You work well within a team of marketers, technologists, creative designers and developers and ensure information is shared and documented so there are actionable insights/results and clear next steps and to help align a broad/diverse audience including stakeholders and leadership.
* Technical Chops: You’ve demonstrated expertise in Data and Research strategy, hypothesis creation, and data analytics. Experienced in using tools such as Adobe analytics, UserZoom, A/B and multi variant testing. Are knowledgeable in UX design with some formal training or education.
* Creative Solutioning: You thrive in an agile, sprint-based workflow that can be scrappy and pivot approaches in collaboration with designers and developers while anchoring in on an objective

What you have

  

To ensure that we fulfill our promise of “challenging the status quo,” this role has specific qualifications that successful candidates should have:

Required Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience working with marketing technology core capabilities including Digital Design Systems, Digital Asset Management Systems and Digital Marketing Content modeling among others (Email, Mobile App, Campaign Management, Marketing Automation, Personalization and Segmentation a plus)
* 4 + years of experience in research and data analytics relevant to a range of marketing technology platforms and tools.
* Extensive hands-on experience with web analytics, research and user testing, A/B testing and analytic tools such as tableau and adobe analytics or similar. (Digital content management experience a plus.)
* Experience with UX, design, research and user testing.
* Proficiency with Microsoft office, Excel, Confluence, Adobe Analytics and other standard tools.

Preferred Qualifications:

* Strong verbal communication skills an ability to build relationships with internal and external partners.

In addition to the salary range, this role is also eligible for bonus or incentive opportunities

What’s in it for you

At Schwab, we’re committed to empowering our employees’ personal and professional success. Our purpose-driven, supportive culture, and focus on your development means you’ll get the tools you need to make a positive difference in the finance industry. Our Hybrid Work and Flexibility approach balances our ongoing commitment to workplace flexibility, serving our clients, and our strong belief in the value of being together in person on a regular basis.

We offer a competitive benefits package that takes care of the whole you – both today and in the future:

* 401(k) with company match and Employee stock purchase plan
* Paid time for vacation, volunteering, and 28-day sabbatical after every 5 years of service for eligible positions
* Paid parental leave and family building benefits
* Tuition reimbursement
* Health, dental, and vision insurance

Eligible Schwabbies receive

Medical, dental and vision benefits

401(k) and employee stock purchase plans

Tuition reimbursement to keep developing your career

Paid parental leave and adoption/family building benefits

Sabbatical leave available after five years of employment

title: GTM Associate
description:
**About Chalk**

Chalk is building the data platform that powers the future of machine learning applications. We tear down complexity, latency, and scale barriers that have traditionally constrained ML capabilities. Our platform combines Rust-speed performance with elegant tools that developers love to use. Leading companies depend on Chalk for everything from stopping fraudulent credit card swipes, verifying identities, and maximizing clean energy capture. We've recently raised a $50 million Series A, led by Felicis.

**About the role**

We're looking for an ambitious and detail-oriented **GTM Associate** to join our team in San Francisco or LA. This is a rare opportunity to work directly with our CEO on high-impact go-to-market projects while getting an inside look at how a fast-growing startup operates.

You'll support sales and growth initiatives—helping with prospect research, outbound outreach, writing follow-ups, and managing customer touchpoints. You'll also pitch in on internal GTM projects, sales enablement, and some light admin support (calendar, coordination, prep materials). This includes helping with operational tasks like sending NDAs, prepping documents, and assisting with security questionnaires. We're looking for someone early in their career who's a fast writer, fast learner, and excited to dive into the world of enterprise software and developer tooling.

**We work in-person Monday through Friday. We don't currently offer remote or hybrid positions.**

**What you will do**

* Partner closely with the CEO on GTM execution, sales strategy, and account outreach
* Write clear, thoughtful outbound messages and follow-ups to prospects and customers
* Research target accounts and identify warm intro or referral paths
* Support prep and follow-up for sales calls, customer meetings, and demos
* Draft and manage customer-facing documents such as NDAs, security questionnaires, and vendor forms
* Create internal collateral and resources that support sales and marketing
* Handle light admin support (calendar, travel, scheduling, notes) to keep things moving smoothly

**What we're looking for**

* Have recently graduated from a top university with standout internships or project experience
* Communicate with clarity and write exceptionally well
* Are curious, organized, and excited to learn the ins and outs of startups, sales, and strategy
* Have familiarity with outbound sales tools (e.g., Outreach, Apollo), AI-driven sales workflows, and CRM follow-up best practices
* Thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous environments and like figuring things out

**Bonus points**

* Prior internships in B2B tech, venture-backed startups, or sales/marketing roles
* Interest in machine learning, infrastructure, or developer tools
* Experience with Notion, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, HubSpot, or similar platforms

**Benefits**

* ️Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance

Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Health Savings Account (HSA)

Expert Healthcare Guidance

Retirement savings

15 company holidays each year

️15 days of personal time off each year

Flex Commuter Benefits

Daily lunch and dinner on Chalk

Office is fully-stocked with drinks and snacks to fuel your work day.

️ Staying late? Dinner is on us

Staying even later? Grab an Uber / Lyft home on Chalk

**Inclusivity**

Chalk is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and inclusion and provide reasonable accommodations to anyone in need of individualized support.

title: Senior Cybersecurity Product Marketing Manager - Data Security Platform
description:
**About Virtru:**

Virtru is a leading data protection provider backed by some of the foremost venture capital firms in Silicon Valley and the Mid-Atlantic region, including Iconiq Capital, Bessemer Venture Partners, Foundry Capital, and Tiger Global. Today, more than ever, data demands respect, and that's why Virtru is committed to changing the rules for data privacy. At Virtru, we equip our customers to take granular control of their data—everywhere it's shared—through end-to-end encryption for Google, Microsoft, and other data sharing platforms. Our market-leading portfolio of data encryption and privacy enhancing applications are remarkably easy to use, fast to implement, affordable for all, and built on the Trusted Data Format (TDF) open standard.

At Virtru, our motto is "Respect the people. Respect the data." Respecting data to us means keeping it secure and protected at all times across its entire lifecycle. We firmly believe that when you respect data, you're demonstrating respect for the people who own that data.

Working at Virtru, you'll be inspired by colleagues who are passionate about the work they do. We are dedicated to creating an atmosphere that sparks creativity, connection, and professional growth while empowering each other to do our best work. We're building something special at Virtru. We hope you consider joining our team and helping us create a brighter future for data privacy.

#### **Compensation: $160,000-195,000/year**

We are looking for a Senior Product Marketing Manager to lead our go-to-market, sales enablement, and thought leadership programs for our zero trust SaaS applications. The ideal candidate possesses boundless curiosity, a broad skill set, and can move nimbly between strategic and tactical challenges. In this role, you will craft positioning, external communications, and competitive analysis to help shape the product's voice, drive brand awareness, and grow our cybersecurity SaaS business.

#### **About the Role**

We seek a visionary Cybersecurity Product Marketing Leader to define and drive our go-to-market strategy for our mission-critical Data Security Platform. This isn't about executing a pre-defined playbook—you'll create that playbook, shaping positioning and thought leadership for technology that protects sensitive data across Fortune 500 companies and government agencies. Success in this role means driving sales growth, increasing market awareness, fostering adoption among developer communities, and equipping our sales channels with compelling materials, accelerating the sales cycle. The ideal candidate brings cybersecurity domain expertise, proven enterprise software launch experience, and strong technical aptitude to elevate our presence in the zero trust security landscape.

  

#### **What You Will Be Doing**

**Market Insights:** Create strategic insights into how we can impact potential customers. Collaborate with Product Management and Sales to develop targets, personas (both economic and technical), and buyer insights for technical and business decision-makers across enterprise and government sectors.

  

**Strategic Positioning:** Develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates our data security solutions in the crowded cybersecurity landscape. Create tailored messaging that resonates with technical audiences, including developers, security engineers, and architects. Collaborate with key stakeholders to determine and monitor product pricing strategies that align with market expectations and value delivery.

  

**Commercial Readiness:** Serve as a critical liaison between Product, Sales, and Marketing to ensure seamless product strategy execution. Drive internal and external launch readiness efforts for product introduction. This effort includes assisting Marketing and agency resources with buyer educational resources and demand generation programs; Product Management with product positioning, pricing, and internal systems readiness; Customer Success, Sales, and Channel partners with required education programs and other necessary go-to-market resources.

  

**Technical Engagement:** Develop strategies to drive adoption and engagement within technical communities, particularly for developer-focused offerings. Create technical content and resources demonstrating the value of our security solutions to highly technical audiences.

  

**Content Creation:** Design and manage ongoing enablement initiatives that equip Sales and channel partners with up-to-date tools and messaging. Develop organized training sessions and continuously gather feedback to refine content, demos, and readiness materials. Assist the product training team with updating the curriculum and other study aids. Develop thought leadership content that establishes Virtru as an authority in data-centric security and zero-trust solutions.

  

**Assess Competitive Landscape:** Oversee the monitoring and operational reporting of the competitive landscape, including SWOT, positioning, and pricing analysis of key competitors in the enterprise security and data protection markets.

  

#### **Required Qualifications and Experience**

* **Cybersecurity Product Marketing Experience:** 8+ years of product marketing leadership in enterprise-grade security or data protection solutions with demonstrated success in B2B/B2G markets
* **Technical-Business Translation:** Proven ability to bridge complex security concepts for diverse audiences - from developers and security engineers to CISOs and business stakeholders
* **Technical Security Knowledge:** Strong understanding of enterprise security architecture, data protection models, zero trust principles, and regulatory compliance frameworks (CMMC, GDPR, FedRAMP, HIPAA, ITAR)
* **Developer Marketing Experience:** Technical aptitude with experience developing API/developer-focused marketing strategies, content, and engagement programs
* **Strategic Go-to-Market Leadership:** Successful execution of 8+ large-scale software product launches with comprehensive commercialization strategies
* **Competitive Positioning:** Demonstrated ability to create differentiated value propositions and messaging in competitive security markets
* **Sales Enablement Excellence:** Experience building comprehensive technical sales tools, including white papers, battle cards, product demonstrations, and more.
* **Content Creation & Storytelling:** Outstanding communication capabilities across various formats (presentations, whitepapers, webinars, technical documentation)
* **Analytical Mindset:** Strong orientation to data-driven decision-making with experience in pricing strategy and key SaaS metrics analysis
* **Competitive Intelligence:** Experience monitoring security market trends and conducting comprehensive competitor analysis

  

#### **Additional Preferred Qualifications**

* Experience bringing security solutions to market in CIV/DOC-IC market segments, as well as commercial enterprise markets
* Strong working knowledge of data security market and solutions, including zero trust; data discovery, classification, and tagging (DSPM), data loss prevention (DLP); identity management
* Previous SaaS or on-premises platform product marketing experience
* Strong working knowledge of Google Workspace, M365, Microsoft SharePoint, and similar collaboration apps in enterprise environments
* International product marketing experience

  

#### **Education**

* Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or related field or equivalent work experience
* Preferred: Certification in the Pragmatic Marketing Framework or other relevant security certifications

  

**Virtruvian qualities that will set you up for success:**

* Thinking outside of the box to respectfully challenge your teammates and managers in the pursuit of excellence
* Strong sense of urgency with an action-oriented mindset
* Able to collaborate and adapt to shifting priorities as business needs evolve
* Comfortable with asynchronous communication including slack, email, zoom, etc.

  

PERKS & BENEFITS

  

At Virtru, we believe people do their best work when their wellbeing is put first. This is why we make your wellbeing our priority with a thoughtful and holistic program that encompasses Occupational, Mental, Social, Physical, and Environmental Wellness by offering benefits such as…

* A **Remote-First** Approach — Virtru is committed to being forever flexible when it comes to where, how, and when you get your work done. You have the option to work from home if that suits you best, or work from our DC Headquarters if you prefer being in person!
* A **Flexible PTO policy** — we strongly encourage you to take time off (in addition to 12 federal holidays) to ensure that you are getting the proper time needed to unplug and recharge.
* A $1,500 annual **Learning & Development Stipend** focused on providing you the resources to continually learn and professionally grow.
* **Internal mobility** options for those interested in exploring their skills in other areas of the business
* Frequent company-sponsored **Team Celebrations** that provide ample opportunities to connect with teammates and be social!
* Access to an **Employee Assistance Program.**
* Access to **Headspace**, a mental health app tailored to your specific needs.
* **A high degree of flexibility** — Have an appointment, errand, or family emergency to take care of? Hop to it! We give you the time and space to take care of you and your own first.

In addition to wellbeing, Virtru places a strong emphasis on diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging. Our DE&I Council is dedicated to fostering an inclusive workplace and making the psychological safety of each and every one of our teammates a top priority. The Council also hosts a range of events throughout the year focused on the continual education of our teammates on social justice issues, current events, and marginalized cultures and communities.

**Additional perks include:**

* Competitive compensation
* Generous parental, medical, and bereavement policies
* Uncapped commissions for Sales roles
* 401K and stock options
* Full medical, dental, and vision benefits
* Annual Winter Hackathons and Summer "InnoVation Weeks" (in-person optional)
* New Hire Swag and IT Welcome boxes
* Structured semi-annual 360° performance reviews
* Transparency is at the core of how we operate and everything we do!

Virtru is currently operating in a remote-first capacity; however, there are plenty of opportunities to connect with the team in person throughout the year, both in and out of the office, whether they be team-specific or company-wide celebrations and events.

  

Virtru is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and everyone is encouraged to apply. Virtru is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

title: Organizational Development Facilitator
description:
Since 2012, we've grown to become one of the leading single-family rental companies and homebuilders in the country, recently recognized as a top employer by Fortune and Great Place To Work®. At AMH, our goal is to simplify the experience of leasing a home through professional management and maintenance support, so our residents can focus on what really matters to them, wherever they are in life.

The **Organizational Development Facilitator** is responsible for leading the design, facilitation, and continuous enhancement of strategic leadership and employee development programs. This role is critical to advancing talent capabilities across the organization and serves as a key partner to mid-level and executive leaders and cross-functional teams. Success in this role is driven by ownership of complex, high-visibility programs that align with enterprise priorities, elevate the learner experience, and deliver measurable business outcomes. This role actively contributes to the innovation, scalability, and execution of the leadership development program portfolio, supporting both current and future leadership pipelines.

**Responsibilities:**

* Leads enterprise-level facilitation and delivery of leadership, onboarding, professional development, and culture-building programs. Oversees the full learning lifecycle—from planning to post-program assessment—and ensures a seamless learner experience across modalities (in-person, virtual, on-demand). Manages program communication strategy, stakeholder alignment, and participant support for high-impact programs.
* Builds strategic partnerships across all levels of the organization to align development efforts with business priorities. Serves as a thought partner on program innovation, consults with stakeholders on development needs, and contributes to the evolution of the enterprise learning strategy. Leads research and authorship of materials for new and enhanced programs in collaboration with Leadership Development Advisor.
* Drives program design and cross-functional execution of learning initiatives. Collaborates with direct leader, subject matter experts, key stakeholders, and external vendors to co-create scalable solutions. Manages complex project workflows, timelines, and program documentation. Provides mentorship and guidance to junior facilitators or peer partners as needed.
* Serves as a Workday Talent and Learning superuser, supporting enterprise adoption and optimization of talent reviews, performance enablement, and learning paths. Supports troubleshooting, feedback loops, and capability building for HR and business users. Ensures system data is aligned to program tracking and reporting.
* Manages Learning & Development programs through the LMS system by configuring learning paths, tracking enrollment and completions, generating insights via dashboards and reports, and ensuring content relevance and accessibility. Coordinates with the LMS team on system enhancements and technical execution of program rollouts.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Education, Organizational Development, Communication, Business or a related field or equivalent combination of education and relevant professional experience.
* Minimum of seven (7) years of experience in learning and development, talent development, or organizational effectiveness roles, with increasing responsibility.
* Minimum of five (5) years of experience designing, delivering, and evaluating leadership development and enterprise-wide training programs.
* Minimum of five (5) years of demonstrated experience coaching and facilitating development for multi-level leaders; ability to guide leaders through performance enablement, communication, and team development practices.
* Expertise in both in-person and virtual/blended facilitation environments, with the ability to adapt delivery to a wide range of learning audiences.
* Experience as a Workday superuser or strong familiarity with Workday’s Talent and Learning modules strongly preferred.
* Proven experience managing and implementing programs through a Learning Management System (LMS); experience with LMS administration or dashboard/report creation preferred.
* Applied knowledge of adult learning theory, instructional design methodologies (ADDIE, SAM, etc.), and facilitation best practices.
* Proficiency with authoring tools such as Articulate 360, Adobe Captivate, and Vyond; graphic design experience using Canva or similar tools a plus.
* Proficiency with Blanchard Exchange and Smartsheet programs a plus.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office 365, particularly PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, and Teams.
* Industry experience in real estate, property management, construction, maintenance, or financial services is a plus.
* Professional certification such as APTD, CPTD, or coaching credentials (e.g., ICF, ATD Coaching Certificate) strongly preferred.
* Real estate, property management, construction, maintenance, or financial services industry experience preferred.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Strong command of the English language with expert grammar and editing skills.
* Exceptional facilitation, presentation, and communication skills; able to engage and influence diverse audiences, including multi-level leadership.
* Results-driven achiever with exemplary planning and organizational skills, along with a high degree of detail orientation.
* Robust assessment, analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
* Deep understanding of learning and talent development strategies across the employee lifecycle, including onboarding, leadership development, performance enablement, and culture-building.
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple concurrent projects under tight deadlines while maintaining a high level of quality and attention to detail.
* Self-motivated, dependable, and solutions-oriented with the ability to work independently or collaboratively.
* High-level analytical and critical thinking skills; ability to interpret learning data and translate insights into actionable program improvements.
* Strong stakeholder management, relationship-building, and consultation skills to partner across functions and levels of the organization.
* Comfortable working in dynamic, fast-paced environments with evolving priorities and technology platforms.

Compensation

The anticipated pay range/scale for this position is $80,155.00 to $100,182.00 Annually. Actual starting base pay within this range will depend on factors including geographic location, education, training, skills, and relevant experience.

Additional Compensation

This position is eligible to receive a discretionary annual bonus.

Perks and Benefits

Employees have the opportunity to participate in medical, dental and vision insurance; flexible spending accounts and/or health savings accounts; dependent savings accounts; 401(k) with company matching contributions; employee stock purchase plan; and a tuition reimbursement program. The Company provides 9 paid holidays per year, and, upon hire, new employees will accrue paid time off (PTO) at a rate of 0.0577 hours of PTO per hour worked, up to a maximum of 120 hours per year.

**CA Privacy Notice:** To learn more about what information we collect when you apply for a job, and how we use that information, please see our CA Job Applicant Privacy Notice found at https://www.amh.com/ca-privacy-notice .

title: Executive Business Partner
description:
Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world's leading provider of online travel and related services, provided to consumers and local partners in more than 220 countries and territories through five primary consumer-facing brands: Booking.com, Priceline, Agoda, KAYAK and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. For more information, visit BookingHoldings.com and follow us on X (formerly known as Twitter) @BookingHoldings.

This role is eligible for our hybrid work model: Two days in-office.

This role will support the SVP Legal, SVP Associate General Counsel, and other legal executives, as well as potentially other team members.

We are seeking a highly organized and strategic professional to deliver high-impact support to senior leaders. This role combines business partnership and operational excellence, ensuring seamless administrative support, streamlined calendar and travel coordination, and efficient expense reporting.

The ideal candidate brings at least 7 years of progressively responsible administrative or business support experience, with a background supporting C-level executives. Success in this role requires exceptional organizational skills, a people- and team-oriented approach, strong stakeholder management, proficiency in Google Workspace and Concur, and the ability to independently troubleshoot and solve problems in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Experience working with lawyers and legal teams is not required, but a plus.

  

**In this role you will get to:**

Business Partnership and Team Enablement:

* Facilitate seamless information flow by communicating updates to leaders' teams, organizing meetings (agendas, minutes, action items), and coordinating team events/offsites.

* Facilitate the process for signatures and be familiar with the authorized signatory processes; notary a plus.

* Support local / office services, including stocking the kitchen, being on-site for office vendors or visitors, and working with other ABPs and EBPs to ensure coverage.
* Ability to develop Google Slides and PowerPoint presentations for executives.

Calendar Management:

* Proactively manage leaders' complex calendars with meticulous attention to detail, ensuring each leader has agendas and pre-reads, while also making informed decisions on their behalf regarding scheduling conflicts and prioritizing commitments.

* Develop and maintain team calendars.

Travel Booking & Travel Itinerary:

* Book and manage end-to-end travel arrangements for Leaders and other team members (as needed) through the Company's internal travel team, including itineraries, visas, and necessary assistance.

Expense Submission & Management:

* Prepare and submit accurate expense claims in Concur on behalf of Leaders and other team members (as needed), and review/approve/decline direct reports' claims, providing guidance and coaching as needed, in accordance with the Company’s Travel & Expense policy.

Invoice Processing

* Process invoices (in Concur) in a timely and efficient manner on behalf of the team(s).

**What you have:**

* A minimum of 7 years of progressive, relevant experience (e.g. administration, business support, executive or administrative assistant).
* Previous experience supporting senior executives, ideally multiple concurrently; experience working with lawyers and legal teams a plus.
* Previous experience in event / team meeting planning.
* Strong stakeholder management, communication, organizational, and proactive problem-solving skills.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment, with attention to detail, adaptability and collaboration with colleagues.
* Proficiency in common administrative and productivity tools, including Google Workspace and Concur.
* Required to work on-site 2 days per week, with flexibility to travel to the NY office on an as needed basis.
* Available to offer support outside of normal business hours and travel internationally, as required.

**Our Commitment to Diversity**

Through the Booking Holdings brands, we help our customers reach all corners of the earth. Our ability to provide great service rests on how well we understand our diverse customer base, which is why having a diverse team is so important to us. We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration.

There are a variety of job related factors that go into determining a salary range, including but not limited to external market benchmark data, geographic location, and years of experience sought/required. In addition to a competitive base salary, roles are eligible to be considered for an annual bonus and equity grant.

The base salary range for Connecticut and the NYC-metro area is $99,000-$121,000.

We are proud to offer a comprehensive benefits program designed to keep you and your family healthy, plan for the future and make the most out of life. For a glimpse of our benefits offerings, please see here. In addition to competitive health and wellness benefits, we currently offer other perks to eligible employees, such as: tuition reimbursement, fitness reimbursement, discounts, and more!

If this role resonates with you, we encourage you to click the "apply" button!

**EEO Statement:**

Booking Holdings is an equal opportunity employer in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws. We ensure equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without discrimination or harassment based on race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.

Booking Holdings also extends this policy to every phase of the employment process including, but not limited to, recruitment, selection, placement, transfer, training and development, position elimination, restructure, promotion, compensation, benefits, layoffs, termination, and all other conditions or privileges of employment. Booking Holdings and its Affiliated Companies are Equal Employment Opportunity employers and welcome all job seekers including individuals with disabilities and veterans with disabilities. title: Senior Program Manager, Learning & Development (AI & Innovation)
description:
**Thumbtack helps millions of people confidently care for their homes.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------

Thumbtack is the one app you need to take care of and improve your home — from personalized guidance to AI tools and a best-in-class hiring experience. Every day in every county of the U.S., people turn to Thumbtack to complete urgent repairs, seasonal maintenance and bigger improvements. We help homeowners know which projects to do, when to do them and who to hire from our growing community of 300,000 local service businesses. If making an impact inspires you, join us. Imagine what we'll build together.

**About the Talent Team**
-------------------------

The Talent Team, a department under our broader People org, brings together Recruiting, Learning & Development, and Talent Management under one unified vision to create seamless and impactful experiences for every individual who joins Thumbtack. From the first interaction with a prospective candidate to their journey as high performing team members, our integrated approach ensures that every step is thoughtful, aligned, and geared toward long term success. This alignment allows us to attract top tier talent, foster a culture of continuous learning, and nurture high potential individuals, all while delivering exceptional results. By thinking bigger and collaborating as one team, we're not just shaping careers, we're building the future of Thumbtack.

**About the role**
------------------

If the idea of helping people unlock the power of AI actually excites you (not in a buzzword kind of way, but in a real, practical, "let's make this useful" kind of way) this role might be your sweet spot. We're looking for a L&D Senior Program Manager to lead AI enablement at Thumbtack. You'll shape the strategy, build the programs, and create the tools that help our team learn how to use AI in meaningful, effective ways. You'll also flex your L&D skills more broadly, jumping in on programs like onboarding, leadership development, and career growth as priorities evolve. No two days will look exactly the same, but the thread that ties it all together is curating learning experiences people actually want to engage with.

You'll be joining a small but mighty team. Right now, L&D is a team of one. This role will double that. And while your L&D leader will be on parental leave when you join, you won't be totally on your own. In the interim, you'll report into our VP of Talent, and you'll be supported by a broader Talent team that collaborates closely and cares deeply. We're big on trust, light on red tape, and excited about what the future of learning can look like when it's done right.

**What you'll do**
------------------

* **Shape Our AI Learning Strategy:** Build trust across the organization and quickly assess learner needs to develop a thoughtful, multi-pronged strategy for AI learning enablement, ensuring employees at all levels feel confident and empowered to leverage AI in their work.
* **Design Impactful, Org-Wide Learning Experiences:** Create and launch learning programs that meet employees where they are by tailoring content for different levels of AI familiarity, from cautious beginners to confident power users.
* **Partner with Business Leaders:** Collaborate with teams across the company to uncover high-impact opportunities for AI integration within their functions.
* **Create Scalable Resources:** Design practical resources—such as playbooks, job aids, and functional guides—that enable teams to confidently embed AI into their daily workflows.
* **Experiment with AI in L&D:** Apply your curiosity and creativity to test out new ways AI can be used within L&D by integrating smart tools into programs, systems, and operations to increase impact and efficiency.
* **Adapt and Support Across L&D Priorities:** Roll up your sleeves to support the broader L&D roadmap as priorities shift, jumping in on initiatives like onboarding, leadership development, career growth, and more.
* **Collaborate Across a High-Trust Team:** Partner closely with a small, nimble team of experienced Talent pros who move fast, support each other, and care deeply about building a culture of continuous learning.

**In order to be successful, you must bring**
---------------------------------------------

* **Learning & Development Expertise:** 8+ years of hands-on experience designing and scaling learning programs that actually move the needle, grounded in adult learning principles and tailored to different audiences. You've built initiatives that connect to real business goals and know how to measure their impact.
* **AI Fluency:** You're not just interested in AI, you've actually used it. Whether applying AI to learning content, using tools to boost your own efficiency, or staying current on trends, you're energized by the potential it holds for the future of work.
* **Strategic Program Leadership:** You're a master of managing moving pieces. You've led multi-phase L&D programs from idea to launch, kept cross-functional partners aligned, and know how to navigate shifting priorities without losing momentum.
* **Operational Hustle:** You take pride in staying five steps ahead. You think strategically, sweat the details, and thrive in the weeds. This is a high-performing team and we rely on each other to deliver.
* **Engaging Facilitation & Comms:** You've facilitated live learning sessions that people don't dread, and you know how to write internal communications that actually get read and spark action.
* **Growth Orientation:** You welcome feedback, adjust with ease, and keep a steady head when working in the messy middle. You approach work with curiosity, accountability, and just the right mix of confidence and humility.
* **Bias for Action in Ambiguity:** You know how to move forward without all the answers, and you're skilled at creating clarity for others too. You've worked in fast-paced, high-change environments (like tech) and know how to bring order to chaos, make confident decisions, and keep your eye on the long-term vision.

**Expected salary ranges**
--------------------------

* For candidates living in San Francisco / Bay Area, San Jose, New York City, or Seattle metros, the expected salary range for the role is currently $151,700 - $196,400.
* For candidates living in Austin, TX or Washington DC metros or in California, Massachusetts, New Jersey, or Washington states, the expected salary range for the role is currently $136,600 - $176,800.
* For candidates living in all other US locations, the expected salary range for this role is currently $128,900 - $166,900.

Actual offered salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as calibrated job level, qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, state, or local law. We also will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, consistent with applicable law.

If you are a California resident, please review information regarding your rights under California privacy laws contained in Thumbtack's Privacy policy available at https://www.thumbtack.com/privacy/ .

title: IT Financial Manager - Corporate Accounting & Finance (Kansas City)
description:
**Description**

The IT Financial Manager is a high impact Finance-based role immersed in the Information Technology Department. This position is responsible for overseeing the financial strategy and execution of all technology-related spend across a multi-billion-dollar enterprise. This role provides direction, support and oversight for a cross-functional team that manages financial planning, forecasting, cost transparency, and technology chargebacks for a portfolio of several hundred million dollars annually.

As a key member of the Information Technology leadership team, the IT Financial Manager partners closely with business and technology stakeholders to influence investment decisions, promote financial accountability, and ensure alignment with strategic priorities.

The ideal candidate brings a blend of strategic acumen, financial expertise, and people leadership. They are comfortable navigating both the details of financial modeling and the broader context of enterprise-level decision making. This individual excels in translating complex financial data into actionable insights for senior executives, while fostering a culture of transparency, consistency, and measurable business value from technology investments.

Service areas within the IT Department include Customer Experience, Enablement Office, Enterprise Architecture, IT Engineering, Information Security, Infrastructure & Operations, and Strategy & Management. As a department within Corporate Services, IT strives to provide value to employee-owners throughout the enterprise as driven by its mission: “To empower every employee-owner to do their best work, every day.”

Key Job Responsibilities

Department Financials

* Partner with the executive leadership team to define and implement financial goals for the IT department.
* Establish and embed financial best practices within the department’s operations.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop the annual business plan and fourth-quarter forecast by translating business initiatives and consumption trends into projected technology cost impacts.
* Monitor and manage monthly financial performance, including detailed analysis of Run vs. Transform the Business spending using the Technology Business Management (TBM) framework.
* Respond to ad hoc requests to support the strategic goals of the executive leadership team.

Financial Data Analysis and Training

* Maintain and apply in-depth knowledge of accounting systems and data reporting tools to support accurate and actionable financial analysis.
* Promote a culture of financial accountability and TBM literacy by equipping service owners and product managers with the knowledge to interpret unit rates, total application costs, and optimization opportunities.
* Conduct benchmarking analyses and develop cost models to support data-driven decision-making.
* Fulfill reporting requirements in coordination with Accounting and other corporate groups.
* Deliver presentations on financial trends and provide conceptual training to various departmental audiences.

Corporate Financial Reporting

* Serve as the primary liaison to the corporate reporting team, ensuring alignment on financial reporting and overhead results.
* Provide expert guidance on forecasting for key initiatives and material financial matters within the IT department.
* Share best practices and innovations developed within IT Finance with the broader corporate reporting community.
* Mentor and support the development of corporate support professionals.

Technology Cost Transparency and Chargebacks

* Drive technology cost transparency by ensuring chargeback rates reflect forecasted consumption, cost structures, and desired behavioral outcomes.
* Build and maintain partnerships across the enterprise to enhance understanding and use of chargeback data in decision-making processes.
* Advocate for fairness and transparency in cost recovery, ensuring technology chargebacks are consistent, defensible, and aligned with business value.
* Design and maintain service cost allocation methodologies grounded in business-relevant drivers and aligned with the TBM model.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance.
* Minimum eight (8) years experience, eleven (11) years preferred. Additional credit may be given for public accounting experience.
* Self-motivator with strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to balance and prioritize multiple day-to-day and ongoing projects simultaneously.
* Proficient in Excel.
* Preferred (but not required):
* Experience with Oracle and Microsoft Power BI
* One year of additional credit given for CPA or MBA

EEO/Disabled/Veterans

**Job** Accounting/Finance

**Primary Location** US-MO-Kansas City

**Schedule:** Full-time

**Travel:** No

**Req ID:** 251598

title: Inside Sales Representative
description:
**Be the Driving Force Behind a High-Performance Sales Team!**

Are you a powerhouse sales leader with a passion for people, strategy, and results? Do you thrive in fast-paced environments where your ideas and leadership create real impact? Moxie Pest Control is looking for a Senior Manager, Inside Sales to take our sales team to the next level and beyond!

In this high-impact role, you’ll lead, build, and energize a talented team of inside sales reps, refine sales strategy, and create a culture that’s both fun and fiercely goal-oriented. If you’re ready to play big with a company that’s just as passionate about growth and culture as it is about success, let's talk.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Lead the strategy for both inbound and outbound sales, collaborating with marketing and the contact center to fuel the funnel.
* Coach, develop, and inspire sales reps through 1:1s, performance feedback, and custom training programs.
* Build killer sales scripts and closing tactics that convert leads into raving fans.
* Run the numbers—analyze KPIs, deliver reports, and drive forecasting to keep us on track (and ahead).
* Partner with marketing to shape lead gen campaigns and unlock new growth channels.
* Use customer feedback to sharpen our service and refine the sales journey.
* Bring the energy—build a sales culture that motivates, supports, and wins together.

**What You Bring to the Table:**

* 3–5+ years of inside sales leadership experience (Supervisor, Sales Manager, etc.)
* Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Business, Marketing—or equivalent experience
* Proven ability to scale teams and consistently crush sales targets
* Deep understanding of the sales cycle and sales enablement tools
* CRM-savvy (PestRoutes experience = a huge plus!)
* Proficient with Google Suite (Docs, Slides, Sheets)
* Exceptional communication and leadership chops
* A strategic thinker with an unstoppable drive to win

**Why Moxie?**

We’re not just a pest control company—we’re a team that believes in doing the right thing, being kind, and constantly improving. At Moxie, you’ll be part of a supportive, high-energy culture with tons of room to grow!

**Here’s What We Offer:**

* **Competitive pay** – Base salary PLUS bonus opportunities!
* **Award-winning workplace** – Named a Top Place to Work since 2021
* **Comprehensive benefits** – Medical, dental, vision, and more
* **401(k) & Roth IRA** – Because your future matters
* **Paid Time Off** – Work-life balance is important to us!
* **Monthly company events & recognition programs**
* **Service projects** – Be part of something bigger than just a job

**Ready to Join the Moxie Family?**

If you’re looking for a fun, rewarding career where you can make an impact, grow professionally, and be part of an amazing team, we want to hear from you!

**Apply today and bring your passion for customer care to Moxie!**

Job Type: Full-time

Expected hours: No less than 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Morning shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Commission pay

Work Location: In person

title: Manager, Marketing
description:
**SUMMARY**

Marketing, Manager is a growth-oriented role that will evolve into a strategic marketing leadership position. You will work closely with the CCO and leadership team to shape our go-to-market strategy while executing high-impact marketing programs today.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

**Strategic Marketing & Positioning**

* Collaborate with CCO and commercial leadership to evolve brand positioning, messaging, and go-to-market strategy as we scale.
* Translate scientific and technical capabilities into compelling marketing narratives.
* Support customer communications initiatives with strategic messaging and materials.
* Marketing intelligence and data
* Analyze Companies market for sizing and needs (including segmentation, adjacent markets, and growth drivers)
* Competitive analysis, both existing and emerging
* Draws data from both internal BD data sources (e.g. SFDC) and external industry sources.
* Works with CCO to inform key strategic decisions during the 5-year LRP process
* Keeps CCO and LT informed on marketing trends real time

**Sales Enablement**

* Develop and maintain marketing materials: pitch decks, service brochures, data sheets, and corporate presentations.
* Equip the commercial team with tailored content and campaigns aligned with the sales pipeline.
* Work with Inside Sales to provide key criteria to be used for Lead Scoring to enhance our success rate through the funnel.

**Events & Conferences**

* Plan, coordinate, and execute trade shows and conferences including logistics, booth design, collateral, lead tracking and ROI analysis.
* Represent the company onsite, supporting business development and technical teams.
* Set up internal procedures to support conference support from the site.

**Analytics & Optimization**

* Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and marketing ROI.
* Regularly report insights and recommendations to optimize spend and impact.

**Digital & Content Marketing**

* Oversee digital presence, including website, SEO/SEM, social media, and email marketing.
* Manage and lead content strategy: case studies, whitepapers, newsletters, technical blogs, etc.
* Coordinate with external digital/creative agency partners
* Supplemental responsibilities
* Other duties as assigned

**JOB REQUIREMENTS**

**Education and Experience**

* 5+ years of marketing experience, preferably in B2B life sciences, biotech, or CDMO environments.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

* Extraverted in the sense of external orientation into the biotech markets
* Hands-on experience in digital marketing, content creation, and event planning.
* Ability to translate complex scientific/technical content into compelling marketing assets.
* Strong project management and organizational skills.
* Excellent communication skills — written, visual, and interpersonal.
* Collaborative mindset with the confidence to lead initiatives and influence stakeholders.
* Collaboratian with Bora Pharmaceuticals
* External marketing team
* Experience working with biotech/biopharma clients or stakeholders.
* Exposure to CRM and marketing automation platforms (HubSpot, Mailchimp, Salesforce, etc.).
* Familiarity with regulatory and compliance considerations in biotech marketing.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL DEMANDS/SAFETY CONSIDERATIONS**

* Hybrid/ Remote (3 remote/ 2 onsite)

title: Director, Product Management
description:
NexusTek is anchored by a long-established core business that delivers unparalleled managed IT services to a wide range of clients. We are embarking on a new chapter, expanding our offerings with three strategic initiatives: Professional and managed services for hybrid cloud, cybersecurity, generative AI, and data. Our ambition is to cultivate a premier service organization recognized nationally for its leadership in these areas.

Trusted by thousands of organizations, we are recognized as a Top 20 Modern National IT Service Provider for the Mid-Market across Consulting and Managed Services, our team is characterized by a distributed remote workforce rich with engineering talent. With a 98% client satisfaction rating and numerous other industry accolades, we are committed to being a trusted partner that drives growth, increases revenue, reduces costs, and mitigates risks for our 1200+ active clients. Join a team that values passionate customer service, integrity, and making a tangible impact.  
  
**Working hours**

Monday – Friday 8am – 5pm local time. This position will require working outside of these hours at times to accommodate client needs.

**Location requirements**

Remote, work from home in the United States. There is no expectation of a return to the office. If interested we have physical offices in Denver, CO, NYC, and Irvine, CA.

Travel up to 25% within the US.

**Why this job is exciting**

This is more than a product leadership role. It’s an opportunity to shape how NexusTek delivers scalable, partner-aligned solutions across key verticals. You’ll drive recurring revenue growth by packaging services that combine innovation, compliance, and operational value, positioning NexusTek as the go-to provider for cybersecurity, hybrid cloud, and AI-driven managed services.

**Who you are**

NexusTek is seeking a dynamic and forward-thinking Director of Product Management to lead the innovation, strategy, and execution of our product portfolio. This is a high-impact role for a strategic product leader who excels at identifying market opportunities, designing scalable IT services, and building solutions that resonate across diverse industries.

You’ll oversee the full product lifecycle, from ideation and market research to roadmap development, execution, and continuous improvement. Working cross-functionally with engineering, marketing, sales, and executive leadership, you’ll shape how we design, package, and deliver our services, ensuring every product drives measurable value for clients.

**You know how to:**

**Set the Strategy**

* Strategic Vision & Roadmap Development: Define and communicate a comprehensive product vision, strategy, and roadmap that align with business goals, address customer needs, and leverage market intelligence.
* Vertical Market Focus & Differentiation: Drive targeted product strategies for high-growth, compliance-driven industries such as healthcare, financial services, and professional services, conducting market and competitive analysis to identify unmet needs and opportunities for differentiation.
* Customer-Centric Innovation & Balanced Execution: Prioritize the development of customer-centric innovations that deliver real-world value, such as operational automation, cloud optimization, or security-first architecture, while balancing long-term product innovation with short-term delivery goals to drive momentum, market relevance, and measurable business impact.

**Drive Execution**

* End-to-End Product Execution & Technical Alignment: Oversee product discovery, definition, and delivery in close collaboration with engineering, operations, and customer-facing teams; ensure design aligns with technical feasibility, scalability, platform direction, and multi-tenant architecture for MSP/MSSP models.
* Team Leadership & Scalable Product Practices: Mentor and develop a high-performing product team while fostering a culture of accountability, curiosity, and continuous improvement; implement scalable frameworks for prioritization, sprint planning, and continuous iteration.
* Customer-Centric Solutions & Monetization Strategy: Collaborate with service delivery and customer success teams to ensure solutions meet operational SLAs, compliance needs, and partner workflows; optimize monetization through packaging, pricing, and recurring service offerings like cloud management, MDR, and compliance bundles.

**Fuel Go-to-Market Success**

* Strategic Positioning & Sales Enablement: Collaborate with sales and marketing to define clear value propositions, competitive messaging, and positioning; develop service tiers, usage-based pricing, and partner-ready bundles tailored to specific industry use cases; and create sales enablement materials such as training resources and sales playbooks.
* Cross-Functional Alignment & Product Evangelism: Ensure consistent alignment across teams regarding launches, milestones, and customer feedback; act as a public-facing product evangelist at conferences, webinars, and with strategic partners to promote product awareness and adoption.
* Performance Tracking & Feedback Integration: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) such as adoption, time-to-value, retention, recurring revenue growth, and SLA compliance; establish internal feedback loops to ensure product decisions reflect the voice of the customer and the market.

**What You Bring:**

**Extensive Product Management Experience:** 8–10+ years in product management, ideally within B2B technology or IT services, with a proven track record of owning and launching end-to-end product strategies—especially within vertical markets.

**Technical & Service Translation Expertise:** Skilled at turning complex offerings (e.g., cybersecurity, cloud, AI) into clear, value-driven products aligned with SOC workflows, cloud operations, or compliance-based service delivery.

**Managed Services & Recurring Revenue Acumen:** Deep understanding of the managed services model, including partner-led delivery, multi-tenant tooling, recurring revenue optimization, and channel-led sales strategies.

**Industry & Regulatory Insight:** Strong grasp of the regulatory and operational nuances impacting sectors such as life sciences, healthcare, manufacturing, and financial services; industry background in these areas is a plus.

**Leadership & Communication Strength**: Experienced in leading cross-functional teams in high-growth or transformation-stage environments; confident communicator with strong storytelling skills, including presenting to senior leadership, customers, and at public forums.

**Pay and Benefits:**

This is a full-time position located in the United States and performed remotely with some travel.

Estimated Starting Salary/Wage Range: **$132,000.00 - $185,000.00 annually + bonus eligible based on performance** , less applicable withholdings and deductions, paid on a semi-monthly basis (The actual salary offered may vary based on relevant factors as determined in the Company’s discretion, which may include experience, qualifications, tenure [for existing employees] skill set, availability of qualified candidates, geographic location, certifications held, and other criteria deemed pertinent to the particular role. Note that the majority of individuals in the position will fall in the low to mid-level of this scale; the upper end of this pay scale is offered only in exceptional circumstances and/or for unusually qualified candidates.)

In addition to legally-required benefits, NexusTek offers a generous benefit package to eligible full-time employees, which currently includes the following:

  

* Four weeks of annual accrued PTO
* Seven paid national holidays
* Medical, dental, vision options
* Company-paid life insurance, short and long-term disability
* Voluntary benefits such as critical illness and accident
* Voluntary Legal Shield and identity theft protection
* Discretionary annual 401k match plan
* Generous employee referral bonus plan
* Employee Assistance Program
* Access to over 90,000+ courses in ADP My Learning
* StandOut employee engagement tools
* Eligible to apply for a Pluralsight license
* Eligible to apply for NexusTek Technical Academy or Leadership Academy

We’re happy to provide our comprehensive benefits guide. Each benefit is subject to eligibility requirements as specified in plan documents, and the Company reserves the right to modify the benefits it offers from time to time.

We seek dedicated professionals who prioritize their role with us as their primary employment. Engagement in additional employment or business activities that may conflict with your responsibilities with NexusTek is not permitted.

**Interview Process -** Typical interview process for this role:

**Application Stage** - Thanks for showing interest by submitting your application!

**Screening Stage** - Let's get to know each other!

* Our recruiters carefully consider each application. If you are selected to move forward, we will contact you for the 20 minute introductory screening to learn more about you and why you want to work for NexusTek.
* As part of our interview process, we use the Culture Index Survey—a brief, 5–10-minute assessment designed to help us understand your natural work preferences and behaviors. The survey consists of two sections:
  + Self-Description: Select adjectives that best describe you.
  + Job Requirements: Choose adjectives that reflect how you believe you need to behave to succeed in your current or desired role.

Prior to moving to the interview phase, you will be asked to complete the survey, or you can take beforehand here: https://surveys.cultureindex.com/s/UFfhWqnV5S/68963

**Interview Stage -** We’ll dive into your experience more in depth

* One-hour interview with CPO (virtual)
* Additional follow up interviews based on availability (virtual)
* References – 3 professional references at least one direct supervisor
* You are welcome to request additional conversations with team members you didn’t get to meet during the process

*NexusTek provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws*

*NexusTek participates in E-Verify for all US Employees*

*Please be aware of potential recruitment fraud and fake social media pages. NexusTek will never ask you to pay a fee as part of the interview process. Additionally, we will not ask for your personal banking information until you have signed an employment offer and completed virtual onboarding training and paperwork provided by our HR team.*

*All communications with NexusTek professionals will only be sent from an @nexustek.com or ADP email address and never originate from gmail.com, yahoo.com, or other commercial email services. If you are viewing this job post outside of our website and interested in exploring opportunities, please go directly to our Careers Page:* *https://www.nexustek.com/nexustek-careers/* *or* *https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=567e686e-7575-49d9-b29f-985e7365f987&ccId=19000101\\_000001&type=MP&lang=en\\_US*
