title: Principal Product Marketing Manager
description:
**Location**: Remote (US CT/ET preferred)

**Reporting to**: VP, Product Marketing

**About CloudBees**
-------------------

CloudBees provides the leading software delivery platform for enterprises, enabling them to continuously innovate, compete, and win in a world powered by the digital experience. Designed for the world's largest organizations with the most complex requirements, CloudBees enables software development organizations to deliver scalable, compliant, governed, and secure software from the code a developer writes to the people who use it.

CloudBees was founded in 2010 and is backed by Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Bridgepoint Credit, HSBC, Golub Capital, Delta-v Capital, Matrix Partners, and Lightspeed Venture Partners. Visit www.cloudbees.com and follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook.

**Why this role matters**
-------------------------

As our first Solutions PMM, you will shape the Unify narrative, weaving CloudBees capabilities into customer-ready solutions that tackle real DevOps challenges such as orchestrating complex enterprise releases, boosting developer productivity with AI, and delivering at scale across hybrid cloud and on-prem environments. You will ensure that the value of Unify resonates within the company and with every customer and prospect. Your work will elevate launches, lifecycle campaigns, growth programs, field enablement, and partner motions, propelling CloudBees into its next stage of growth.

**What You'll Do**
------------------

Shape the future of DevOps with your ability to:

* Drive go-to-market strategy: Design and continuously refine a strategy that links CloudBees Unify messaging, packaging, pricing, and channel plays to concrete pipeline and revenue targets.
* Craft the narrative: Build crisp messaging, positioning, and value props that span CloudBees Unify, our Agentic AI capabilities, and adjacent offerings.
* Launch solutions: Drive GTM plans, from packaging to demand gen, to bring new solution bundles to market.
* Fuel demand: Partner with marketing teams on campaigns, webinars, and events that create pipeline in target verticals.
* Be a thought leader: Elevate CloudBees’ voice by publishing opinionated content, briefing analysts, and speaking at industry events so we’re seen as the authority on DevOps and agentic AI.
* Enable the field: Arm Sales, SEs, and Partners with playbooks, competitive insights, and customer-facing collateral that win deals.
* Lead with data: Define success metrics, track adoption, and iterate quickly based on market feedback.
* Be the voice of the customer: Gather market, buyer, and competitive intelligence to shape roadmap and pricing decisions.
* Leverage AI: Use generative AI to automate research, sharpen messaging, and accelerate GTM execution, multiplying the team’s impact and productivity.

**What You’ll Bring**
---------------------

* 8+ years in product or solutions marketing for DevOps, developer platforms, or adjacent SaaS products.
* Track record of launching multi-product solutions that generated measurable revenue impact.
* Deep understanding of software delivery and the enterprise buyer journey.
* Talent for translating technical capabilities into clear, business-level value.
* Strong storyteller with executive presence and proven cross-functional leadership.
* Comfortable working Agile across globally distributed teams; bias for action and experimentation.

### **Bonus points**

* Experience marketing AI/ML or agentic-AI-driven developer tools.
* Familiarity with regulated industries (finance, healthcare, public sector).

title: Senior Director, Data Visualization
description:
McKesson is an impact-driven, Fortune 10 company that touches virtually every aspect of healthcare. We are known for delivering insights, products, and services that make quality care more accessible and affordable. Here, we focus on the health, happiness, and well-being of you and those we serve – we care.

What you do at McKesson matters. We foster a culture where you can grow, make an impact, and are empowered to bring new ideas. Together, we thrive as we shape the future of health for patients, our communities, and our people. If you want to be part of tomorrow’s health today, we want to hear from you.

**Senior Director of Visualization**

**Position Overview**

We are seeking an exceptional Senior Director of Visualization to join McKesson Technology organization and lead the strategic vision for enterprise business intelligence, data visualization, and analytics governance across our global operations. This senior management role will oversee our comprehensive BI ecosystem encompassing Microsoft PowerBI, Looker, Tableau, QlikSense, and Alation, while driving data democratization initiatives that empower 50,000+ employees with self-service analytics capabilities. The successful candidate will combine deep technical expertise in modern BI platforms with proven leadership in scaling enterprise visualization programs that deliver measurable business impact across multiple business units and geographic regions.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Strategic BI & Analytics Leadership**

* Define and execute enterprise-wide visualization and business intelligence strategy aligned with corporate digital transformation objectives
* Partner with executives, business unit leaders, and functional stakeholders to establish data-driven decision-making culture across the organization
* Drive multi-platform BI strategy optimizing PowerBI, Looker, Tableau, and QlikSense capabilities to serve diverse analytical needs and user personas
* Establish enterprise analytics governance framework ensuring consistent data storytelling, visualization standards, and self-service enablement

**Enterprise BI Platform Excellence**

* Lead strategic optimization of Microsoft PowerBI ecosystem including Premium capacity planning, embedded analytics, and enterprise deployment across 50,000+ users
* Oversee Looker platform development for modern cloud-native analytics, and embedded business intelligence capabilities
* Manage Tableau enterprise deployment including Server/Cloud optimization, advanced analytics integration, and performance at scale
* Optimize QlikSense associative analytics platform for complex business discovery and interactive dashboard experiences
* Leverage Alation data catalog for enterprise data governance, data discovery, and collaborative analytics across all BI platforms

**Data Governance & Democratization**

* Establish comprehensive data governance framework through Alation platform ensuring data lineage, quality, and trusted analytics across enterprise
* Drive self-service analytics adoption enabling business users to create insights while maintaining data accuracy and security standards
* Implement enterprise semantic layer and common business definitions across all visualization platforms
* Lead data literacy programs and training initiatives to scale analytical capabilities across the organization

**Organizational Leadership & Innovation**

* Build and lead high-performing organization of 40+ professionals including BI architects, visualization developers, data analysts, and platform administrators
* Foster center of excellence for visualization best practices, advanced analytics techniques, and emerging BI technologies
* Drive innovation in augmented analytics, embedded intelligence, and next-generation visualization capabilities
* Establish strategic partnerships with technology vendors and industry leaders to maintain competitive advantage in enterprise analytics

**Business Impact & Performance Management**

* Deliver measurable business value through enterprise analytics initiatives driving revenue growth, cost optimization, and operational efficiency
* Establish KPIs and success metrics for BI platform adoption, user engagement, and business impact across all business units
* Manage substantial technology budget ($5M+) optimizing total cost of ownership across multi-platform BI environment
* Lead enterprise-wide analytics transformations ensuring seamless user experience and business continuity

**Minimum Qualifications**

Degree or equivalent experience. Typically requires 13+ years of professional experience and 6+ years of diversified leadership, planning, communication, organization, and people motivation skills (or equivalent experience)

**Critical Skills**

* Strong background in enterprise analytics strategy, platform governance, and organizational change management
* Deep expertise in Microsoft PowerBI including Premium architecture, embedded analytics, Power Platform integration, and enterprise security models
* Advanced proficiency with Looker platform including LookML development, cloud-native architecture, and embedded analytics deployment
* Extensive experience with Tableau enterprise deployment including Server/Cloud administration, advanced visualization techniques, and performance optimization
* Comprehensive understanding of modern BI architecture, cloud analytics platforms, and enterprise data integration patterns
* Strong understanding of enterprise data governance, regulatory compliance, and data privacy requirements across multiple industries
* Deep understanding of emerging BI trends including augmented analytics, natural language processing, and AI-powered insights
* Experience with modern data architecture including cloud data platforms, real-time analytics, and embedded intelligence

**Additional Skills-**

* Proven leader in enterprise BI transformation, with a track record of driving large-scale initiatives at Fortune 50/100 companies and building high-performing BI teams of 35+ professionals across global locations and diverse technology platforms.
* Proven experience with P&L responsibility, budget management ($5M+), and technology ROI optimization for enterprise BI programs
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills with ability to influence C-suite executives and drive organizational consensus
* Knowledge of industry best practices for data democratization, self-service analytics, and enterprise-scale BI governance
* Background in advanced analytics integration including machine learning, predictive modeling, and statistical analysis within BI platforms

**Preferred Qualifications**

* One or more of professional certifications across BI platforms: Microsoft Certified Power BI Expert, Looker Professional, Tableau Certified Professional
* Experience in highly regulated industries (financial services, healthcare, manufacturing) with complex compliance and governance requirements
* Familiarity with enterprise AI/ML integration within business intelligence and visualization platforms
* Previous experience at Fortune 50 companies managing similar analytical complexity and organizational scale
* International experience leading global BI operations across multiple regions, cultures, and regulatory environments

**Leadership Competencies**

* Visionary strategic thinking with ability to anticipate market trends and technology evolution
* Change leadership expertise for large-scale organizational and technology transformations
* Exceptional stakeholder management across technical teams, business units, and executive leadership
* Talent development focus with proven success building high-performing analytical organizations
* Innovation mindset balanced with operational excellence and enterprise-grade reliability

**Success Metrics**

* Enterprise BI platform adoption rates and user engagement across 50,000+ employee base
* Business impact measurement through analytics-driven decision making and operational improvements
* Platform performance optimization including cost efficiency and technical excellence
* Data governance maturity and self-service analytics capability development
* Team performance, talent retention, and organizational capability growth

**What We Offer**

* Compensation package including competitive base salary, substantial performance bonus, and equity participation
* Comprehensive benefits including premium health coverage, executive retirement planning, and extensive professional development opportunities
* Opportunity to lead cutting-edge visualization and analytics initiatives at unprecedented global scale
* Access to latest BI technologies, strategic vendor partnerships, and industry thought leadership platforms
* Clear advancement path within our expanding technology and analytics organization
* Collaborative culture emphasizing innovation, data-driven decision making, and organizational excellence

*Candidate must be authorized to work in the U.S, now or in the future, without the support from McKesson.*

We are proud to offer a competitive compensation package at McKesson as part of our Total Rewards. This is determined by several factors, including performance, experience and skills, equity, regular job market evaluations, and geographical markets. The pay range shown below is aligned with McKesson's pay philosophy, and pay will always be compliant with any applicable regulations. In addition to base pay, other compensation, such as an annual bonus or long-term incentive opportunities may be offered. For more information regarding benefits at McKesson, please

**Our Base Pay Range for this position**

$174,900 - $291,500

McKesson is an Equal Opportunity Employer

McKesson provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees and is committed to a diverse and inclusive environment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age or genetic information. For additional information on McKesson’s full Equal Employment Opportunity policies, visit our Equal Employment Opportunity page.

Join us at McKesson!

title: Manufacturing Technician - Shockwave
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

**Job Function:**

Supply Chain Manufacturing

**Job Sub Function:**

Production Equipment Repair & Maintenance

**Job Category:**

Business Enablement/Support

**All Job Posting Locations:**

Santa Clara, California, United States of America

**Job Description:**

Johnson & Johnson is hiring for a **Manufacturing Technician - Shockwave Medical** to join our team located in **Santa Clara, CA**.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Fueled by innovation at the intersection of biology and technology, we’re developing the next generation of smarter, less invasive, more personalized treatments. Ready to join a team that’s pioneering the development and commercialization of Intravascular Lithotripsy (IVL) to treat complex calcified cardiovascular disease. Our Shockwave Medical portfolio aims to establish a new standard of care for medical device treatment of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease through its differentiated and proprietary local delivery of sonic pressure waves for the treatment of calcified plaque.

**Position Overview**

The Manufacturing Technician performs complex or specialized technical assignments, often project-based, requiring the ability to work independently. This role may involve designing, developing, maintaining or modifying manufacturing equipment, materials, systems and products. The technician uses sound judgment, a high degree of initiative, creativity in solving, and must adapt to rapidly shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment. The Manufacturing Technician sets up and maintains equipment to required standards and makes recommendations for continuous improvement of manufacturing methods in partnership with Manufacturing Engineering.

**Essential Job Functions**

* Supports development and manufacturing teams by testing specific aspects of products, processes, or equipment to meet defined requirements and timelines.
* Troubleshoots and resolves equipment issues requiring hands-on experience and technical interpretation of procedures and practices.
* Masters the processes and procedures used to build company products, and is qualified to train new employees (including assemblers, technicians, engineers).
* Demonstrates ingenuity, creativity and a high degree of independent action and initiative.
* Communicates effectively with team members and multi-functional partners to ensure the highest quality products, processes, or equipment to meet identified needs.
* Supplies ideas and solutions to improve processes and equipment.
* Analyzes data to identify trends and isolate cause-effect relationships; reports findings and presents progress and plans to engineers and/or management.
* Provides support data for Engineers during qualification and validation studies.
* Plans and organizes project assignments of substantial variety and complexity; initiates or maintains work schedules and project milestones; establishes priorities.
* Facilitates meetings and training sessions on procedures and processes for all levels of technical personnel, including engineers.
* Must be available to support production on Saturdays, as needed.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Requirements**

* High School Diploma required with a minimum of 1 year experience as a manufacturing technician (or relevant experience) in the medical device industry or with 3 years’ other relevant hands on medical device experience.
* Knowledge of and compliance with applicable Quality System requirements such as QSRs, FDA, ISO, MDD and other relevant regulations.
* Understanding of and experience with 5S, Lean, and waste reduction in manufacturing.
* Experience in equipment preventive maintenance and/or calibration is a plus.
* Knowledge of PLC’s, pneumatic systems, and electrical systems.
* Experience in manufacturing processes, systems, and process/product development.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple priorities.
* Proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively, showing flexibility to adapt to changing requirements. Must be able to sit for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour workday)
* May be required to lift objects up to 25lbs or more.
* Must be able to work in an air-conditioned office as well as a non-temperature controlled warehouse environment as needed.

*NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employees may perform other related duties as assigned or negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.*

**Additional Information:**

* The anticipated base pay for this position is $39,100-$69,000 annually.
* The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.
* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:

  + Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
  + Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
  + Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year
  + Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year
* Additional information can be found through the link below. https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

*Johnson & Johnson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. We actively seek qualified candidates who are protected veterans and individuals with disabilities as defined under VEVRAA and Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act.*

*Johnson and Johnson is committed to providing an interview process that is inclusive of our applicants’ needs. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request an accommodation, please email the Employee Health Support Center (**ra-employeehealthsup@its.jnj.com**) or contact AskGS to be directed to your accommodation resource.*

**The anticipated base pay range for this position is :**

title: Hips Training Manager
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

**Job Function:**

Sales Enablement

**Job Sub Function:**

Sales Training

**Job Category:**

Professional

**All Job Posting Locations:**

Palm Beach Gardens, Florida, United States of America, Warsaw, Indiana, United States of America

**Job Description:**

**We are searching for the best talent for** **Hips Training Manager to be in Palm Beach Gardens, FL or Warsaw, IN.**

**About Orthopaedics**

Fueled by innovation at the intersection of biology and technology, we’re developing the next generation of smarter, less invasive, more personalized treatments.

Are you passionate about improving and expanding the possibilities of Orthopaedics? Ready to join a team that’s reimagining how we heal? Our Orthopaedics teams help keep more than 6 million people moving each year while delivering clinical and economic value to surgeons and healthcare systems. Our teams build solutions for joint reconstruction; trauma and craniomaxillofacial; sports, extremities, and elective foot and ankle; spine; and robotics and digital surgery.

Your unique talents will help patients on their journey to wellness. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/medtech

**Purpose:**

The role of Hips Training Manager, Commercial Education, Joint Reconstruction and VELYS Hip Navigation is responsible for the planning, delivery, and execution of training for the sales organization aligned to the global learning strategy and in support of the US region’s business needs.

This role will be primarily focused on Hip surgeries and product lines and will work with Global Education, Regional Marketing, Sales Leadership, Healthcare Compliance and other functional partners to shape and deliver educational programs aimed at elevating the competency of the sales organization aligned with the company curricula, certification pathways, policies and strategies.

**Key responsibilities:**

* Manages daily business-focused training activities for the Commercial Education Hips and VHN.This includes but is not limited to administrative activities, communications, development and execution of curricula and courses and administration of Commercial Education policies and guidelines, all aligned with the MedTech Education strategy.
* Liaises with senior management to obtain resources for supporting needs and requirements for Joint Reconstruction and VELYS Enabling Tech strategic initiatives.
* Accountable for ongoing related asset management tracking and reporting
* Accountable for ongoing training needs assessment of customer-facing field sales teams related to organizational imperatives by performing analysis on current and historical sales activities, and enterprise engagement.
* Delivers the most effective educational programs to satisfy the overall objectives of the Joint Reconstruction and VELYS Enabling Tech organization.
* Develops and executes Commercial Education strategies in partnership with internal functional partners and Commercial Development cohorts to address all ongoing training and development of sales consultants with emphasis on technical training, clinical selling, operations, job related technical proficiency, strategic account management, and enterprise and market effectiveness.
* Keeps expertise updated in training and related clinical and business technologies and methodologies. Identifies market and organizational trends and recommends appropriate actions to management.
* Ensures that sales training practices are in compliance with all government and legal requirements.
* Accountable for the Design and deliver effective educational programs aligned to our learning strategies including the use of a 30-40-30 format.
* Educates sales consultants across the entire portfolio to build clinical and non-clinical proficiency with emphasis on technical training, clinical selling, operations, strategic account management and enterprise market effectiveness.
* Conducts and reports on follow-up of training programs, updates ongoing programs utilizing MedTech Education analytics methodologies and update programs as needed.
* Facilitates virtual/live training classes as needed to build clinical and non-clinical proficiency of sales/clinical team across the entire portfolio.
* Works with strategic vendors and acts as subject matter expert for training development.
* Leverages technology platforms to help facilitate education.
* Apply adult learning principles and professional facilitation skills in all learning programs.
* Facilitates learning in live, virtual and self-guided formats aligned with our learning strategies.
* Serve as a subject matter expert for training development with strategic partners and vendors.
* Maintains expertise in training and related clinical and business technologies and methodologies.
* Develop and deliver post course assessments in various formats that align with the training content.

**Qualifications**

Required:

* Bachelor’s degree
* 5 years of medical device experience
* Strong clinical expertise or orthopedic/medical device training experience specific in Hips Arthroplasty.
* Strong sense of ownership and accountability, ability to self-direct and self-govern
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Effective interpersonal skills that include professionalism, maturity and team mentality
* Experience leading projects or initiatives.
* Purposeful orientation aligned with passion for providing the best patient care possible
* Genuine interest in ongoing professional development of self and others
* The ability to effectively create and deliver presentations to a variety of audiences including learners, colleagues and senior leaders.
* Ability to collaborate and lead across functions, cross-functional teams, job levels and a matrix organization
* Ability to adapt to and deliver in a dynamic work environment
* MS Office proficiency and virtual meetings applications
* Travel up to 50% based on where you reside.

Preferred:

* Experience with hip arthroplasty and/or reconstructive joint replacement surgery and revision.
* 3-7+ years of experience in medical device sales, clinical education, or sales training, particularly in orthopaedics
* Strong understanding of hip anatomy, biomechanics, and pathology.
* Familiarity with hip arthroplasty procedures, surgical techniques, and instrumentation.
* Experience with orthopaedics implant products, including the EMPHASYS™, KINCISE™, ACTIS™ and CORAIL™
* Expertise in DPS product platform and sales business practices
* Experience as an orthopedic/medical device trainer
* Experience designing, creating and delivering educational content for virtual, classroom, in-person internal and field-based audiences.
* Experience in technology assisted surgery and/or capital equipment
* Understanding selling strategies
* Experience working in additional commercial functions (field, marketing, etc.)
* Familiarity and training experience with preoperative templating software and 3D planning platforms for accurate implant selection and positioning
* The ability to collaborate with surgeon faculty to develop and deliver high-quality educational programing.
* Ability to process complex situration with opporsing inputs and decide the best path forward.
* Strong ability to build relationships with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and align training programs with best practices and evolving clinical techniques.

Other:

* Office work requires sitting, walking, using phone and computer and surgical instrumentation demonstrating surgical workflow, work in the presence of fluoroscopy.
* May lift up to 30 lbs. occasionally.
* Work Environment: Office, classroom, laboratory and surgical facilities.
* Working Hours: daily Monday – Friday and occasional evenings and weekends.
* Travel Requirements: Overnight travel may be required up to 50%.

title: Manufacturing Technician (Swing Shift)
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

**Job Function:**

Supply Chain Manufacturing

**Job Sub Function:**

Production Equipment Repair & Maintenance

**Job Category:**

Business Enablement/Support

**All Job Posting Locations:**

Santa Clara, California, United States of America

**Job Description:**

Johnson & Johnson is hiring for a **Manufacturing Technician (Swing Shift) - Shockwave Medical** to join our team located in **Santa Clara, CA**.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Fueled by innovation at the intersection of biology and technology, we’re developing the next generation of smarter, less invasive, more personalized treatments. Ready to join a team that’s pioneering the development and commercialization of Intravascular Lithotripsy (IVL) to treat complex calcified cardiovascular disease. Our Shockwave Medical portfolio aims to establish a new standard of care for medical device treatment of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease through its differentiated and proprietary local delivery of sonic pressure waves for the treatment of calcified plaque.

**Position Overview**

The Manufacturing Technician performs complex or specialized technical assignments, often project-based, requiring the ability to work independently. This role may involve designing, developing, maintaining or modifying manufacturing equipment, materials, systems and products. The technician uses sound judgment, a high degree of initiative, creativity in solving, and must adapt to rapidly shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment. The Manufacturing Technician sets up and maintains equipment to required standards and makes recommendations for continuous improvement of manufacturing methods in partnership with Manufacturing Engineering.

**Essential Job Functions**

* Supports development and manufacturing teams by testing specific aspects of products, processes, or equipment to meet defined requirements and timelines.
* Troubleshoots and resolves equipment issues requiring hands-on experience and technical interpretation of procedures and practices.
* Masters the processes and procedures used to build company products, and is qualified to train new employees (including assemblers, technicians, engineers).
* Demonstrates ingenuity, creativity and a high degree of independent action and initiative.
* Communicates effectively with team members and multi-functional partners to ensure the highest quality products, processes, or equipment to meet identified needs.
* Supplies ideas and solutions to improve processes and equipment.
* Analyzes data to identify trends and isolate cause-effect relationships; reports findings and presents progress and plans to engineers and/or management.
* Provides support data for Engineers during qualification and validation studies.
* Plans and organizes project assignments of substantial variety and complexity; initiates or maintains work schedules and project milestones; establishes priorities.
* Facilitates meetings and training sessions on procedures and processes for all levels of technical personnel, including engineers.
* Must be available to support production on Saturdays, as needed.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Requirements**

* High School Diploma required with a minimum of 1 year experience as a manufacturing technician (or relevant experience) in the medical device industry or with 3 years’ other relevant hands on medical device experience.
* Must be able to work 2nd shift hours (2:45 pm - 11:15 pm) and overtime as needed to meet business needs.
* Knowledge of and compliance with applicable Quality System requirements such as QSRs, FDA, ISO, MDD and other relevant regulations.
* Understanding of and experience with 5S, Lean, and waste reduction in manufacturing.
* Experience in equipment preventive maintenance and/or calibration is a plus.
* Knowledge of PLC’s, pneumatic systems, and electrical systems.
* Experience in manufacturing processes, systems, and process/product development.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple priorities.
* Proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively, showing flexibility to adapt to changing requirements. Must be able to sit for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour workday)
* May be required to lift objects up to 25lbs or more.
* Must be able to work in an air-conditioned office as well as a non-temperature controlled warehouse environment as needed.

*NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employees may perform other related duties as assigned or negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.*

**Additional Information:**

* The anticipated base pay for this position is $39,100-$69,000 annually.
* The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.
* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:

  + Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
  + Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
  + Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year
  + Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year
* Additional information can be found through the link below. https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

*Johnson & Johnson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. We actively seek qualified candidates who are protected veterans and individuals with disabilities as defined under VEVRAA and Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act.*

If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request an accommodation, please email the Employee Health Support Center (**ra-employeehealthsup@its.jnj.com**) or contact AskGS to be directed to your accommodation resource.*

title: RevOps Specialist - Salesforce
description:
Description:

NEFCO is seeking an experienced Salesforce professional to serve in a hybrid role focused on both platform administration and end-user enablement. As our Salesforce Administrator & Training Specialist, you’ll take ownership of Salesforce system configuration while also leading hands-on training and support for our customer-facing teams. This role is ideal for someone who understands the technical side of Salesforce and knows how to train and support sales reps in using it effectively. You’ll play a key role in driving adoption, building scalable workflows, and ensuring our teams are equipped to succeed within the platform.

**Key Responsibilities**

*Training & Enablement*

* Deliver live and virtual Salesforce training sessions for sales, service, and support teams
* Develop and maintain user-friendly documentation: onboarding guides, job aids, and videos
* Provide one-on-one coaching, follow-up training, and frontline system support
* Partner with leadership to tailor training content to team-specific workflows
* Monitor adoption and usage to identify knowledge gaps and refine enablement strategies

*Salesforce Administration*

* Serve as the primary admin for Salesforce—manage user access, roles, profiles, and permissions
* Maintain data integrity and support regular data cleanup efforts
* Build and manage reports, dashboards, page layouts, and basic automation
* Translate business needs into scalable solutions using native Salesforce features
* Collaborate with the RevOps team on process improvements and CRM optimization

**Why This Role Matters**

As NEFCO implements Salesforce company-wide, this role is critical in bridging the gap between system functionality and user success. You’ll be the face of Salesforce to our sales teams—ensuring the platform is configured to support their goals and that they’re confident and capable using it every day.

Requirements:

**Required Qualifications**

* 2–5 years of experience as a Salesforce Administrator or CRM training specialist
* Proven experience training and supporting sales teams on Salesforce or similar CRMs
* Strong knowledge of Salesforce Sales Cloud functionality and best practices
* Comfortable with user management, security settings, layouts, reports, and basic automation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills; confident leading training sessions
* Ability to balance technical responsibilities with people-focused enablement work

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Salesforce Administrator certification (or in-progress)
* Experience with system rollouts, user onboarding, and change management
* Familiarity with data analysis and Excel (VLOOKUPs, pivot tables)
* Experience in sales enablement, sales operations, or customer success

title: Strategic Account Executive - Bay Area
description:
**About Team & About Role:**

Rubrik’s sales organization is a united group of elite cross-functional sales professionals that help companies & government entities achieve resilience against cyberattacks, malicious insiders, and operational disruptions. We offer continuous professional development through our world class sales enablement program and our One Rubrik selling approach provides all the resources you need to exceed your goals, maximize your earnings potential and take your career to the next level. All this while doing something that truly matters, protecting the world's data.

As a Strategic Enterprise Account Executive, you will have ownership of all elements of bookings growth in new and existing accounts across the northwest region. We are seeking a relentless self-starter who is hyper-focused on acquiring new logos by discovering and developing new opportunities, managing pipeline and executing account strategies, while also encouraging existing customer expansion. The AE must drive pipeline generation daily while working with Sales Engineers, Sales Development, Channel Development and Rubrik Channel Partners to exceed sales quotas.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Define and execute sales plans for the assigned territory to meet and exceed quota through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities
* Develop and manage sales pipeline to move a large number of strategic transactions through the sales process
* Identify and close new opportunities for growth working with a mix of mid-enterprise accounts
* Present Rubrik, Inc. solutions within complex data center design environments
* Co-sell and strategize with partners, distributors and VAR’s to enable rapid growth
* Provide Rubrik, Inc. management with feedback about the local market opportunity and identification of new business opportunities and channel partnerships

**Experience You’ll Need**:

* 5 years Tech sales experience (selling either IT Infrastructure or SaaS Security)
* Consistent track record landing “net new logos". WE NEED HUNTERS.
* Strong track record of performance selling to many accounts across various verticals.
* Understanding and experience working with channel
* Consistent overachievement
* Highly driven, goal oriented "get it done" attitude
* Experience selling a complex solutions

The minimum and maximum base salaries for this role are posted below; this role is also eligible to earn commissions pursuant to the Company’s written Incentive Compensation Plan. Additionally, the role is eligible for equity and benefits. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the role based on U.S. location. Within the range, the salary offered will be determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

US Pay Range

$138,150—$174,700 USD

**Join Us in Securing the World's Data**
----------------------------------------

Rubrik (NYSE: RBRK) is on a mission to secure the world’s data. With Zero Trust Data Security™, we help organizations achieve business resilience against cyberattacks, malicious insiders, and operational disruptions. Rubrik Security Cloud, powered by machine learning, secures data across enterprise, cloud, and SaaS applications. We help organizations uphold data integrity, deliver data availability that withstands adverse conditions, continuously monitor data risks and threats, and restore businesses with their data when infrastructure is attacked.

  

**Inclusion @ Rubrik**
----------------------

At Rubrik, we are dedicated to fostering a culture where people from all backgrounds are valued, feel they belong, and believe they can succeed. Our commitment to inclusion is at the heart of our mission to secure the world’s data.

Our goal is to hire and promote the best talent, regardless of background. We continually review our hiring practices to ensure fairness and strive to create an environment where every employee has equal access to opportunities for growth and excellence. We believe in empowering everyone to bring their authentic selves to work and achieve their fullest potential.

### **Our inclusion strategy focuses on three core areas of our business and culture:**

* Our Company: We are committed to building a merit-based organization that offers equal access to growth and success for all employees globally. Your potential is limitless here.
* Our Culture: We strive to create an inclusive atmosphere where individuals from all backgrounds feel a strong sense of belonging, can thrive, and do their best work. Your contributions help us innovate and break boundaries.
* Our Communities: We are dedicated to expanding our engagement with the communities we operate in, creating opportunities for underrepresented talent and driving greater innovation for our clients. Your impact extends beyond Rubrik, contributing to safer and stronger communities.

**Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled**
------------------------------------------------

Rubrik is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Rubrik provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Rubrik complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please contact us at hr@rubrik.com if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.

title: Senior Advanced Analytics Engineer
description:
**Job Ref:**  
45141
  
  
**Location:**  
450 Brookline Ave, Boston, MA 02215
  
  
**Category:**  
IT/Informatics
  
  
**Employment Type:**  
Full time
  
  
**Work Location:**  
**Hybrid:** 2-3 days onsite/week
  
  
Overview
  
  
This role will report to the Lead, Advanced Analytics within the I&A organization, the Senior, Advanced Analytics Engineer will bring deep technical expertise in advanced analytics and machine learning techniques to deploy, monitor, and maintain models through our Databricks cloud platform, while collaborating with senior data scientists, operational leaders, and clinical staff on high-impact data products and use cases. You will act as a thought leader, promoting best practices to enable teams across the institute to perform efficient and effective analytics. Your work will directly influence the deployment of cutting-edge solutions that drive real-world outcomes for cancer treatment and research.
  
  
Located in Boston and the surrounding communities, Dana-Farber Cancer Institute is a leader in life changing breakthroughs in cancer research and patient care. We are united in our mission of conquering cancer, HIV/AIDS and related diseases. We strive to create an inclusive, diverse, and equitable environment where we provide compassionate and comprehensive care to patients of all backgrounds, and design programs to promote public health particularly among high-risk and underserved populations. We conduct groundbreaking research that advances treatment, we educate tomorrow's physician/researchers, and we work with amazing partners, including other Harvard Medical School-affiliated hospitals.
  
  
Responsibilities
  
  
Model Creation, Deployment, and Maintenance
  
  
Plan, advise and execute on scalable practices for development, deployment, and long-term monitoring for advanced analytics solutions, ensuring a delivery that is built for scale, reliable telemetry tracking, informative monitoring and diagnosis of model drift, and cross-platform efficiency.
  
Implement and maintain best-in-class data solutions, managing machine learning models from deployment to retirement, ensuring models are well organized, auditable, and continuously perform with the highest degree of accuracy.
  
Develop CI/CD pipelines for predictive and forecasting models in cloud environments, including batch, online, streaming, and edge training/inference.
  
Elicit functional requirements from end users, advanced analytics, and data science teams, utilizing methods such as user interviews, mockups, wireframes, end-to-end testing, prototypes, GUI designs, use cases, and surveys of your communities of practice.
  
Establish yourself as an Institute Analytics thought leader, bringing expertise and impeccable communication on what’s possible and not possible with these capabilities, including knowledge of recent advancements, established methods, the pathways to success, and helping staff to see the “art of the possible”.
  
  
Data Architecture and Accessibility
  
  
Oversee the data governance, including data versioning, lineage, and compliance, ensuring model components and model data are available for high-throughput, low-latency processing and training.
  
Design, implement, and maintain data pipelines that support machine learning models, ensuring data availability and integrity across hybrid cloud platforms.
  
Collaborate on multi-cloud & hybrid data platforms (e.g., Databricks, Snowflake, Kubernetes, Spark) to support machine learning and AI initiatives.
  
  
**Thought Leadership, Best Practices, and User Enablement:**  
Provide thought leadership in how analytics platforms can be used and measured to achieve best practices in performance, reliability, usability, and value for users.
  
Communicate status on various project/program efforts to multiple groups including the Advanced Analytics team, project sponsors, business owners, and internal stakeholders.
  
Embed continuous improvement processes in your product solution designs, ways of working, and the solution consulting practice you build ensuring durable products that provide long-term value.
  
Mentor and provide guidance to junior and new team members.
  
  
Qualifications
  
  
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field (Master’s or PhD preferred).
  
5 years of relevant experience in advanced analytics leveraging machine learning techniques, model deployment. 2+ years in healthcare/life sciences (clinical or research setting) preferred.
  
High proficiency with using Python, SQL and multi-cloud & hybrid data platforms (Databricks, Snowflake, Docker/Spark/Kubernetes).Experience with data engineering, MLOps, and deploying ML models in cloud environments (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP). Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and DataOps practices, including tools like Terraform and Jenkins.
  
Experience designing technical solutions in partnership with development teams for monitoring and management of large-scale custom software applications.
  
Familiarity with healthcare data and regulatory environments (HIPAA, GDPR) is preferred.
  
  
**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:**  
Proven ability to handle high-throughput big data processing with low-latency requirements.
  
Advanced understanding of the AI/ML lifecycle, including data preparation, model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.
  
Advanced understanding of software development and platform management and ability to adapt quickly to changing requirements.
  
Excellent understanding in best practices for solution design for data, AI, informatics, and/or software development use cases including technical architecture, and the interactions between systems including working knowledge of data platforms, the AI tech stack, and the software development lifecycle.
  
Work closely with stakeholders across the Institute to understand data and AI needs and deliver tailored technical solutions.
  
Act as a liaison between advanced analytics teams and operational leaders, ensuring that machine learning models are effectively deployed and managed.
  
Provide exceptional problem-solving and communication skills, working with cross-functional teams to meet the evolving needs of the Institute’s AI initiatives.
  
Demonstrated ability to provide exceptional user support, meet users where they are, talk their language, and guide them to expand their capabilities beyond what they thought they were capable of.
  
Able to skillfully educate the business on the importance of leveraging data & analysis for decision-making and enable the embedding of a data-driven culture.
  
Ability to work and maintain focus within a complex, fast-paced work environment with multiple concurrent, inter-related subprojects, as well as shifting and competing priorities. Leads technical discussions and report project status to stakeholders and collaborators.
  
Ability to skillfully and routinely create, cultivate, and leverage cross-group, cross-departmental (e.g., I.S.), and external (e.g., vendor) relationships where appropriate with a big picture view of DFCI benefit.
  
Possesses a high-level of empathy, kindness, and a mindset of inclusive, diverse thinking.
  
Demonstrates self-awareness, professionalism, agility and flexibility, a strong work ethic, appropriate humility, and the ability to lead through challenging situations.
  
Ability to think and act consistently with a broader “we” mentality, i.e., what’s best for the group as a whole vs. self and “my team”.
  
  
At Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, we work every day to create an innovative, caring, and inclusive environment where every patient, family, and staff member feels they belong. As relentless as we are in our mission to reduce the burden of cancer for all, we are equally committed to diversifying our faculty and staff. Cancer knows no boundaries and when it comes to hiring the most dedicated and diverse professionals, neither do we. If working in this kind of organization inspires you, we encourage you to apply.
  
  
Dana-Farber Cancer Institute is an equal opportunity employer and affirms the right of every qualified applicant to receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, sexual orientation, genetic information, disability, age, ancestry, military service, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law.
